description: Relive the glory of the Victorian age and enjoy the comforts of a more civilized time in our reinterpretation of a Victorian drawing room. Every afternoon and evening, our gracious hosts and hostesses dress to the Victorian theme, hand-serving  selections from our tea collection along with light snacks.
landmark: Look for the Victorian Style Lamp post.

name: Wah-Nah-Shotskee
description: Wet your whistle with a highly interactive game of personal truth and a chance to explore your daring side!. Lounge through the afternoon activities, or turn up with a shot skee.
landmark: LED Palm Trees, and lit wah-nah-shotskee sign.

name: Dye With Dignity
description: Dye With Dignity provides silk scarves and all necessary elements to create your own tie dye work of art on playa! On none dye days we provide snow cones and frozen margaritas.
landmark: Two large signs that say Dye With Dignity

name: Lucid Dream Hideout
description: A afternoon coffee bar to get the best coffee on the Playa!  We have a live DJ, wi-fi and shade to sit and chill to share your amazing burner stories.
landmark: Lucid Dream Hideout Banner

name: Rustic WerQ Ranch
description: Rustic WerQ Ranch is a camp full of people who make the many art projects happen on playa.  Drop by for a whiskey or a water.
landmark: White 25' cargo trailer 'Rustic Ranch'

name: Agaric argileh
description: Art Support Camp for Agaric argileh
landmark: Lotus bell tent with jellyfish ground lights.

name: Sparkle Love
description: Come experience a little Sparkle Love in our beautiful oasis Tiki lounge, enjoy a cold drink and make new friends. We are a colorful and eclectic crew of sex positive, queer friendly, Sparkle Lovers and Burning Man family with an international flair. Cold drinks, hot friends, sexy games, groovy beats, rainbow colors all around.
landmark: Canopies covered in bright pink and blue fabrics

name: Counter Culture
description: We are the BRC Census support camp. Drop by anytime to learn about what Census does and the information we have to share.
landmark: Counter Culture and Kitten Theater banners

name: Perky Parts
description: A random group of people who share the same motto: "We can't pace ourselves" and believe the only way of knowing is to go and find out!
landmark: 2x6ft Perky Parts sign at shade entrance

name: There Ain't No Virgin Mary
description: Cowboy themed bar and burlesque show
landmark: Split Rail Fence and Salon Doors

name: Ocean Beach
description:
Drop anchor at one of the playa's exquisite beachfront properties and nurture body and soul with our beach yoga, workshops, and games. Or stop by for a drink at our beach bar, serving smoothies in the morning and beach cocktails in the afternoon (M-S, 9a-6p).

Our beach area includes 2 kiddie rides for the young of age and mind. 

Sing along with Jimmy Buffett on Tuesday and devour a delicious cheeseburger in paradise. Come try our signature lobster pizza during our Wednesday late afternoon Pizza Palooza. Party with us on Friday because ... TGIF. 

We are a group of beach lovers operating a 100% green camp. If this all sounds like you, let us know. We accept newbies and are willing to help them adjust to the playa.
landmark: Neon Ocean Beach sign and the large life guard

name: Cheat Codes
description: Cheat Codes is a bespoke analog arcade offering games of wit and dexterity 24/7. Come play with us!
landmark: Cheat Codes sign, some other bright blinky lights.

name: CocoDisco
description:
CocoDisco is your playa home for....well...coconuts and disco. Stop by Tuesday afternoon for a cold coconut, tropical vibes, and an epic dance party. Or Wednesday for a full dim sum brunch.

The CocoDisco lounge is also open 24/7 when you just need a little time at the beach.
landmark: Disco ball in a coconut!

name: La Ville Bohème
description: La Ville Bohème is a haven for the artistically inclined, seeker of depth, eccentric soul. Calling all musicians and lovers of music to come play, dance in the Bohemian living room.
landmark: Colourful flags hanging above the living room.

name: VW Bus Camp
description: Driving out to Curiouser & Curiouser in an old VW Bus or other unique camper? Make sure to change out your leaky fuel lines, check your tires, carry a fire extinguisher and pack lots and lots of spare parts. So, you are welcome to camp with us, a fine Burning Man theme camp which has been placed on the Playa since 1998. Join us and learn about life in Black Rock City and participate in Camp's many interactive projects. This is a wonderful opportunity for you to bring out your own project and teach us something new. Welcome home and see you soon, in the dust!
landmark: Lots of old VW Campers

name: Census
description: The Census has been collecting information about the population of Black Rock City since 2002. The results of the Census from previous years will be on display at the Census Lab on playa and published in the Population Analysis Report on our website at http://blackrockcitycensus.org
landmark: pink Census signs and colorful data displays

name: DO THE ROBOT DANCE
description: Our camp "DO THE ROBOT DANCE" is an art support camp for "DANCING BALLOON ROBOT" honoraria art project. We are open to all if you are interested and can be helpful in improving the project, or our experience and happiness at burning man
landmark: the silver balloons

name: PO9
description:
We connect you with the world, we are the original way to get USPS mail to the playa, as we have been for decades.  We do: USPS to the Playa, Playa to any (international) address with a unique artistic postmark!  (US postage encouraged/required), and friendly (and not-so-friendly) posties: stand in line, and fill out your form... in triplicate... with crayon.

On-playa updates: http://twitter.com/brcpo9
landmark: brcpo9 sign

name: Mule Town
description: The home of hugely inventive, yet modestly sized mutant vehicles. MuleTown welcomes you to stop by anytime for engaging MV dialog or Nomadic lifestyle talk; with a Wednesday Q&A session on what it takes to maintain a comfortable lifestyle while creating the freedom you've been seeking.
landmark: Lrg Tri-Mule Sign w/ a gold flag on top, lights up

name: Groovy Sexy Funky
description: Where you can come climb up to catch a sunset view of the playa from our dome. Stay and play with our aerialists, acrobats, and fire/flow spinners, and get your virgin burner cherry-popped! We've got a BIG surprise for you if you're feeling too hot... come shine under our disco ball. Let's DANCE!
landmark: aerial rig, climbing dome, Groovy Sexy Funky sign

name: Enchanted Booty Forest
description: The Enchanted Booty Forest is the gathering point for a worldwide collection of artists, thinkers, media creators, scientists, healers, teachers, jokers, professionals, and other amazing and humble humans. Our aim is to cultivate our community, and through collective creation and engagement, share our values of growth, connection, and learning.
landmark: Enchanted Booty Forest Sign\4 illuminated windows

name: Black Rock City Welding & Repair
description: Welding, repair, adjustment and general tinkering help. Come on over to use our tools to repair your stuff or get our help repairing what's broke.  We repair bikes and all sorts of other things.  Enjoy an adult beverage at Crowbar our shaded walk up and sit down Bar.
landmark: 4 signs saying CrowBar or BRC Welding & Repair

name: Ski Patrol
description: Ski Patrol is an Art Support Camp the has been creating art for the playa annually since 2015.
landmark: shaded front porch covering chaise lounge chairs

name: Pigmalions
description: Pigmalions offers Bloody Marys and bacon from 11ish until we run out. Join us in our Pig Pen to enjoy the vibes as we offer you the best in service at our award winning bar! Play with the pigs while you wait for your treats. Our 13 ingredient Bloody Mary recipe is sure to please! (Only 12 ingredients if you want a virgin.)
landmark: Pink camp flag, Pigmalion banner, & sexy dancers!

name: Pyramid Portal
description: Experience the vibrant atmosphere of the pyramids as we come together to craft a sanctuary for all. Join us for an enchanting journey filled with sound healing, enriching conversations, ecstatic dance, and captivating ritual theater performances. Your presence is called up to add magic of our temple.
landmark: 1 Large Pyramid Lit @ Night

name: Gallavant
description: Ahoy from the Pirates of the Playa (infamous creators of the oldest Mutant Vehicle USS Nevada)…look for us "Gallavanting" around the playa spreading fun and adventure and hop a ride with us! !   Our mighty USS Nevada will be doing 2+ tours around playa daily from our home port so come visit us, enjoy our signature grogs concocted with our homemade distilled rum in an awesome full-fledged pirate bar, The ArrghBar. pARTicipate in our 2+ daily theme parties 10am and 2pm, come get your drink on, play games, and then relax in our Pirates Den – an amazing chill space with couches. Visit our Wayward Wenches Bazaar, because we got what you forgot. Come party with us....It's sure to be an adventure.
landmark: Large Pier Sign with Gallavant across the top

name: La Calaca Village
description: La Calaca Village offers theme camps, art car support and artist support on playa. We pride ourselves on being makers, teachers and healers . Come for the healing, stay for the hedonism! Spiritual healers, yogis and massage artists await you in our Healing Plaza. Wanna help build and work on a big art car? Visit the "Imagination Station Piazza" featuring different activities and gatherings daily!
landmark: Giant Domes and La Calaca Village Signs

name: ILLUMINALIA
description: Come by in the early morning or afternoon on weekdays for refreshments and flow lessons. See our fire performance at 7pm on Tuesday and Thursday!
landmark: Illuminalia banner/patio, burn yard stage area

name: Fjörgyn's Lair
description:
The Viking Longboat was a potent symbol of life, livelihood, one's journey through life, the afterlife, and was used by the Norse for transport, in trade, in warfare, and as a burial vessel for centuries.
Fjorgyn is a personification of earth in Norse mythology, and the mother of the thunder god Thor, the son of Odin.

At our camp will be the Nudeaoke (Nude Karaoke) stage, we're not just about pushing boundaries; we're about breaking them down entirely. Imagine a space where participants confront not just one, but two of the most common fears: public speaking/singing and nudity, all in one transformative experience.
In the face of such bravery and liberation, what else on the playa could possibly hold fear?
landmark: White work truck bed, turned into fuel trailer

name: Camp Zoombox
description: A giant boombox and some rad people
landmark: Giant boombox

name: I Love Elephants
description: Join us at the "I Love Elephants" camp to celebrate the majesty and wisdom of elephants. Our passion spans from the spiritual essence of Ganesh to the communal spirit of elephant herds. Immerse yourself in an projection experience of Samskara, the Android Jones masterpiece! Dive into daily yoga, sound baths, music, and enlightening talks. Unleash your creativity in the Yaari Tent of Glow, painting laser-cut elephants or exploring body art. Our focus is unconventional, but it underscores a vital lesson: elephants, in their unique compassion, teach us about love and the necessity of community. Engage with informative panels, meet dedicated elephant activists, and embrace the call to action. Be part of a movement for change. Join us at Burning Man for an unforgettable experience.
landmark: Light sticks projecting 40 feet into the air

name: Black Rock Labs The Expanse
description: Black Rock Labs is a Civic Support camp focused on testing/scaling/messaging climate smart regenerative technologies at Black Rock City and the Regionals. Black Rock Labs hosts a daily  1-hour Sustainability Talk Series at 2 pm and a Playa-wide tour on the Abraxas art car at 4 pm  on Thursday to view BRC's expanding deployment of renewables and regenerative climate smart activities.
landmark: Large white banners with Black Rock Labs symbol

name: Pariah Express Camp
description: Home of the Pariah Express Mutant Vehicle , a large double decked people mover open to any and all.  we start and end our day here
landmark: 8 multi colored flags 30 feet in the air on an MV

name: Sin City Village
description: Come by and pose with our popular "Welcome to Sin City" sign. We'd love for you to join us for a little creature comfort during our scheduled pamper services days. We offer sunscreen application, massages, manicures and more at various times. If you come by during our Souvenir Photo Creation events our photographers will take the ultimate souvenir photo with our custom man backdrop ad email it to you after the burn.
landmark: "Welcome to Sin City" sign

name: Taco Tuesday
description: Organic Study No. 4 Camp - Fuerte Art House
landmark: 16' tall "tepee" style shade structure

name: Snacklandia
description: A Butt Bounce? Or a bag of Zapp's New Orleans Kettle Style Voodoo Chips? Step into Snacklandia, where every spin yields a surprise and every bite sparks an adventure. Embark on a journey through wild flavors, engaging workshops, and a vibrant community that revels in the extraordinary. Here, taste knows no boundaries, and Burning Man transforms into a playground for the curious and the epicurean. We're crafting two giant spinning wheels brimming with wild and unexpected flavors, elevating the Snacklandia experience to new heights of surprise and delight. Our menu, ever-evolving, draws inspiration from the diverse cultural backgrounds of our campmates each year. Get ready for a taste adventure that changes daily and annually, reflecting the rich tapestry of our community's culinary heritage!
landmark: Snacklandia Sign

name: Portal to the New Earth
description: Art support camp for the 1:44 Tri-Sky Portal. We host New Earth Visioning meetings everyday at noon from Tuesday to Saturday
landmark: Portal to the New Earth banners

name: Yellow Bike Project
description: The mission of the Yellow Bike Project (YBP) is to oversee the build, release, maintenance, and collection of Yellow Bikes on playa to foster community participation in the goal of sustainable transportation within Black Rock City and to help reduce the number of abandoned bikes. Yellow Bikes are meant to be used for point to point transportation and are free for anyone to use. Yellow Bikes are not meant to be locked up or decorated.
landmark: Semi-trailers at 5:30/A

name: Dusty Minds
description: Dusty Minds is a collective group of imaginations born out of the love and curiosity discovered in the desert, nurtured through the community found there, and sustained by the principals upheld on the playa.
landmark: 24ft flagpole with Dusty Minds brain logo

name: Toxic Disco Clam
description: In the default world, the Toxic Disco Clam is a real aquatic creature. It uses its luminous lips to attract passing fish... and then it dazes them with acidic snot. We're pretty much the same: we draw you in with dazzling lights and entertaining activities, we ply you with our intoxicating beverages, and we hope you never leave.
landmark: Toxic Disco Clam Sign hanging on shade structure

name: Camp Fly
description: Camp Fly is the home of our insect themed art cars. Swing by our camp to get a ride, or reach out if you would like us to help host your  event. At our camp, we will be offering aerial silks performances and lessons, please come find us! Here is our schedule for the week... Flying Fusion fun: Come learn the basics of free-form fusion partner dance. No experience/partner required. Come get dusty on the dance floor! Tuesday 6:00PM- 7:30PM, Beginner Aerial Silks: Learn the basics of Aerial silks. Come climb towards the sky at Camp Fly! Tuesday 10:00AM-11:00AM, Aerial silks pop up practice: Come join our pop-up show. Bring your own music and create an act for our evening show! Wednesday 10:00AM-12:00PM, Aerial silks pop up show:Come watch an impromptu burner-brewed Aerial silks show! 8:00PM-9:00PM
landmark: Look for our LED light tree and silk dancing rig.

name: Dusty Rhino Camp
description: The Dusty Rhino art car is a fire breathing, thumping, mobile party that brings people together through art, fire and electronic music. We provide enthusiastic participants with a unique interactive experience that alters their notions of what is possible.
landmark: Dusty Rhino Art Car or LED Mini Rhino

name: The Pit
description: The Pit, DMV volunteer camp.
landmark: big silver tarp shade structure.

name: Hug cabana camp
landmark: Big pink rabbit

name: NoseTradamus
description: Step off the dusty paths of Black Rock City and into Noseremony, a transcendent oasis where nose care becomes an immersive ritual. Within this haven, every detail is curated to transform your breathing experience, inviting you on a journey from cleansing to deep sensory awakening. Our ritual begins with a meticulous cleansing, ridding your nostrils of the desert's embrace and preparing you for a voyage of renewal.
landmark: We are not sure yet what our landmark will be

name: AMAZONE
description: AmaZONE Wisdom Camp is inspired by the power of the largest river in the world. We started out as a Brazilian camp and, in that way, we honor our South American heritage. We see each of the 10 principles of Burning Man reflected and encapsulated in every water molecule: inclusive, self-reliant, participative, immediate... Like water, like life. We are a hub of people who get together to reinforce our beliefs and share our studies.We like to provide experiences so people can contemplate water and the natural forces that rule existence. We are a tool for awakening. We bring up practices to heal our body and soul and by doing that we heal the whole. Be water, my friend.
landmark: Large blue portal with AmaZONE on it

name: I'm OK, You're OK Corral
description: Stop on by the Corral for a libation in our vintage saloon. We host daily drink specials and welcome critters of all types!
landmark: OK Signs

name: Black Rock City Animal Control
landmark: human-size NASCAR track, complete with stoplight

name: Camp Bean Water
description: Beans, flicking, roasting, steamy dripping love, room for cream – our secret steps to the finest cup of coffee. Bring your brewtiful self over to Camp Bean Water to enjoy a cup and let us show you the full potential of a coffee shop. All cups of coffee our baristas serve-up are made to order and come with positive affirmations. Looking for something to fill your now stimulated colon, our cooks can fry you up mouth-watering arepas. Love and good vibes are abundant in our cafe, so drip on in. We're open every weekday morning. We have special evening events like arepa night and a special sunrise opening
landmark: A small camp with Camp Bean Water big letter sign

name: Placement HQ
landmark: Placement HQ sign

name: The Enclave
description: The Enclave brings those with deep BurningMan roots while providing room for a cast of new tendrils. We are united by a passion for art, design, performance and self-deprecating behavior. The Enclave brings a spicy hot mess of Playastani charm to the 9's of Black Rock by celebrating the civically-minded gifts, we have to offer, in a format that intends to suspend and expand our visitor's expectations
landmark: Warm colored, surreal lanterns and Moroccan tent

name: Le Kafé
description: Enjoy one of the most loving and comfy landing spots on Playa! Monday – Friday mornings we offer the 2nd best cup of organic coffee on playa. Bring your coffee mug! Shaded seating and a large covered lounge, we offer 24/7 comfort, with futons and cushions, shade, tantalizing tunes, and warm smiles and/or hugs (with consent). At night also enjoy a warm fire after rolling in late! Howl with us on top of our container! We are relationship driven, and can't wait to meet you!
landmark: 20' tall, center pole 40' hexagon alluminet tent

name: Magic Lantern Society
description:
The Magic Lantern is a wandering inn, located at the end of all worlds. Sumptuously-appointed with antiques, curiosities, games, and mysterious old books, we are a space created for deeper human connection, and a warm and inviting sanctuary for the weary and curious traveller.

Our centerpiece is our unique Trading Booth, where stories and secrets are the only accepted currency. Anyone can step up to don our shopkeeper's hat—we believe in erasing the boundaries between host and traveller.
landmark: Garlic-shaped canvas tent

name: Camp High Maintenance
description: The Mutant Vehicle support camp for the Bioluminescent Slug. The slug is a whimsical creature that delights in transporting burners around the playa. Our camp offers two delightful lounge areas and a large elevated firepit for morning hang outs.
landmark: Twin 40*40 Aluminet Shades fronting our camp.

name: B.E.D Bureau of Erotic Discourse
description: Welcome to the B.E.D Bureau of Erotic Discourse! Our camp is dedicated to promoting consent culture at Burning Man by ensuring every theme camp has a BEDucator. We believe in the importance of education and empowerment when it comes to fostering a safe and consensual environment on the playa. Our team of passionate volunteers is committed to providing information and resources to help every camp create a respectful and inclusive space for their participants. Join us in our mission to make Burning Man a place where consent is prioritized and respected by all.
landmark: BED feather flags and large BED letters.

name: Extinct Oasis
description: A desert oasis themed bar set in the prehistoric age! Daylight activities include themed cocktails, dancing, and a relaxing misted atmosphere. Bring your best dinosaur costume or impression!
landmark: 12ft palm trees

name: MINSTREL CrAMP
description: MINSTREL CrAMP is a largely acoustic music themed camp and performance space with an acoustic piano, sound system with mic's, amps, monitors etc., a full drum kit, and a variety of available musical instruments. We do daily workshops and performances Mon.– Sat. We're looking for Minstrels, madmen, and makers of tunes who want to perform, or just hang out – Come play!
landmark: 20 foot lighted tower with Purple Gorilla on top

name: Daydream
description:
Welcome to Daydream, where reality takes a vacation and dreams throw the parties! Nestled in  Black Rock City, our sanctuary is all about radical inclusion and self-expression. Get ready to dive into enchanting art installations, mystical workshops, and dance parties that make reality jealous.   And oh boy, our legendary dream parties kick off the day with beats that'll wake up even the sleepiest spirits!

Need a breather from the chaos? Slip into our Dreamers' Lounges for some cool tranquility amidst the madness.

But wait, there's more! Join us for our sunset workshops that'll unleash your creativity. 

Join us in forging radical connections and embracing transformation as we journey together through the wonders of the playa.
landmark: Daydream Lounge and Art Park

name: Playa Info/VRT
description:
NEW LOCATION, look for the Blue "I" in the sky
Providing Oracles, Digital Services, Lost and Found, ASL, Health Permits and BRC Lockout and Towing Services. 
Open 9am-6pm daily with limited services 8am-11am on Sept. 3
landmark: Look for the Blue "I" in the sky next to Ranger HQ

name: FERN
description: FERN Camp is the home to for Rampart staff.
landmark: On A Street right next to the Rampart Medical sta.

name: Gymnasium
description:
Gymnasium celebrates acceptance of everyone in their most natural form, naked.   Come enjoy the freedom of social nudity and take part in some of our recreation events including naked oil wrestling, naked beer mile fun run, yoga, carnival games, the Gym at Gymnasium and gymnastics on a suspended ring.   We hope to see you there!

Our camp is a great mixture of gay and straight burners, men and women of multiple ethnicities and nationalities.  Come by and say hi, experience some of our events, or just take your clothes off and enjoy some shade (it's just about the only area of our camp where the sun doesn't shine).
landmark: Gymnasium signs, wrestling arena, gymnastics ring

name: Sakenoma
hometown: The Bay, NorCal, Where We Park It
description:
Luxury estates for your mannequin children. We have plenty to drink. Come participate and try your hand at animal husbandry while spectating our fish friendly taxidermy and bowling. 

The only Japanese word we know is Bukkake. It's in the sake...
landmark: sake

name: Volunteer Village
description:
We are a department camp for the Volunteer Resource Team
We have a Bar that is open to the public a few days a week.
landmark: Volunteer Village Camp Sign(6:45 & A)  MountinSide

name: POWERHOUSE
landmark: Green Flag with Yellow "Plugs Not Drugs" logo.

name: Waffles & House
description: Delicious Waffles with all your favorite toppings, plus tasty House music for your dancing pleasure. And Friday is the Waffolympics, a syrup licking good time!
landmark: Big yellow/black Waffles & House sign

name: Media Mecca
description: Media Mecca is Black Rock City's home to storytellers, journalists, and media. All media projects must register at Mecca prior to beginning in BRC.
landmark: Orange Mecca flags on top of an outlook deck

name: Deep Playa Simulator
description: Over are the days of having to haul your ass all the way out to the trash fence to enjoy the deep open playa! Now for the first time ever experience the joys and wonders of deep playa from the comfort of the city!
landmark: Orange trash fence, sign with camp name

name: Chop Shop
description: We are the best BRC bicycle repair shop. We have bicycle parts and welding.
landmark: Green Shade Structure. Chop Shop sign on corner.

name: MOOP MAP HQ
description: Home of the Playa Restoration All-Star team (aka Resto), this is where we spring into action, responding to environmental cleanup emergencies and coloring in the MOOP Map in real-time. Interested in volunteering to Leave No Trace with Playa Restoration after the event? Come to Esplanade at 5:30 and hang out with Resto by our Fireside Circle and sign up to leave the playa clean, beautiful, and without a trace.
landmark: Fireside Circle at the corner of 5:30 Esplanade

name: Sunrise Diner
description: The Sunrise Diner is a retro diner serving breakfast, coffee and Elvis to help feed the hungry, the hungover, and the happy-to-be-here burners every morning. Come join us and jam to throwback tunes while waking up right!
landmark: Teal and Pink Awning, Boomerang neon sign

name: MUSE Café
description:
MUSE is a nod, a wink, a slap on the bum. It is a toast to the muse in you and the muse in me. It's booty shaking praise and it's champagne smiles. It is a place where we can embrace both the funky and meaningful in a "come as you are" kinda way. Our goal is to
honor & celebrate the inspiration in every human being. We create a space and curate events that ignite the playful & seductive spirit of the muse. Our mission is to honor the muses among us and within us. To seek, offer, and discover inspiration in both the obvious and the peculiar places. To create a nurturing home on playa, to host our fellow burners, and enrich as many people's burning man experience as much as possible. Come to our cafe hours, burlesque show, or boogie the night away at one of our parties.
landmark: fiery geodesic dome

name: People's Art Congress
description: We are a collection of various artists working in diverse mediums, seeking a range of expression and serendipity. We have interactive art, DIY art, intuitive readings, cuddle spaces, a labyrinth, brain talks, philosophy slams, and welcoming space for various spontaneous activities all day and night.
landmark: 3-6 feet high mushrooms & Mad Hatter in blacklight

name: IN THE DARK
description: "in the Dark" is a meditative space for a deeper understanding of your feelings. We build a completely darkened space without light and each new event explores different ideas through the prism of different feelings. At Burning Man 2024 we are exploring the idea of death.
landmark: Fire place along the street

name: Stranger Things
description: We're an art support camp and if you're looking for us then you just found us.  Art is hopefully near 1:00 and 2600' - follow Esplanade around the clock - same as last year.
landmark: On the RV is a sign that says "Stranger Things"

name: Hack-a-Cola
description: A visit to Hack-a-Cola is a reprieve from the heat empowered by a sampling of a wide variety of unique, handcrafted flavors of soda. Hand us a cup and we'll mix cold carbonated water with one or more of our syrups to make a refreshing soda on the spot. We may even put a scoop of ice cream in your soda to make it a float! We tweak our recipes and invent new flavors throughout the week. Inquisitive visitors can learn how to fulfill their own soda making dreams with the guidance of our knowledgeable, helpful soda jerks. We aim to provide a welcoming space where everyone will feel comfortable to stay a while and enjoy the company under our plentiful shade.
landmark: red shade, brick wall facade, Hack-a-Cola sign

name: Kidsville
description: Burning Man's best place for kids!  Come enjoy our trampolines, playgrounds, kid-friendly treats, and meet other families that burn with people under 18.
landmark: big Kidsville vertical flags that ring our camp

name: Monoceros
description: Art Support Camp for the Monoceros art installation. Stop by if you want to learn more about the project or your are just an inquisitive unicorn.
landmark: Monoceros Unicorn sign

name: The New Barbarians
landmark: New Barbarians Sign and large 38 ft red trailer

name: Santo Cabron
description: Anarquismo bailable para toda la familia
landmark: Horned angel

name: Lost Wages
description: Home to Pancake, Waffles, and El Loco Loco art cars.
landmark: 40' flattop shade structure.

name: Ofosho
description: Good ramen, a great playa moment! Serving the ramen experience on the playa the last 12 years. Doodle or dance to deep house or minimal techno while you wait, noodlessly polaroid yourself or connect with 100s of fellow burners either noodling around or slurping an irresistible bowl of happiness (we have got you covered vegetarians!). Ofosho memorable!
landmark: Large Ofosho sign, swing and ramen station

name: Soft Landing
description: Soft Landing offers a comfortable space to drink tea, hydrate, and rest in our Full Circle Tea House. Soft Landing also presents the Palenque Norte speaker series featuring over 40 visionary talks and stories spanning concepts such as technology, community organization, medicine, art, science, design and ethnobotany.
landmark: Large white circus tent and the 20 baby blue flags

name: Recycle Camp
description: CRUSH IT w/the Recyclonauts at Recycle Camp. Bring us your mesh bag of empty aluminum cans (plz no tin/steel/glass/plastic) & ride the amazing bicycle powered Crushinator!
landmark: 24' dome covered w/ aluminet at the front of camp

name: Treble Makers
description:
Long day on playa? With a daily wine, music, and cheese pairing at sunset, you'll be able to enjoy some of life's most indulgent pleasures. Our artists are grass-fed, our red wine is selected and served by beret-wearing french busboys, and we will show you the difference between cheese and fu**ng fromage.

If you want to get to the next level of indulgence come enjoy the somatic gyrations delivered to your weary core by the one-and-only Buffer Bush. Swing on by and we will help you hit that higher note, we got your back!
landmark: Big red and beige shade - poofer tower at night

name: badlands
description:
Badlands is a live music open jam camp. 
Formed in 2011, we have always had a drum kit (or 3), amps, guitar, bass, keys, and a PA with microphones available for anyone that wants to come by and play. All levels of musicianship (within reason haha) are welcome!! We are open from 1-5 Mon-Fri and oftentimes have random night jams too! We have topless bartenders and bottomless drinks at our bar and a comfy shaded area with games and couches to relax, enjoy music and get out of the sun.
landmark: 2 blue/white badlands flags flying at frontage

name: NOT a CAMP
description: This is NOT a CAMP. If you dig the art piece titled "1986", come to talk to us. We also like presents. And people who are present. We might even have presents.
landmark: Sweet Jesus prayer flags, camp name

name: Mystical Order of Dust andShadows
description: Welcome to our Curiosity Shoppe filled with magical and scientific objects from beyond space, time and imagination. Vials of the Spice Melange from the planet Arrakis share shelves with Elvish Lembas bread and tufts of fur from the legendary luck dragon Falkor. Our Shoppe recognizes no dimensional bounds, but it does hold a mystery waiting to be solved by you, intrepid traveler. Should you unlock its secrets, you will be invited to join our Mystical Order.
landmark: Mystical Order of Dust and Shadows Sign

name: Camp PlayApology
description: You eff up, we fix it! Black Rock City's first "Custom Apology Delivery Service" offers Playa-friendly flowers, Burner-centric cards & singing "SorryGrams" for BRC residents looking to make playAmends. We also have cards for other occasions. Send out a card, relax in our breezy shade structure, or have a shot of artisanal, home-infused vodka at our Sorry Bar. Check Playa Events for info on our "Sorry Soiree," "What The Dilly, Yo!" happy hour & an end-of-week "Hail Bloody Mary" party, plus other daytime workshops and activities.
landmark: 15' spinning PlayApology sign, lit at night

name: Prismaticamp
description: Various artists coming together to offer LED knowledge.
landmark: 16' tall LED dome lit at night

name: BAAAHS Station
description:
We're the home of BAAAHS: the Big-Ass Amazingly Awesome Homosexual Sheep. You might know us as the 40-foot long rolling disco whose entrance, naturally, is through the pulsing pink sphincter in the rear. Day and night, we graze on the playa — laser eyeballs shining, beloved DJs spinning, dancy people flocking.
BAAAHS Station is our central depot where everyone is welcome to kick up your hooves. Come for our daily dance parties, get a view from our four-story watchtower, enjoy a lovely beverage from our friendly bartenders, and meet a homo or two.
We're builders, artists, and techies at heart. Our DJ line-up combines world-famous names with up-and-cumming performers, with a focus on featuring queer artists. Our mission? Shear queer bliss.
landmark: 30' tall glowing art deco tower

name: Jub Jub's Plastic Circus
description: Jub Jub always here to fling those funny hard-to-get drinks, uneasy rest, strange music, weird plays, loud noises, oh-so-friendly grief, bruises, nausea, vertigo i.e. Monkey Business!!!   maybe poo too…
landmark: Banana Peels by Porches under the Monkey Head neon

name: Rootist Lounge
description:
A camp based on the love of celebrating life with beats of sound, the joy of #energy, and the beauty of #spiritual connection with self, and others. A place where acceptance, creativity, and passions flourish. It's a gathering of open-minded and like-minded individuals where friendships surround you. A place to learn, grow, inspire, heal, and release. One lounge, one vibe, one LOVE, one beautiful, and a growing family that is all connected.
With a major focus on cutting-edge energy work, healing sound vibrational therapy incorporating live music, beautiful decor for the senses/art, artists, performers, yoga, workshops, hughealing, ArtCars Art car support, Art project support and so much more.
landmark: Look for the 8ft tall gifting tree

name: Skinny Kitty Teahouse
description: The best big, fat, kitty-loving teahouse on the playa.  Come get some shade, couches and tea, tea, tea 24/7.  If you come at the right time you might catch a performance, a wandering piano player tickling the keys, some aerialists, fire spinners or just some fabulous conversation at the tea bar.
landmark: Big, white saddle-span tent.  You can't miss it.

name: Worst Bar
description: Drink Shit and Die: Worst Bar gifts experiences in the form of beverages/rituals during our scheduled Unhappy Hours. The consensual experiences are not pleasurable in the expected sense and include but are not limited to mild or moderate elements of pain, humiliation, embarrassment, and disgust or combinations thereof.
landmark: Large LED sign with the word WORST

name: Disco Primitive
landmark: Canopy

name: Benevolent Elephant year off
landmark: N/A

name: Always Open
description: Look out for black lights and a big OPEN sign! Come say hello!
landmark: Black Light OPEN sign!

name: NAACB
description: NAACB (National Association for the Advancement of Colored Burners)
landmark: Look up for two 4ft tall colorful NAACB signs

name: Snarky Marquee
description: Like our reader boards stop by and say hi. Have something you want to say put it on our reader boards.
landmark: 4 Marquee or Reader Boards

name: the black hole
description: The Black Hole is the Home of Black Rock City's Gate, Perimeter and Exodus Department, and while we realize it isn't for everybody, it may VERY MUCH be for you. It was for us. If you are down to clown in all black clothes in the middle of the desert in a cloud of dust and car exhaust two miles outside of the best party on earth – then boy howdy have we got an offer for you.
landmark: West of Commissary. sign that says the Black hole

name: Space Punks
landmark: 20 x 20 Stage truss w/aluminet wings

name: Black Rock Roller Disco
description: Every city has a roller skating rink. The Black Rock Roller Disco is the roller skating rink for Blac Rock City. We ae a full service roller rink.  We have the skates, the funky music and we're always a funky good time every time.
landmark: Golden Gate Bridge

name: Kombuchachacha
description: Kombuchachacha is the place to relax, refresh and dance the day away.
landmark: Black and red flags with Kombuchachacha sign

name: Blazing Death Ship
description: Join the legendary Death Ship at its home camp, where an interdimensional Viking feast hall awaits weary travelers.  Join us for  libations and savor slow-cooked pit barbecue at dusk-ish, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, or just ride with us out on playa.
landmark: Death Ship sign and the big, ominous triangle

name: Pickleback Oasis
description: Take a break from the hot sun and stop in for a cold Pickleback. Relax and meet new friends under our shade structure.
landmark: 20x30 w/black wind screen side walls. Lit at night

name: HOT SHOTS
description: Our camp is a tiny haven for those looking to immerse themselves in the beauty of the desert, fostering moments of connection and self-discovery via our golden hour photo shoots and late night treats. Join us at HOT SHOTS, where each sunset marks not just the end of a day, but the beginning of an unforgettable experience.
landmark: Totem pole with 'HOT SHOTS' sign

name: Camp Lil' Bit
description: Hands Down, the best Hobby Horse in BRC.  Get your jockey on, place your bets, and enjoy Jus' A Lil' Bit of fun. Our horses are off the bit and our craft cocktails will get you through the home stretch.
landmark: Gold flags, rust colored horse trailer

name: Land of Monkey
description:
Land of Monkey is a multicultural, international LGBTQ+ camp that welcomes diversity and that promotes human evolution through body (ice-cold lemonade, coffee & cocoa), mind (deep talks on important subjects) and soul (yoga, breath work & meditation). 
At Land of Monkey we believe that we are not yet fully human and must evolve. Humanity is a process of becoming, which we all practice throughout our lives. Learning to listen, to be patient, to understand, to forgive and to be more merciful: these are among the skills we practice in becoming more human.
We also evolve through events we share with our fellow Burners. We evolve through openness and arms held wide open to the friends we have not yet met. 
We evolve by being the best version of ourselves.
landmark: Big banana

name: Hodge Podge
description:
Hodge Podge - Get on up and come on down. All are welcome to twist up, unwind, get down, step up, shake it out. Coffee by day - beats by night. Sometimes also though there's coffee by night and beats by day. Shade and lounge space for resting your feet or playing some games.

When you are here you are family. Come inquire about using our public space during unscheduled time for a class, talk, reading, game or whatever. We'd love to help you float your boat.
landmark: Wooden sign that says "Hodge Podge"

name: Uncle Larry's Misguided Burners
description: We are the Misguided Burners of Uncle Larry! Home of KART Radio on 88.3FM! Taste a home-brew while getting your bicycle or Mutant Vehicle fixed!
landmark: Lit Radio tower with Green Lasers!

name: Suspended Animation
description: Experience full-suspension erotic rope bondage: part kinetic art, part thrill ride, part endorphin rush. Our crew of expert riggers offers bondage and BDSM rides to all (Yes! You too can fly!), workshops for all levels, breathtaking performances, and night time play parties. We also rove the playa and build impromptu bondage sculpture!
landmark: Big black tent with aerialist rig in front

name: Glowskull Asylum Int'l
description: Glowskull Asylum Int'l brings extreme metal radical inclusion to the playa. Are you craving some good headbanging and want to meet exotic misfits from random places all over the world? Our bar, Skullushery, and art car "Castle Glowskull" will be hosting mischief, ultra-violence, and twisted METAL (and other deranged forms of bad music) daily. All varieties of humans welcome!
landmark: line of LED flame lampposts

name: Yes Please
description:
Yes: adv. – Used to express affirmation, agreement, positive affirmation, or consent.
Please: adv. – Give pleasure to or to be pleasing to; give satisfaction.
Yes Please is the answer to every question. Come chill in our calm and revitalizing sanctuary, dance with new friends, and experience our inclusive oasis of sex-positivity, queer empowerment, and love. Be sure to visit our infamous Non-Monogamy Advice Booth.
landmark: Rainbow sigil flag/sign, yellow Advice Booth

name: Halloween Camp
description: Halloween Camp brings out the inner child in all of us BOO-urners, taking us back to the haunts of that special day, where anybody can be anyone. Come knock on our door for some tricks, treats, sips & beats…if you dare!
landmark: Orange trickortreating door or Halloween Camp Sign

name: TRANCEylvania
description: Soup'a Place. Join us in our interactivity nights for a hot mug of traditional romanian soup, shots and fine tunes.
landmark: A wooden lit up gate and a red powerful laser.

name: Jitters & Bitters
description: Jitters and Bitters will be offering the most ok and acceptable cup of cold brew on the playa! Come in the evenings for an espresso martini! Will it have some dust in it? I don't know, probably! come find out!
landmark: String lights from structure to ground near road

name: Camera Obscura Tribe
description:
We invite you to the world of photography - from enrichment of visual experience to technical support and guidance: we do it all! Our camp is home for everyone - with or without cameras, photographers and just artists.  

As a service, we offer professional photography for everything, from playa weddings to personal sessions and public events - just ask!  We have a walk-in photobooth and plan various photo-related workshops.
landmark: Blue gate that resembles a camera, illuminated

name: PALINKA LOUNGE
description: Palinka Lounge offers a welcoming respite for Burners new and old around the globe, we offer a comfortable environment for Burners to take a moment to relax, have a drink, introduce themselves, and learn about what it means to be a burner (or learn about Hungarian burners) gaining from our camp-members Burning Man knowledge. We do this not only through sharing a drink, but also by engaging in activities together such as arts/craft, games or trampoline.
landmark: RED tent, RedWhiteGreen Hungarian flags

name: Latica
description: We are a very diverse camp that will exemplify radical inclusion. This camp will be mostly populated by latinX individuals from Venezuela, Mexico and various hispanic upbringings along with some strong allies.
landmark: Big frontage sign of a cat

name: DeMentha
description: Mojitos, mist & dancing served up with a warm welcome.
landmark: Lit DeMentha sign located at the corner of camp

name: KAIF
description:
Step into the cool ambiance of our air-conditioned, LED-illuminated cozy KAIF lounge, a haven where you can unwind with a refreshing slushy (virgin, or not?) in a crisp waffle cone, complemented by healthy snacks. Join us for a delightful escape designed for your relaxation and pleasure.


We welcome you in our A/C LED-lit lounge where you can enjoy slushy drinks (virgin, or not?) served in waffle cones and healthy snack while relaxing in comfy ambiance.
landmark: "KAIF" camp sign and a tall white inflatable cube

name: Bao Chicka Wow Wow
description:
Visit Bao Chicka Wow Wow to taste our bao (dim sum buns)!

Fill your belly with our fresh and delicious steamed-to-order pork, red-bean, and custard bao.

Hours:
Brunch: 11am - 2pm (MON, TUES, WED)
Far East Night Market:  7pm - 1am (WED)
landmark: "Bao Chicka Wow Wow" sign

name: Nothing Butt Art
description:
We supply the canvas and paint, you supply the cheeks or any other body part. Together, we will create nothing butt art! Complimentary T-shirts provided to participants. No Body Shaming here; bring what you got, and we'll turn it into Art! Woohoo! We also feature body stamp temporary tattoos. Stop by, make some art and get a tramp stamp. 

Sunset Journey Home Table. Share your journey "Home" while enjoying an ice-cold IPA. Our bar table has become a focal point for all to express themselves with marking pens, paint, and pictures for gifting their stories for all who visit the camp.
landmark: Six Foot Tall T-Shirt

name: WrongoWrongo
description: The home of the mutant vehicle Uuna Ahi and your somewhat friendly neighborhood mutant vehicle repair oasis.
landmark: Metal Moai Mutant Vehicle and palm tree sign

name: Brodega
landmark: Brick Facade Corner Store, sign reading BRODEGA

name: Feed tHE ARTists
description: Started in 2007 with Larry Harvey's blessing and support, FTA has fed tens of thousands of artists, musicians, dancers, builders, makers, dabblers, and generally curious wandering travelers. FTA actively models the concept of creating community through the sharing of delicious meals at BRC and all over the world. We are striving to elevate food to an art form, serving as a primary resource for playa food safety, kitchen design, and unforgettable cooking. You never know what we'll be cooking up next - and, whatever it may be, you are invited to prepare it with us and share a meal of some of the finest food ever gifted on the playa!
landmark: Yellow rope lighting & neon Feed the Artists sign

name: Patsy's Hangout
description: Patsy's Hangout is a fabulous lounge in the gayborhood where you can connect with old friends and make new ones while enjoying a refreshing cocktail. Enjoy high-energy tunes, good company and a comfortable space all day, every day. Stop by for our daily recurring activities including: Patsy's lounge, which is always open, Patsy's Classical Morning Brew: Serving coffee with classical chill music every morning 9 AM to 12 Noon and Patsy's Bar: Serving cold beverages, and lots of ice, every day 12 Noon to 7 PM. Participate in our daily special events including our dueling pianos happy hour on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday, Patsy's Closet on Monday, Patsy's Nail Salon on Tuesday, and our Cubs, Otters, and Bears, Oh My! on Thursday. And don't forget to explore Patsy's Parlor while you're here.
landmark: Peaked metal/tarp structure with PATSY'S signage.

name: Bounce Block
description: Welcome to Bounce Block! Come Bounce in our Bounce House culdesac and relax in our shaded couch zone! Spontaneous DJ sets and party vibes Press the dynamite box to see what happens and get a Scooby smooch if your lucky!
landmark: Elmo and Scooby Doo Bounce houses!

name: *D*R*E*A*M*
description: Welcome to *D*R*E*A*M* Immerse yourself in a cloud-like oasis of creativity and serenity. Our camp is a haven for dreamers, artists, and visionaries from around the world. Join us in a space where radical inclusion and artistic expression flourish. Experience immersive art, wellness offerings in our dream cloud. Be part of a community dedicated to personal and planetary growth, embracing the beauty of simplicity. Explore new dimensions with us at Burning Man 2024
landmark: fluffy dream cloud

name: Tequila Bees
description: The Tequila Bees a Hive Like No Other
landmark: The Prominent Tequila Bees Lighted Sign

name: Emergence
description: Find the owl - Unzip the door - Be delighted - Enjoy the AC - Vibe to the music  - Have a popsicle - Smile for your ID - Go lay your ass on the grass and play giant jenga while it prints.
landmark: Big owl sign

name: Tour de Chance
description: Êtes-vous chanceux? Ride the the Playa's largest French-themed bicycle-powered carnival game for marvelous prizes! But vélo beware, some are risqué.
landmark: "Tour De Chance" sign & 10ft tall roulette wheel

name: Honest MiSteak
description: Honest MiSteak is a participatory day camp that loves to feed people and have fun! We eat meat! We run events from Monday through Friday, including Mystery Meat Monday, TuTu Taco Tuesday, and signature Tri-Tip BBQ on Wednesday! Or just stop by to chill under our large, public shade structure with sofa and chairs and/or grab a drink from our neighbors at Caffeine Oasis or the Petting Zoo bar.
landmark: Bali flags and neighbors to Petting Zoo!

name: Trotsea
description: Live Birds love you!
landmark: Flagpole wrapped in green LEDs, with tie dye flag

name: Camp Lip Service
description: Camp Lip Service - Bad Advice dispensed morning to night.  We take the fun out of dysfunction.
landmark: A 14 foot long Lip Service sign atop at tower.

name: Dymaxion
landmark: Large two story silver dome with dymaxion sign

name: Swag of Burning Man
landmark: "Swag of Burning Man" Sign

name: Bad Boy's Discover Your Kinks
description: Introductions to BDSM for the Vanilla but Curious and those new to the Kink community
landmark: 12x20 foot white Dungeon with large Bad Boy sign

name: AquaZone Intentional Water Bar
description: Every Day – Intention infused water tastings by your friendly Watertenders, plus! Nail Polish Stations, Tarot, Conversation, Surrogate Playa Parent/Friend Counselor, 24 hour Hydration Refill Station and self-serve waters of intention. Our bottles of various still and bubbly waters each have a positive word inscribed on them. These bottles infuse the water they contain with the specific energy that each word evokes. Our Watertenders guide you through the AquaZone Intentional Water Bar ritual of choosing your intention for the moment. You decide!
landmark: Structure draped in billowy fabric in aqua hues

name: Burner Brown
description: Great music, Great Mead, party games, dancing, and general shenanigans. We make janky look good!
landmark: Large colorful flags, BurnerBrown sign

name: Shitty Wood
description: We (sometimes) have wood. We burn. Established 2007.
landmark: Minimalist conduit shade structure with shirts

name: Camp Little Bitty
description: Burner Express rider (or friend of one)?  Use our camp as the luxury bus stop option!  Shade, drinks, luggage storage, luggage help, and lots of informed campmates are here to help you on your journey (or wait for your friend!).
landmark: Blue and yellow Camp Little Bitty Bus Stop sign

name: The Petting Zoo
description: Come celebrate the Petting Zoo turning 21 this year! We're open ~11am to sundown daily - hosting our 2nd annual big wheel horse dildo jousting tournament of champions daily 3-5pm. Come enjoy all the free-of-forced-participation-games iced alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks you can manage. Bring your government issued ID - 21+ only!!
landmark: Zebra striped banners and four 20' led light poles

name: Drawn Inn
description: Drawn Inn is a studio space and lounge where you are both the artist, and the art. Come flex those artistic muscles at our Figure Drawing classes and even try your hand at being one of our models! We will have open studio hours. And, themed events where we offer whimsical props, body paint and creative atmosphere to help you become your most inspired self.
landmark: Bell tents with amber light and flowy fabric

name: Casa de la Rumba
description:
The most magical prohibition era Casino where you can come and try our whimsical cocktails while trying your luck at our roulette or Blackjack table all under our glorious circus tent.

Come get some rumba to our Casa. Celebrate sharing, life, and try your luck in our little casino. You can come and bet whatever you have on you and we will match it up.
landmark: Big red CASINO letter with light bulbs

name: Pleasant Camp
description: A pleasant place to be.
landmark: Pleasant Camp sign next to our shaded lounge

name: Down Low Club
description: Host of annual LGBTQ+ Meet & Greet on Monday night since 2012, Little Black Dress Party on Tuesday evening and "Escape From Shady Pines" Golden Girls-themed brunch on Thursday. Also, since 2009, hosting the 24/7 interactivity in our Down Low Club tent, providing a discreet, enclosed and air-conditioned space for erotic play between consenting 18+ adult men & male-identified individuals.
landmark: Nite lighted DOWN LOW CLUB sign & GAY PRIDE banner

name: You're Doing Great
landmark: blue rope labyrinth, You're Doing Great banner

name: Argonauts
description: Cherish the uncertain, challenge fear, welcome the odd, and seek thyself!  The Argonauts bring a unique and infectious spirit which we share across the playa and in conjunction with reenergizing camp activities including our high-noon ArgoDogs and ArgoShine-enhanced induction ceremonies.  Besides our Argonaut spirit and noontime hot dogs, our gifts include Argonaut dust, sun & fashion bandanas, temporary Argonaut tattoos, and spiritually-assigned individual Quests for each newly inducted Argonaut for the coming year.
landmark: Argonaut flags and beached hull of our Argo ship

name: Cronos Camp
description:
WE ARE CRONOS CAMP
WE ARE A FAMILY  a group of BEST FRIENDS, Sisters, Brothers, Mothers, Fathers, Wives and Husbands  
from different part of the world with different cultures and believes that come together to create something magical.
landmark: The one with the 3 flags, Crono, Mexico, Argentina

name: Astral Lab
description:
Lose yourself in a reverie of music. An intimate sound camp for people who like good, unique music to jam out to. 

Feel like taking a break? Come watch forgotten films from the VHS era on a large format screen with high quality sound. Or kick back in our furry, air-conditioned VR lounge and explore some crafted spaces. Or take a seat, have a drink, and discuss the day's explorations in our shaded bar and lounge.
landmark: neon Sonic Dream sign

name: Bike Gods
description: Bike trouble got ya down? Come visit the Bike Gods, where we practice self reliant bike repair 24 hours a day. Our camp features 8 fully equipped workstations and spare parts. We have caring and compassionate bike mechanics to assist you M-F 10am-12pm. Out on the Playa, look for our Bike Gods Taxi Service running yellow tandems and our famous Lanterne Rouge art car.
landmark: neon lighted bicycle over the shade structure

name: Alter Ego
description: Camp ALTER EGO creates experiences through art that challenge and expand one's sense of self.
landmark: camps sign on top of social structure ALTER EGO

name: Disco Roboto
description: Gratitude Love and Fun. We are a group of healers, dancers, friends, artists, creatives and foodies. Deep playa and camp dancing on Disco Roboto; Iron Giants disco floor. Morning Healing yoga. Sunset trips to deep playa and a Friday Gratitude Shabbat circle.
landmark: Iron Giant Mutant Vehicle

name: Burner Dojo
description: Burner Dojo is a home for sharing and learning a variety of martial arts styles on the playa, most notably Quantum Martial Arts from San Francisco/Seattle/Portland. We also offer daily classes in meditation, yoga, and even Kids Karate! Pinnacle events include a Kumite Battle and board breaking bonanza. Enter through the Torii Gate, kick off your shoes, wander through our Zen rock garden, share a cup of tea, and get in touch with the peaceful warrior within.
landmark: redwood Torii Gate (Japanese temple/garden gate)

name: Never Sleep Again
description: Electronic music and games, inspired by Berlin clubs and park parties. Our intimately designed dance floor surrounded by individually themed chill-spaces with beds, couches, and pillows invites you to lounge with us, dance, have a cold drink, play a game, or do all of the above at the same time. We are an international bunch of dreamers and doers and want to meet you!
landmark: large 8-feet wide multi-faced logo/infinity mirror

name: Equal and Opposite Camp
description: Immerse yourself in the ancient wisdom of the I-Ching, considered by many as both the first, and the best, guide to personal development. In our space, we expertly guide you through the very same Taoist teachings that have guided wise souls for centuries. Participants will be provided with all necessary materials to continue this transformative practice beyond the playa, including coins for throwing, and a copy of our specially crafted guide, "Changes." Learn to become "like water," adaptable yet potent. The secrets of balance and harmony await you.
landmark: yin-yang symbols all over the place

name: The Love Collective
description:
Made up of many diverse humans, under the banner of Love.
We gather together as community, growing and expanding our hearts.
We are creators of deep soul friendships and love filled experiences.
landmark: Red Heart Beacon Tower and Colorful Shade Canopy

name: Hello Mom!
description: Come celebrate the motherly figure in your life, whoever that may be! We provide stationary, stamps, and polaroid pictures to help you write a letter home to Mom, which we then mail from the BRC post office. We serve Mom's apple pie from our cozy living room to snack on while you write. Or, if writing isn't your thing, stop by for a bit of motherly advice or even just a shoulder to cry (or celebrate) on. We love moms and motherly figures of all types!
landmark: Huge "HELLO MOM!" sign in black letters.

name: Cotton Candy Vibes
description: We are a camp of light-hearted, whimsical burners committed to delivering maximum childhood nostalgia to BRC through the time-honored medium of cotton candy served on a variety of delicious cookies, pretzels, or twizzlers.  Enjoy your cotton-candy treats in our fluffy lounge space, protected from the elements and basking in excellent vibes.
landmark: Cotton candy vibe sign at the front of our camp

name: Videogasm
description: Black Rock City's Playa Theater since 1998! Nightly video screenings on our 20' screen. Get your morning coffee at our Slurping Sloth Cafe. Body painting every afternoon in our shade structure. Play with our curious oversized games. Check out our Sleepy Pickle Bar for one of our daily themed "Drink Me!" happy hour specials. You Pick it Double Feature chosen by the citizens of BRC (Come by and cast your vote.) Play with our giant hanging caterpillar or take your picture in front of our huge inflatable rodent, Rizzo! Compete in one of our live Game/Talent Shows or walk our red carpet and talk to fellow filmmakers and content creators. Home of The Black Rock City Film Festival. Live Rocky Horror Picture Show on Friday night! Contact us to show your original film on our twenty foot screen.
landmark: Videogasm Lighted Theater Marque

name: Altitude Lounge
description: Come lounge on our tower overlooking the playa and see what you helped create while enjoying our down-tempo beats at sunset!
landmark: tall tower with 3 levels of lounges

name: Black Rock Yacht Club
landmark: Orange wind sock, Red BRYC banners on tall masts

name: Boots & Cats
description:
Join us for afternoon kom"boot"cha and dance yourself clean on our life-size cat play house, Catopia. You won't want to miss this view! 

For our creative cats, decorate your boots and make pasties (we'll provide DIY supplies). On Wednesday, we honor all boobs in a Boobs & Cats kombucha party, aka "Titty Takeover".

Missing your cat or furry friend at home? Write them a message and we'll mail it after the burn!
landmark: Two-story white deck & "Boots & Cats" sign

name: HeckleBerries
description: Who doesn't come to the playa to enjoy getting heckled on your bike then stumble into a party for fresh berries and dust storm shots? The HeckleBerries offer the unique experience of sick burns, sweet berries,  shots that offer a consensual face slap, and of course rude babes.
landmark: Heckleberry flag or neon heckleberries sign

name: Lollypopolus
description: Lollypopolus is a Theme camp focused on self care, volunteer and medical support, disabilities support (deaf, blind, immobile), and general all around silly fun. Organization and commitment are the core of this camp.
landmark: Twin Tiki Torches and large red Pharmacy sign

name: Homebrew 4A Homebrew
description: We are a daytime bar with cold home brewed beverages, games and a friendly welcoming atmosphere. Enjoy a cold beer (incl. non-alcoholic), cider, mead or soda served daily from 10am until after dark. We have a pool table and daily events including our Playa famous pickle party! Bring your keg and we will refrigerate and tap it, or bring a bottle to share.
landmark: Beer mugs sign, large open shade and pink dinosaur

name: Camp Scone Fucker
description: Come get Sconed with us. 10 unique flavors to try throughout the week and ice cold tea to wash it down. All while grooving to our camp DJs Disco, House, and Lo-Fi beats.
landmark: Scone Fuckers sign and trampoline

name: The Sweet Spot
description:
The Sweet Spot is an enchanting, safe, and sacred space to explore our vulnerability and humanity through movement practices, spirituality, explorations of human relationships, and play. 

We aim to nurture the body, mind, and spirit of all beings by offering spaces, events, and offerings to meet everybody exactly where they are. 

Enjoy our Self-Care Tent, Come drink some herbal delights at our Elixir Bar, Melt into the Honey Pot Tea House, Play, Be Entertained, and Groove on Our Boogie Floor & Carefully Crafted Food Party Events, OH MY! 

Oh and the fire pit, every night come by and warm your face and heart. 

See you here.
landmark: The Sweet Spot sign, yellow dome, colorful shade

name: Camp BUI
description: The friendliest camp on the playa famous for our front porch. Drop by for a visit and a cold drink. Join us at sundown for a Shot of the Day or Thursday from 2:00 to 4:00pm for our Pineapple Upside Down Cake Thursday event. We are well known for our fine cuisine and repartee.
landmark: Lighted BUI Banner over entrance and corner sign

name: Camp Caribou
description: Come Join us for Breakfast! Tuesday 9am - 10:30am, Thursday 9am - 10:30am. We will be serving Canadian Bacon on a Bun. Let us know what fixings you want? Camp Caribou will be dishing up some tasty temporary tattoos.Whom: The Sexy Mounties  Get ready to Dig IN.
landmark: Black/White Stylized Caribou Flags & fireplace

name: Galactic Rabbit
description: Come enter the Galactic Rabbit hole, gaze at the stars and play a game of checkers or croquet whist enjoying cool shade and great company.
landmark: look for the Giant connect 4

name: Skull Pony
description: A desert goddess led band of outlaws cast asunder from other theme camps and located at the iconic big red horse trailer, we are the preppers of the playa with an oasis of emergency party supplies and a THERMOSTAT. Is the heat of the day or chill of the night killing your buzz? We have MIST and HEAT, bitches!! Dance under the shade and mist of the Embers Lounge or under the stars next to our burn barrels and heaters! We are not a sound camp, but deliver legit tunes and a coffee & hydration bar with WIFI.  Get your groove on in swankadelic comfort during pole dancing, yoga or emergency blacklight neon paint dance parties. Consider us the Eagles of Death Metal of the playa and the place you would want to be if this was your last day of cheating death on Earth!
landmark: Big Red Horse Trailer w/ Skull Pony LED Roof Sign

name: Comfy Cozy Community College
description: Comfy Cozy Community College & VooDoo Lounge is a place for gathering, learning and hijinx. Come take one of our classes, have your palm read, or take a class in dildo fencing. Learning is its own type of VooDoo.
landmark: Giant 6' Buttplug

name: Amour Inn
description: Welcome to Amour Inn, a camp that radiates love in the heart of the Black Rock Desert. Our cozy lounge area, illuminated by twinkling lights, invites you to unwind and connect with others. Together, we celebrate the power of community and sharing. We'll be running contact improvisation classes and serving holistic drinks in a shaded area with enchanted tunes playing in the background. Come visit us at Amour Inn and experience the warmth and connection of our loving community!
landmark: inflated bubble with balls flying in it

name: Coffee and Pasties
description: Coffee and Pasties, bringing organic peculator coffee back the the Playa and of course all the colorful pasties!
landmark: The bright colored bistro tables

name: BEER30
description: Voted Best Beer on the playa 6 years running! Maybe some seltzer or kombucha as well. Shade. Carpet. Seating. Conversation. Scheduled opening M, W, F 11AM-3PM. Other days hours vary.
landmark: BEER30 sign or flags

name: Dolphin day spa
description: A fun camp for people who want to experience as much of Burning Man as Burning Man has to offers. A place to make friends and memories.
landmark: 10x5 banner white with blue dolphin lite at night.

name: Duck Pond
description: Quack quack! Grab your cup (and your ID) and come on down to Duck Pond for cold drinks, bumpin' music, and a wild ride on the infamous Bucking Duck.
landmark: Yellow striped tent, radio tower w/ yellow duck

name: Billy Madison's Tent
description:
Come and experience Billy Madison's Tent!

Fun hangout with drinks, food and karaoke. Come in, make friends, party or just pretend to be Billy Madison for a while.

All are welcome!
landmark: "Billy Madison's Tent" sign and inflatable penguin

name: Yummm
description: Yummm is a camp dedicated to creating Yummmy (non-food) moments for everyone on playa!
landmark: human-sized cat scratching post

name: Kuker Camp
description:
BULGARIAN KUKER Mutant Vehicle is based on the Kukeri Ritual Dancers - a millenia old tradition from Bulgaria, Eastern Europe. Kukeri are people wearing elaborate self-made fur costumes and hideous animalistic masks. Every year at the beginning of spring Kukeri dance to scare away evil spirits and bring joy, happiness and prosperity for the whole village throughout the year. 
In addition to just having the festive and carnival-like appearance, we have infused our ancient MUTANT PET with a modern soul - mixing ancient bagpipe melodies and live drum beats with various electronic music styles.
landmark: The Kukeri furry masks hanging on the canopy poles

name: Fire Conclave Convergence
description: Fire Conclave Convergence is where Fire Performers, Ambient Drummers, and Documentarians who will be performing in the Great Circle will be signing in and receiving procedural information.  Those with a Black Rock passport can also get their passport stamped.
landmark: Fire Conclave sign and photo gallery

name: Shenanigans
description: ICE COLD face masks! Find us when the sun is high and the heat is excessive every day. We will welcome you into our comfy chill space and put a cold mask straight from our ice packed cooler on your face. While the moisturizing ingredients soak into your skin, you're welcome to kick back and enjoy the occasional water spritz, fanning and cup of iced tea.
landmark: Big canvas wall with SHENANIGANS cat logo

name: IHOTT
description: IHOTT (Intergalactic House of Time Travelers) is back with everyone's favorite Waffles from the past, present and future: The Cheesy Pickle! The Whiskey Maple! The Kimchi Peanut Butter! The Strawberry Cream Pie! Will your own creation be the next favorite menu item? Our delicious waffles are traveling across spacetime to a gravitational singularity near you!
landmark: Two white tents beneath a 16ft LED hourglass

name: Camp Sweaty Betty
description:
Friendly neighborhood misting Parlor, Hair Salon and Bike Repair. Stop in and experience an overall cooling sensation from head to foot as you stroll through the mist. Got crunchy hair, feeling a bit beat... Get in early for a partner provided hair wash.  Got a flat, derailleur doesn't work, chain broke, we can fix that also. 
Misting & Bike Repair = Open 11:00 to 4:00.
Bike Repair = DIY Service 10:00 am – 7:00 pm. 
Hair Salon = Open Monday – Thursday 9:00 am – 1:00 pm, Friday 9:00 am – 11:00 am.
landmark: Large sign "Sweaty Betty's Misting Parlor"

name: Cosmica
description: Cosmica is the place where rationals and mystics meet. Dip into the cosmic theater, take a meditative journey through the stars, dance to galactic tunes at our Cosmic Feel party.
landmark: Cosmica sign, floating planets & celestial spheres

name: Pretty Pickle
description: A relaxed and welcoming outpost on the dusty road to nowhere. We have daily afternoon pickle service (Noon to 3 pm). Cold pickles and pickletini shots! We invite passersby to step under our shade, enjoy a refreshing treat, and ride our disco pickle swing! In-the-know visitors may inquire about our playa-famous pickle warmers!
landmark: green and pink flags and "Pretty Pickle" sign

name: Oral Fixation
description: Come one, come all, to fixate on our tantalizing treats. Suckle your way to the pearly gates of bliss. We're also sharing secrets of relational connection and repair and we can also fix your bike if you're in a jam!
landmark: Oral Fixation signage and purple night lighting

name: HHC
description: HHC (formerly Holi High Camp) is rebirthing this year into a kaleidoscopic immersive art experience. Afternoon dance parties accompanied with craft cocktails pair perfectly with making your own kaleidoscope (using MOOP encouraged), painting a friend or partner, painting a parasol, reusable cup or upcycled piece of Playa-essential gear - you'll need to stop by to find out what is on offer ;) As the dance party wraps, join us for a trash fence sunset ride! By the time we convince you to come back to camp, our interactive projection art display will be lit up and ready for you to move and play with art projected on the Playa.
landmark: Brightly colored geodesic dome with a neon flag

name: Sweaty's Last Resort
landmark: 6 tall colorful flags, sweaty's last resort sign

name: Best Butt
description: Camp Best Butt is dedicated to the relentless appreciation and promotion of all things buttocks related. How do you achieve the Best Butt? It's 90% confidence and 10% squats.
landmark: A blue wall with TWERK on it, a 15' peach dome

name: Brand-ur-Ass N More
description:
Brand-Ur-Ass N More will stimulate your entire being -- from your mind to your ass. Bare your butt at the hitchin' post and
get a temporary brand. Do some cock ropin' and belly up to the saloon. Bathe in sound at the evening gong baths. Feel the vibrations of the playa, hear the harmonic frequencies and allow your mind to wander. 
Find something/give something at the Giving Tree, and hitch a ride on our vehicles. Y'all come N play!
landmark: Brand Ur Ass sign above the corral.

name: Camp Slow Your Roll
description: Take inspiration from the sloth and give into the deadly sin. Take a breath, put a pause on your carefully laid out plans and just slow your roll to indulge in all your curiosities. No need to rush even if you are late for an important date! Fall down the rabbit hole and land in a sloth's dream jungle paradise. Come hang with us where everything is, you guessed it, slooowly done. Experience Slow Drunk Yoga (Mon/Wed 11am-12pm) and the Best Worst "Tea" Lounge (Tue/Thu 4:30-7pm) for the best tasting cocktail "teas" on the playa but you have to wait. Play some slow sloth challenges and games while you wait. Who can be LATER than the White Rabbit? Don't fall off but finish last in the Slowest Bike Race. Channel your Chesire Cat smile to take photos in sloth onesies at our Sloth Pun Photo Booth.
landmark: Camp Slow Your Roll flags, Start/Finish race flags

name: Northern Lights
description: Sauna camp from Norway with a lounge litt in the northern lights.
landmark: Sauna cube

name: Practice Camp
description: Practicing since 2012.   Home of the WE ARE, EXQUISITE DORKS & UNIDENTIFIED art pieces.  Come by and interact with them and us!
landmark: Exquisite Dorks & We Are art piece!

name: Yellowstone Burners
description: Step right up to the Yellowstone Burner's Playacebo Experience! We have collected artisanal water from our home area around Yellowstone National Park, infused with the natural powers of this geothermal wonderland. Your Lifetender will guide you through the process of selecting the specific water elements that are meant just for you, creating a customized elixir guaranteed - and backed by research - to give you exactly what you need.
landmark: Brown school bus w/ upper deck, gazebos in front

name: Monkey Business
description: CAMP MONKEY BUSINESS - A place for Primates to Thrive
landmark: Banana tower

name: Dark Heart
description:
Morning community dance followed by small, intimate heart-share pods? Incredible afternoon expansive workshops? Sunset rituals? Fire art? Nightly temple celebrations of intimacy and joy? Yes, yes, yes, yes, yes. 

Start with our Cafe on the Edge, where you can look forward into the mystery and consider what you're going to leave behind. Take the leap into our Dark Temple, where you can plug into the void and remember what all-is-love really feels and looks like and how to bring that heaven to the heart of the playa - you! 

Come drop in with our camp of experienced, international burners who are focused on creating a loving, tight community and flowing the love out to all of you BRC citizens! We love you!
landmark: Tall lighted archway with a "Dark Temple" sign

name: Dicey Side Quests
landmark: light-up 20-sided dice archway

name: Zen as Fuck
description: Welcome to Zen as Fuck, where we blend the integration of Burning Man with the disintegration of Zen philosophy. Our camp is a sanctuary amidst the playa madness, inviting participants to find their inner peace while embracing the vibrant energy of Black Rock City. At Zen as Fuck, we believe that your trip to Burning Man is a journey of self-discovery and transformation. Join us in embracing the principles of radical self-expression and radical self-reliance as we navigate this beautiful chaos together, one mindful moment at a time.
landmark: 6 color-changing vertical lanterns, red trampoline

name: Camp Touch This
description: Camp Touch This is diverse crew of artists, tradespeople, medical professionals, teachers, seasoned Burners and virgins. Come climb our 4 Story Cuddle Puddle, ride the giant Teeter Totter, participate in pixie bike races, or enjoy one of our frozen drinks dance parties. Wet Woody Wednesday starts around 5pm on Wednesday and is not to be missed!
landmark: 4 story scaffolding tower lit up in red

name: Celestial Sideshow
description:
Our camp is made up of lively, youthful, creative, high energy people who love creating unique and transformative experiences for ALL. The camp is designed to promote an exhilarating and transformative experience, with an emphasis on healing practices and performance arts.
To us, healing includes yoga, breath, intimacy, consent, sex & kink and emotional mastery. 
Our performances include acro-yoga, aerial silks, fire spinning, flow toys, juggling, improv + comedy, contact dancing, DJ sets and live music bands.
Our intention goes beyond celebrating our own blissful flow: we aim to share, inspire, educate and include individuals into our community, space and lives. Our BRC camp is an open door invitation to fully integrate into our world, and an open heart to everyone's unique offerings.
landmark: Teal & tan shade sails & colored puzzle floor pads

name: Camp Kühloff
description: Known as the shaded oasis of BRC, everyone is welcome and encouraged to join us during the hottest part of the day. We are here to help you cool-off and reset with an ice-cold lavender towel, good vibes, and a good time.
landmark: 20' x 40' tent with seaweed fabric for walls

name: Baconeers
description: Come visit the Baconeers for BACON, BOOZE and BEATS! 4 huge parties featuring 90's Hip-Hop, break-beats, funk and more. We're cooking up more than 300 pounds of bacon this year, so come get your fix. The new game plaza will have offer some weird and exciting fun. Evening videos, karaoke and periodic bacon sightings!
landmark: Large white obelisk sign with 20' light beacon.

name: New Desert Outpost
description: We are an eclectic, antique outpost for wanderers and those seeking adventure.
landmark: Big wooden sign that says New Desert Outpost

name: Leopard Martini Lounge
description: The LEOPARD MARTINI LOUNGE has been returning since 1998 serving top shelf cocktails in a chill area with wonderful people. The LML BIKE REPAIR SHOP will return this year to support our community. BETTY'S PIE SHOP will continue to serve fresh pie daily in a no rush atmosphere. CLEO the mutant vehicle with continue to roam the playa.
landmark: 26' dome with green parachute & white camo netting

name: Reno Housewives
description: Costuming BRC since 1998. Do you need bridesmaids for your playa wedding, or are looking for the perfect outfit for that party? ASK US -- From frumpy to fabulous, we have you covered.
landmark: Purple gypsy wagon on the street by our boutique.

name: Barbots
description: Barbots mobilize! Where Cyborg Volterra oversees the camp--but you get to push the buttons! Peaking on Thursday at 4 with Alice-In-Robotland main event, our schedule is a collection of day-spa, champagne saber lessons, karaoke, and nooks and crannies with all sorts of curious offerings all week. It'll have you thinking... "Oh yeah I remember these guys." With some new tricks up our sleeves, bring it on over to Barbots 2024!
landmark: Pink BARBOTS blade flags, flat top shades, trampln

name: Bunny Meth Lab
description: BML is a place where all bunnies can exercise their darker side, the place of matted fur, of sharper teeth. We are the bunnies unafraid to carry rabbit feet so we don't lose the keys to our ever deeper and darker rabbit holes. We eat snakes. We devour foxes. We shit chocolate eggs.
landmark: 55 foot long INSANITY letter signage

name: Spice N Vice
description: Spice N Vice offers Bedouin hospitality every day from 10am-6 p.m. Visit us for some hot or cold chai tea. Or join us for one of our workshops. Our comfortable oasis is also the perfect place to take a break from the sun and talk to one of our travel sages for stories about life abroad and travel advice.
landmark: Large red bedouin tent and Spice N Vice flags

name: Camp PtP - The Clock Ship Tere
description: Home port and mutant vehicle support camp for The Clock Ship Tere and her crew who have been sailing the playa regularly since 2010.
