description: We serve gourmet, gluten-free, cinnamon-buttered toasted, peanut-butter and jelly sammiches. All that we ask is for you to provide us with a taste of YOUR flavor. Sing us a song..., tell us a joke..., confess a sin.., the dirtier the better. We also provide a moving cuddle puddle which is all about conscious conversations: opening up, connecting, and sharing what's going on inside oneself.
landmark: Trailer that says "The Great Sammich Ride"

name: Soulshakers
hometown: Queenstown, Auckland, Koh Phangan, Vancouver, NYC, Lagos, Montreal, Christchurch, Bend, Paris, Zurich
description: Our camp is a playground for the free-spirited and a home base for nomads with a thirst for connection and adventure. We're a global tribe of dream-chasers and boundary-pushers, supporting each other to live our best lives; from the peaks of New Zealand to the shores of Thailand, and everywhere in between.  We are solid as a community and feel that the space we hold between us can inspire other Burners to live courageously and less conventionally, as we all aim to do, as a community together. Join us, where every moment is a chance to shake up the soul and sprinkle a little more magic into the burn.
landmark: Green Parachute & Large White Stretch Tent

name: Nakked Zebra Bazaar
description: Nakked Zebra Bazaar is an interactive costuming and outfitting boutique. We have been here for the past 10 years providing burners with unique and stylish outfits that help guide them on their expressive journey through the week. We are open daily from 10 'ish to whenever the twilight calls. We have been growing in size over the years and expect to bring literally a "tonne" of exciting new items for any and all to enjoy.
landmark: Bar Mactropolis and Slackjaws 60ft tower

name: Ready Playa One
description: Ready Playa One - a world that we dream up, believe in, and step curiously into, together in Black Rock City. Each day is an adventure to expand our minds, deepen human connection, and creatively challenge the status quo's of the world that we believe in changing.
landmark: Red Chinese lantern-scape with the Wishing Tree.

name: Metal-Morphosis
description:
Camp Metal-Morphosis provides metal workshop M-F 12-2pm.
Make your own pendant and learn metal work skills at our camp.
Some burners come every year !
landmark: 2 large pyramids with black shade cloth

name: SOTSOAGAWIIE
landmark: Wood Skeleton

name: Pink Ponies
description: Pink Ponies is a diverse collection of kind and welcoming queer campers. We create parties and workshops that help build ties through shared interests and giving without expectations! We pride ourselves on being a great place for all campers to meet and mingle the first Sunday night at our Queeer Homecoming. We also offer daily workshops on a variety of topics close to our community's heart. We celebrate randomness, and anything goes at this weirdly joyful camp. Come build relationships with us that will last a lifetime.
landmark: Two Neon Signs: Horse silhouette and "PINK PONIES"

name: 42 Ramen
description: We know the answer to the ultimate question. If you know it, come and tell us to claim your yummy prize.
landmark: camp sign "42 Ramen" and the maze of hunger.

name: Camp Journeylizm
description: Camp Journeylizm - working camp to help media attending the event
landmark: Camp Journeylizm sign

name: BLACK ROCK ADVENTURES BUS STOP!
description: Providing accessible Playa tours in our adventure rig, with room for about 10 - 16 Burners, leaving from our BUS STOP! art installation on the Playa. Tours go daily at 9am, return you to the BUS STOP! and last about 2hrs. Or meet us at camp prior to the tour! Contact us for info about special tours and pick ups/drop offs. If you are interested in camping with us or driving tours please contact us. To find our camp - look for tall grey feather flags with a big " ! "on them! or check the website for our location closer to the Burn. Come ride with us!
landmark: Grey Feather Flag with a "!" on it

name: Ganesh Camp
description: Ganesh Camp is a lush retreat for dusty desert denizens. Tue-Fri, 1-5, celebrate and beat the heat in the bar in a large, cool desert tent from India or sit by the hypnotic burn barrel at night! Or play volleyball during the day. We have discussion groups (e.g. Stoic philosophy) before the bar opens. We have incarnated this small camp (30 people) since 2003, so we have figured out some infrastructure stuff, including green infrastructure, and are happy to share our knowledge.
landmark: Rajasthani desert tent or lighted "Ganesh" sign

name: Interaction Café
description: We create a space where servers get to create their ideal burning man experience by choosing interactions offered to guests who come by, and guests choose whichever of their offerings tickles their fancy. The result is consensual weird and wonderful experiences, and it's hard to leave our camp, because you never know what might happen next: one moment it's sweet and moving, and the next it's rowdy and hysterical. During self-service hours, guests use menus to engage in interactions between themselves.
landmark: 3 Interaction Café signs.  carport structures.

name: Dusty Nation
description: Dusty Nation is the support camp for Carried By The Wind, a 2024 Honorarium art project.
landmark: large colorful silk banners on bamboo poles

name: Kerosene
description: Black Rock City's premiere laser engraving camp. Solar powered gifts from The Playa
landmark: Camp Kerosene Flag and Scaffolding Tower

name: Pablo's Breakfast Cantina & Spa
description:
Pablo's Breakfast Cantina and Spa
Start your day with breakfast quesadillas, churro pancakes, micheladas, margaritas, spa treatments, and dancing!
landmark: Lit up dome and breakfast dancers

name: MESA
description: A sanctuary where the spirit of community, self-expression, and well-being converge. Our vibrant, shaded oasis offers a diverse array of experiences, from drum circles under starlit skies to sunrise yoga sessions, fireside mezcal nights and even light up mini-golf! With a dedication to Radical Inclusion, we welcome all seekers to our haven of pillows, rugs, and couches, where connections are forged, creativity flourishes, and transformative journeys unfold.
landmark: MESA of stone with steps up to a shaded plateau

name: Metal Detected
description: Calling all metal heads! Open stage to bang out sick tunes. Jam on a rotating stage and meet other musicians. Can't play? Nightly karaoke with backing tracks or live bands. Come metal detect or get metal detected - your choice!
landmark: Metal Detected sign and lighted stage

name: Xpat Alien
description:
Xpat Alien has searched far and wide, through many galaxies, to find a new place to rest our travel weary heads. Earth fits the bill and we have decided to stay.
We bring with us the Crop Circle Cantina, complete with 80' of circular shade, phenomenal DJs spinning epic tunes, a bar top with stripper poles for dancing shenanigans, six 3-butt benches to relax on, Colorado brewed craft beer and root beer on tap, and glasses full of ice filled with our own Alien Punch.
landmark: Silver and blue space ship canopy

name: Bat Haus
description: Art support camp for Am I Better Yet? Come take your photo in our face in a hole photo ops!
landmark: Bat Haus camp sign, purple and black bunting.

name: Feral Cat Motorcycle Club
description: Feral Cat Motorcycle Club is much MUCH more than what meets the eye. Join us if you dare!
landmark: Illuminated "FCMC" led sign

name: Camp Random Pants
landmark: Lage CRP Marquee sign and dome/shade with pants

name: P³ Oasis
description: P³ Oasis is a bar. We serve hard liquor, all day every day, unless nobody feels like working at the moment. But if one of us is awake, one of us is behind the bar, so there you go.
landmark: Palm trees and the flaming sign

name: Planet Bound
description:
Take a look at what you are, versus who believe you are or will be, off planet...

Participating as explorers our campers navigate life's experiences through altered states of transformation. Come by for our scheduled events or spontaneous demonstrations as we wax the philosophical. We have shade and an art car. We (almost) lock burners in our box of animal crackers and strongly encourage them to share cultural conversations! We listen for possibility. It's millennial torture.
landmark: Sin City Sign

name: Cloudy AF
description:
Feel the thunder as we BUFF and FLOG your muscles at Body Werkz, get foggy in the Steamy AF sauna, get wisped away in our evolving sprinkles of frosty bevies -- take flight into the silky skies on our aerial rig - drift away in a dream in our cloud pit!
We are dedicated to raising the hearts, body and souls of the broader Burning Man community through our art, events, and welcoming space. We dew take our fun quite cirrus-ly.
It's never been this cool to throw so much shade!!
landmark: Truck with the clouds and lightning bolt

name: IPOW-Indigenous People of World
hometown: Minneapolis Minnesota "the traditional land of the Dakota people"
description: IPOW-Indigenous People of World wants to bring Indigenous people and allies from around the world together to share their stories and life experiences. The basis of the camp is to create a place to share Indigenous culture and educate all who want to join our camp or events to learn. This camp will be a place to spread different cultures and teachings from all over the world for all that want to learn. We are honored by our Two Spirit community that support and are an integral part of our camp. The camp will be safe space for all Indigenous people for all over the world and allies. It is a place where people can learn and share traditions, foods before and after colonization, games, languages, and music. We will host interactivity events-based food and the gathering of people.
landmark: Flags of different Indigenous Nations

name: KAHVE
description:
KAHVE (meaning café in Turkish) is an Anatolian-inspired camp serving coffee and offering coffee-ground readings daily from 10am-2pm. We are a stylistic sanctuary for wary travelers on their journey throughout the desert. Find shade among plush pillows, pithy lounges and Turkish lanterns. Enjoy the atmosphere and ambient music while admiring the intricate art pieces. Find a safe haven in one of our Bedouin-styled cabanas to relax and enjoy your beverage.

KAHVE is a sanctuary to provide relief from the hustle and bustle of the stimulating playa. Come by anytime you need a place to chill, relax, take a nap.. or briefly lose yourself in an Anatolian dream.
landmark: KAHVE sign, crescent moon flags & 4 lit pillars

name: Vamp Camp
description: Burning since 94, one of the oldest camps on playa. We are mostly battle born burners whom take pride in Nevada. Enjoy playa lore whilst embibbing our signature Vamp Juice or a cup of joe. We have DJ's as well. Stop by, we do bite!
landmark: Camp signage over bar.

name: Camp Ridiculicious
description:
In a pickle? Come get some advice.
Need a pickle? Come get a pickle.
Need a straw? Make you own out of a Pickle!
Need to hug a pickle? Let us help!
Kid Friendly
landmark: Giant Pickle Art/ Shipping contianer/ Camp sign

name: Camp Hapeh
description: Camp Hapeh offers ancestral medicine ceremonies
landmark: Camp Hapeh Sign

name: Funky Monkey Camp
description: Furthering the funky merriment of maniacal monkeys everywhere! Music, PARTIES, fire, and climbing structures!
landmark: Large metal Funky Monkey sign

name: Pancake Playhouse
description: Start your day off with some feel-good jams paired with hot-off-the-griddle pancakes, Monday, Wednesday, Friday 10ish-12ish. And swing by Tuesday and Thursday 3ish-5ish for some disco beats and drinks.
landmark: Large GP with sparkly sign and disco balls!

name: LEGOCroc
description: Home of LEGOCroc (green blocky solar crocodile) and occasional liquid nitrogen freezed ice scream.
landmark: 4 green & yellow flags over beige triangular sails

name: Tac-O-Cat
description:
We are Camp Tac-O-Cat. We cook tacos for the masses and enjoy serving libations and great conversation. We offer shade, a misty breeze and we have a few gear-heads who like to solve problems. Our camp is made up of Burners with deep roots in playa culture and a few we have newly adopted. People will likely be pulled in by heckling when they pass by, and some of the best connections have come from luring our new friends in from the street. We enjoy cracking people out of their comfort zone and immersing them in dusty happiness.

At sunset Monday, Wednesday and Friday we will be offering tacos. Our tacos are playa-famous and have a special grilled tortilla. We have vegetarian options as well.
landmark: Huge tent/shade structure that is green and tan.

name: Camp Akumal
description: The Best Shaved Ice and Rum Cocktails on Playa -- Come for the Concessions, Stay for the Vibes
landmark: The turtle flag

name: Lucid Paradise
description:
Welcome dusty traveler, to Lucid Paradise - a universe born from our collective vision to awaken wonder within the hearts of all who enter. 

As the sun dips below the horizon and the stars ignite the sky, surrender yourself to the magic of our dreamlike wonderland. Behold the illuminated flower garden and a floating blossoming Lantern Wall that casts a spellbinding glow.

Afternoons, come savor our ice-cold che dessert with fruits and jellies, and evenings, come try our late night snacks -- spank musubis, dirty sausages, and more. 

Experience a full sensorial immersion that will leave you breathless and yearning for more.
landmark: Multicolored lantern wall with giant flowers

name: Camp Bird of Paradise
description: Camp Bird of Paradise is the support camp for the mutant vehicle Bird of Paradise. Our artistic theme is a cross between the Bird of Paradise Flower and a Mardi Gras parade float. The Bird of Paradise  provides access out to the playa art installations    We share or transportation with any and all denizens of Black Rock City ... Day and Night.  The BOP has bicycle racks and shade. We are especially cognizant of  those with limited mobility or limited bicycle skills. The Bird of Paradise will be even more artistically appealing this time out with added wow factor while engaging the 2023 theme of Animalia. Our home camp is a shady place to lounge and interact with our eclectic crew of philosophers and physicians out of Mammoth Lakes California.
landmark: a large sign which reads Camp Bird of Paradise

name: Night Visions
landmark: 31' white and gold class C, ford granite ridge RV

name: What Would You Do For A Pickle?
description: Come join us and play the Pickle Game and find out what YOU would do for a pickle! Spankings sold separately.
landmark: Pickle banners and one raised pickle flag

name: Next Year on Luna
description: Next Year on Luna explores the remarkable experience of humanity in the present from complementary perspectives: creating beautiful experiences centered on embodied and visual expression, and provoking expansive thoughts with a salon-style exchange of ideas as we marvel together at the breadth of existence through space and time. Together, we wonder: As the systems around us shape our experiences and our lives, what does it mean to maintain our essential humanity and ultimately to remain ourselves?
landmark: 24' lit geodesic sphere

name: Base Camp
description: Base Camp, home and landing pad for the Metro Chop mutant vehicle.   A working camp where stuff gets done so the Black Rock City can have some fun.
landmark: THE METRO CHOP sign

name: High Desert Cinema
description: Movie Night! 8:00pm Hot Buttered popcorn & Candy! Come hang out!
landmark: Large lit up marquee -  High Desert Cinema

name: Cornstars
description: Everybody wants to be a CORNSTAR!  That means YOU!!!  Stop by for some boozy cereal during our morning breakfast bar (7:30 - 9:00 AM) or a delicious cocktail during our afternoon bar (3:00 - 6:00 PM)!!  We would love to see you!!  Every day, we have Cornshoots, where we can take your picture with an instant film camera.  And, we have plenty of corny outfits and props for you to include in your Cornshoots!!  If you need a picture for this year's Christmas card, we are the camp for you!!!  And, keep an eye out for our BILF (Bar I'd Like to Find) in the deep Playa!  You never know where we might show up!!!
landmark: "SWEET CORN" banners and the "CORNSTARS" sign.

name: Twilight language
landmark: Giant silver box

name: Harmonic Convergence Camp
description: We will not have set hours as a cafe or healing center, but if you stop by, there's a good chance we'll serve you a cappuccino or set up an energy healing.
landmark: Harmonic Convergence Camp sign

name: Camp Desert of Eden
description: Escape the elements and indulge in our garden of earthly delights, inspired by the fiery fate of humanity consumed by passion and pleasure. We will be providing food and nourishment daily at our "Giving Kitchen" including vegan and GF options. For those who are just passing by, stop at our "24 Hour Electrolyte Vanity Bar" where you can refuel your water bottle and freshen up your face.
landmark: Our leafy green wall and "Desert of Eden" sign

name: Sticky Fingers
description:
In the fashion of the old-time traveling medical wagons, we are offering honey-based, miracle elixirs, potions, tonics and liniments. Experience increased physical, emotional and spiritual health and well being! Participants will also be able to fill a 2 oz. honey bear (provided) to bring back to share with their camp. Also offered: Journeys to explore Spirit Animals and Past Lives.  You'll be guided in a traditional shamanic journey to find a spirit animal or guide.  The past life journey revisits old energy and fosters a more full expression of creativity in your present life. 
Hometown: San Francisco
landmark: tall yellow flags with sticky fingers signage

name: Happy Hanuman
description: We are Happy Hanuman, a mutant vehicle support camp. We hail from all over the world to bring our imagination to the Playa in the form of Mutant Vehicles. Our camp also has a few fun things for you to check out including a calligraphy wall! A white wall that can be painted on with water that disappears as it dries. Come by and say hi!
landmark: Light beacon and large Happy Hanuman Logo flag

name: Chatterbox Camp
description: Immerse yourself in the vibrant cacophony of creativity with the Chatterbox Art Car. This rolling masterpiece serves as a mobile platform for spontaneous conversations, fueled by the energy of the playa. Adorned with mesmerizing humans and pulsating with music, the Chatterbox invites participants to engage in dynamic dialogues, forging connections that transcend boundaries. Join the journey aboard this mobile marvel and experience the magic of community, expression, laughter and exploration!
landmark: 30 Ft Dome with Chatterbox Sign

name: SLAYER!
description:
In Black Rock City's relentless heat,
Escape to SLAYER camp's heavy metal retreat.
Where guitars scream and drums empower,
Find solace in our Heavy Metal Happy Hour.
landmark: Two giant skeletons and four black Slayer flags.

name: Paradise Motel
description: Step into a slice of '60s roadside kitsch reimagined for the playa at Paradise Motel, nestled in the heart of the gayborhood. By day, indulge in the best snow cones around—show your junk, cut to the front—and dance to themed beats from Madonna Monday to Diva Thursday. Nighttime unveils a giant Lite Brite, spontaneous speakeasy adventures, and cozy fireside gatherings. We're a flamboyance of queer and ally burners from the Bay Area (and beyond), creating a space where every flamingo can spread their wings and flamingle in true Burning Man style. Interested in joining our flamboyance? Contact us!
landmark: neon Paradise Motel sign with the huge flamingo

name: Lakes on the Playa Village
description: The only lake on the playa, come swim
landmark: Lakefront Bollards lit at night

name: Nyurmok
description: we are an art support camp for the playa installation "Nyurmok 2024".  We bring the gift of art, through visual and microtonal music expression.  Watch out for our frontage art pieces.
landmark: frontage art, human sized pieces

name: Stoop
description:
Stoop serves top-shelf neighborly vibes and creates a community space where everyone belongs. Stoop is my 22' foot converted box-truck and is my full-time, tiny home on wheels. And I bring my home and everything that it has to offer to the Burning Man community. I literally get to go to Burning Man in my living room—and so I want my home to be a gift for others. 

As the name Stoop suggests, it is a traveling porch—a space where neighbors can gather, share stories, and offer each other some wisdom they've learned on their journey. Oh, and fresh pour-over coffees, blueberry pancakes, grilled cheeses, and cocktails.
landmark: Blue/White/Gold converted 22' U-Haul Box truck.

name: " ING "
description:
Welcome to Camp ING, an ephemeral sanctuary conjured into existence annually by a passionate group of friends from all corners of the globe for the last decade... vibrant camp day and night we embrace the ethos of the playa, build-ing, sweat-ing, laugh-ing, play-ing, and bask-ing in the wonder around us. Here we seek those moments that leave us breathless. Camp ING is not just a place but an experience— where radical participation is key. No sherpas. No spectat-ING! come create some dusty memories 

Parties and events posted outside daily: Bar, Slide, Aerial Rig, Shade!
landmark: "ING " totem above camp. Lit all night all week!

name: Black Rock City Passport Office
description: Your adventure awaits! Explore Black Rock City! Record your journey! We provide playa passports you can get stamped at various camps to record your travels. Visit your favorite camps and discover new ones!
landmark: Large Black Rock City Passport Office Sign.

name: WHITE RABBIT ARMY
landmark: Large wood and fabric pair of pink panties

name: Camp Dilly Dally
landmark: Whingdingdilly Flag

name: Galactic Cruzaders
landmark: Galactic Cruzaders Sign/ Colored Sails/ 20x40 tent

name: Helios Hideout
description: Helios is a symbol of rebirth after hard times.  It is a celebration of humanity and an invitation for us all to stand together in the challenging times ahead.
landmark: Decorative wooden doorway with the word Helios

name: Wok Paper Scissors
description: Welcome to Wok Paper Scissors! Here in Sizzle City you battle for your stir fry. Come one, come all to Wok Paper Scissors, serving stir fry on the playa daily. To get your hands on a bowl of our delicious delights, you must first win a game of rock-paper-scissors! Do you have what it takes when noodles are at stake?
landmark: Red Chinese lantern-scape with the Wishing Tree.

name: El Pulpo Magnifico
description: Home base for El Pulpo Magnifico. Come drop in if you would like to look at the beautiful machine up close in the daylight. We do not have any in camp events or program.
landmark: round shade structure in streetside center of camp

name: EYERIS
description: Last year we did EYE EXAMS as CAMP PLEYEA and had so much fun!! This year we decided to switch it up our camp a little and we will be providing IRIS photography!! Come on down and make some crafts while you wait for your turn making a button from an image of your IRIS!
landmark: EYE BALL BALLOONS

name: Camp XUZA
description:
Home of XUZA Art Car
Every Night XUZA will be out on the prowl, seeking out Art installations to host parties and more.
landmark: XUZA Art Car Sign at the end of XUZA's Driveway.

name: Camp ASL Support Services HUB
description: Deaf centralized services for deaf needs/resources/services/faq
landmark: Camp logo

name: Cool Cat Cafe
description: Cool Cat Cafe is all meow all the time.  We are a small family owned and operated theme camp dedicated to serving quality nom noms.  We are here to make your burn meowy af!!
landmark: Sphinx and all the cat stuff

name: Frybread and Friends
landmark: Banner Frybread and Friends

name: Celestial Bodies
description: For 20 years, Celestial Bodies has been your friendly, all inclusive, gay bar on the playa. Brining you fun, daily events in a welcoming environment.
landmark: illuminated rockets, four illuminated white flags

name: The Sultry Lodge
description:
Enter our sanctuary and escape the scorching midday sun!

During the first half of the week allow us to untangle your tresses and braid them into intricate patterns that will turn heads. Feast on a delicious breakfast. And while you are here, relish the playful art of plastic jewelry-making.
Pass by later in the week for Everybody's Birthday Party. It's for you – after all, you are born someday too!
Leave feeling refreshed, empowered, and tantalized, intrigued by the possibilities that await you...

And when the sun sets - return. Join the Sultry Lodge on a journey into the realms of unbridled sensuality, where you can lose yourself in a world of seductive pleasures and uninhibited desire.
landmark: Pavilion with high roof & sign "The Sultry Lodge"

name: Khan You Not Conform
description: Have you ever seen someone on playa who looked like they were the most likely to get caught in a dust storm, or the biggest flirt, or simply the most captivating and inviting individual and wanted to recognize that individual? Well now you can! Introducing playa's first absurd awards camp. Come by and make a custom award for that special someone, vote for award nominees, or just relax and listen to some not shitty music. We are kid friendly too!
landmark: giant Khan You Not Conform sign

name: Avocado "Toast"
description: Come enjoy a slice of avocado toast and a refreshing drink before heading out on the playa!
landmark: the avocado toast sign with a burning man chef

name: Mouse House
description: You know who loves hammocks? Mice love hammocks. If you also love hammocks, you might be a mouse yourself! Come to the Mouse House to get in touch with your inner rodent. Vibes so chill you might find yourself trapped.
landmark: Mouse decor tapestry wall behind the hammocks

name: Camp Shutterbuggy
description: Camp Shutterbuggy is home base for our mobile photo booth art car in the shape of an antique camera. Stop by camp daily from 3 pm onward for your souvenir photo in our photo booth.
landmark: Maharaja Wedding Tent

name: G.M.A.V.
landmark: GMAV lit up on top of trailer

name: Unitopia
description: Nestled in the heart of BRC, Unitopia Camp emerges as a beacon of creativity, inclusivity, and communal harmony, guided by the mystical spirit of the Unicorn. Our ethos revolves around celebrating the unique journey of each individual, fostering deep connections through radical self-expression and inclusivity. Here, amidst the dust and dreams, we create a vibrant tapestry of art, music, workshops, and shared experiences that resonate with the core principles of Burning Man.
landmark: The giant iconic unicorn flag

name: Camp FronkenBears
description:
The FronkenBears are back!! Create your very own Freak of Nature and watch it come alive before your very eyes! 
Assemble your creature from buckets of amputated limbs, bodies and heads to make your perfectly hideous and precious Mini-Me. Great everybody-friendly event even for those new to sewing.
landmark: Large Solar Sign above the camp~ FronkenBears.

name: The Parliament
description: The Parliament and Tim's Place where you can kick back with a negroni while watching live glassblowing and leave with an owl shaped glass vial or pendant.
landmark: TheParliament sign and our wood triangle art

name: SERENDIPITEA
description: SERENDIPITEA, a place where you can expect terrific teas, transformative workshops, titanic parties and tons of absurdity. Come by any time and enjoy a refreshing iced tea cocktail infusion, under the shade in our desert oasis. For your recovery mornings, help yourself to a cup of tea and recharge at our crystal alter. We exist to cultivate experiences full of intimate bonds, insightful breakthroughs, incredible beats, irreverent banter and intoxicating brews. Tues (Day) and Thurs (Night) we host our big parties! Let us dream of evanescence, and linger in the beautiful foolishness of things.
landmark: White camo netting; 2 black Serendipitea flags

name: Exploratorium
description: Calling all explorers! Come curious! Get curiouser! The Exploratorium campus combines the active physical play we love with workshops and dance parties. Explore, learn, play, create, bring your friends, make new ones.
landmark: Stretch tent 'Exploratorium' banner

name: Pier Pressure
description: We are the support camp for the Mutant Vehicle, Pier Pressure!  Look for our floating pier cruising the playa all week long.
landmark: 8ft dock and "Pier Pressure" flag.

name: Twisted
landmark: 12 foot tall neon twisted sign, frontage lights

name: The Miscellaneous Heathens
landmark: Large wooden Beethen and Logo sign

name: Time Bandit!
description: Time Bandit! Mutant Vehicle Support Camp
landmark: burner motor home with murals of space cows & UFOs.

name: HARDLY
landmark: 45 foot tall bright red H beacon

name: Budju Oasis
description: Come for a refreshing drink and fresh fruit stick, stay for our entertaining company and to discover the secret pleasures of what it is to be and know a Budju.
landmark: Budju Oasis sign and pink material screening

name: Hush Hush Pony Barn
description: Hush Hush Pony Barn is exciting to bring two offerings to playa: Our beloved Mutant Vehicle made out of reclaimed fence board (formerly known as the Trash Fence) and our brand new interactivity Gossip & Guillotines. They say you'll lose your head at Burning Man! Come see what the rumor mill and the gallery are all chatting about.
landmark: Guillotine structure by the street

name: Your Dad's Couch: Chill Zone
description: A Conversation Corner
landmark: "Your Dad's Couch" Signs on each side of frontage

name: MAXA
description: A community of wanderers, dreamers, healers, artists and storytellers around the world. sharing friendship as the only currency.
landmark: Flag with our Deer Logo that will be lit at night

name: Playa Name Pawn Shop
description: Welcome to the Playa Name Pawnshop, the one-stop-shop for anyone looking to explore the power of names and how they connect to identity. Expert name-givers are here to guide you through the process and help you find a name that truly reflects your inner playa spirit! Don't have a playa name and want one? Come on down! Are you tired of your playa name? Do you want to embrace a new identity that is full of double entendre and mischief? Look no further!
landmark: Playa Pawn neon sign and giant inflatable pawn

name: Bing
description: Start the day with the rich aromas of freshly brewed coffee from around the world. Camp Bing is an interstellar cafe and hangout where baristas from countless planets unite to share their home planet's quintessential morning ritual - the perfect cup of joe. Come and chill with us.
landmark: A sign says "Bing" with an image of a corgi dog

name: Arbitrarium
description: We build this mutant vehicle on playa every year to share a reminder that you should never lose the child like wonder and imagination, nothing is that serious. "it's all performance Art!" Bill Gilman (Original SOS designer) You can't take a Giant furry yellow submarine sauntering across the playa with rainbow flowers lights and a crew that's wearing matching yellow rain gear bibs in the middle of the desert seriously.
landmark: Yellow  shade structures & "Arbitrarium" sign

name: Playa Alterations
description: Playa Alterations is your one-stop shop for chopping, cropping, bedazzling, sprucing, or painting up your favorite duds! We have sewing supplies, apertif cocktails, cold brew coffee, and tunes to carry you through your week.
landmark: SHORT JEAN SHORTS flag

name: Black Rock Boutique
description: The Black Rock Boutique is your fashion headquarters at Burning Man since 1996. We empower Burners to creatively self-express with funky, freaky, furry, fabulous clothing. Come find a new outfit, donate your dusty old playawear, mutate your clothes into something new and weird, and strut your stuff on our runway! Open 12-5pm Monday-Saturday of Burn Week.
landmark: Pink and black 12-sided wooden frame circus tent

name: Abstininthe
description: The friendly bar on the playa, providing our special drink to the thirsty of BRC since the last millennium. Come try our many flavors and enjoy the music, ambiance and conversation of our neighborhood bar.
landmark: Big "Abstininthe" sign over our bar

name: Post Nuclear Family
description:
Post Nuclear Family is our shelter in the nuclear furnace of the man burn. We're born with our biological family and then we find our logical family in the friends we make. Each of us are different artists under a single roof sharing unique interactive experiences.
* Our home is a space for you to explore the universe aboard Starship Qubit
* Two Minute Photo Booth
* Free Electroshock Therapy is available upon demand
* Cusiouser & Curiouser Headspace
landmark: high peaked yellow roof shade with colorful fabric

name: Hiburnia
description: Serving delicious honey, Agave & Clove, infused hot Toddies at sunrise and sunset every day. Temple Builders Drink for Free
landmark: hiburnia bar

name: Fusion Valley
description: Fusion Valley is one of the oldest camps on the playa! Founded some time in the 90s, we are a collection of sweet and surly geeks and artists dedicated to keeping you safe through the ministrations of Black Rock Ultra Safe (BRUSe). Come on by for a rest in our shade, play board games, test your coordination on our obstacle course, troll the inter webs, and watch a weird movie or two.
landmark: A purple sea train with a movie screen up top.

name: The Dusty Nuts Tavern
description: Escape the constant wub wub for something a little different, along with dusty drinks from dusty peopel.
landmark: Red Dice, shoddy wooden bar

name: DIPTOWN
description: Discover the essence of Eastern Europe at BARBORIS, where we serve only the finest Russian, Ukrainian, and Eastern European vodkas. Our cozy, intimate bar offers a unique experience with dozens of vodka brands, each served in ice-cold shot glasses for the perfect chill. Immerse yourself in the authentic atmosphere, savor the rich flavors, and participate in traditional drinking rituals. Learn what sets traditional vodka apart from the rest. Join us at BARBORIS for a journey of taste and tradition, where every sip tells a tale
landmark: Glowing sign BARBORIS at wooden pergola

name: OLD DUSTY FARTS
landmark: The front of the camp will have the viewing tower flanked by bike racks

name: Radio Electra
description: Live coverage of Burning Man streaming 24-7 during the event. Real news, Fake news, mayhem, music and good times.
landmark: Lighted Signs out front

name: Spoonful of Friends
description: An inclusive 3-course sit-down banquet awaits with arts, games, drinks and gastronomic delight. Hurry, first 80 to arrive dine !
landmark: A long dining table with a giant fork & spoon sign

name: Playa Penthouse
description: Elevated, restful, shady platform, from which to view the entire Playa. Lively discussions about life and relationships. Coffee in the mornings, cocktails in the evenings. Dance parties day and night. Our interior chill space/playpen is perfect midday or midnight. People from all over the world come to share experiences or simply enjoy our view in silence. "Our view doesn't suck"! We are the home of the Eros Tangier. Informal discussions all week on topics as varied and vital as "Living The 10 Principles", "Couples Communication", "Self-acceptance in sexual transition", "Finding a safe space for partners to express and discuss fantasies" and "We Love You! Do not fear".
landmark: Scaffold tower with 4 lights/flames on the corners

name: Knot Sure
description: Come to Knot Sure and play our spinning wheel game hang out or get a decorative rope top.
landmark: Look for our big camp sign that says Knot Sure

name: Cosmic Giggle
description:
Welcome to Cosmic Giggle! We are burners spanning from NYC to the Bay and crossing continents to London and Beirut. Our name is inspired by an experimental documentary that explores the expansive energy field that we, together, create...and one thing is for sure, it can get pretty random! Here's what we have in store for you this year:
 
We've got a gym! Who said being Playa meant missing out on your pump up?
We've got classes! We work out your externals, navigate your internals, and will get you giggling!
We've got a bar! Rehydrate with electrolytes. Dehydrate with booze. Though beware: we may make you work for it!
Looking to keep your heart rate mellow? We've got cosmic croquet and an oasis lounge.
OH, and meet Freddy, our resident GODZILLA!

 So come on: Enter our cosmic chaos. Have a Giggle!
landmark: LED Cosmic Giggle sign or 20 foot green dinosaur

name: Southern Discomfort
description: Welcome to Southern Discomfort, where we bring a slice of charm to the eclectic desert landscape of Burning Man. Join us as we invite you to indulge in the ultimate fusion of down-home hospitality and radical self-expression. Prepare to be transported to a realm where Awful Waffle and Hillbilly Ice Tea parties redefine the notion of fun and festivities under the scorching sun.
landmark: The OPEN sign for the Awful Waffle

name: SonicBoom Saloon
description: Come enjoy some old west drinks while you learn to crack a whip or gamble your precious shwag away.
landmark: barbwire cactus

name: Cheezy Oasis
description: Indulge in the tantalizing allure of irresistibly cheezy goodness that delicately melts in your mouth. Join us to savor this exquisite experience of cheesy delight. Alternatively, embark on a flavorful adventure and roll the dice for a delectable drink that promises to energize your day like never before.  Feeling adventurous? Grab the mic and unleash your inner comedian, songbird, or entertainer extraordinaire. The stage is yours to own!  If mornings aren't your thing or you've burned the midnight oil, why not join us for a pick-me-up coffee and delightful conversation to start your day right? And remember--Stay Cheezy
landmark: flashing orange road light on top of structure

name: HAPPINESS AND JOY TOUR MASSAGE
landmark: MASSAGE upright feather signs

name: Camp Pendant
description: Welcome one and all! Come by and pick up one of this year's pendants or a "BURNER" bike license plate. Rest your weary feet and tell us about your year. Be sure to check out the day's swag on our gifting tree. Whether you take a little something or leave a little something, it's here to make everyone's day a little brighter. Nights too frenetic? Sit and watch our relaxing fractal display.
landmark: Large backdrops of famous art. Long Pennants

name: Yeah Man!
description: The playa fabulous version of your favorite small town dive bar.  Music selection includes but is not limited to: Hip-Hop/Rap, Latin (Cumbia, Salsa, Reggaeton, Pop Latino), Old School, Jam Bands, Classic Rock, House, Techno, and more.  Carpeted, shaded dance area with a bar and a pink silicone stripper pole.  Ambient lighting at night.  Spank stamp paddles and Misguidance Counseling.
landmark: big red letters that say "Yeah Man!"

name: Sharkey's Bar and Lounge
description: Sharkey's Oasis: The unrivaled "Preferred Party Beyond the Porto-Potties, where Peni and Pagina frolic on the Pre-Playa Plaza Playground!"  Our mission? To delight you with delectable libations, provide respite under our shady canopy, serenade you with tunes in the lounge, and bestow upon you exhilarating and daring drinking games! 🍹🎶🎲
landmark: The Golden Gate Bridge entrance

name: Alternative Energy Zone
description: A camp where you can come learn about how you can create a solar system to take care of your power needs large or small. 11am daily. Get a cocktail or pancakes, learn to figure draw and even get a positive attitude adjustment. We have Wifi gifted from the BM Org, shade and technical support from Solar to Excel...
landmark: 45' Scafold tower.

name: Penis Envy
description: na
landmark: Lit up penis in the sky

name: Never Past Bedtime Land
description:
BE THE TRASH!
Never Past Bedtime Land brings the Trash Fence to YOU!
Get dressed in HORRID DRAG and Photographed at the TRASH FENCE SIMULATOR!
DANCE to our SEXY DJ's and their SILKY BEATS!
Get delicious ICE COLD ROSÉ served by our DOMINATRIX!
Load up on TRASHY SNACKS.  You'll need them later...
Remember: The Best Way Get Picked Up At Burning Man is if YOU'RE TRASH.  You heard it here first!  Never Past Bedtime Land.
landmark: NEON NPBL SIGN and TWIN SHADE STRUCTURES

name: And Then There's Only Love
description:
Home of the world famous Orgy Dome – where couples & moresomes of all orientations are invited to come and play. We welcome the combination of love in all forms.

We're a sex-positive, inclusionary, and exploratory space that's been a place of fire, fun, and passion since 2003.

Everyone wishing to enter the Orgy Dome receives a detailed orientation covering Informed Enthusiastic Consent. Remember, anything other than an enthusiastic YES means NO!

Our (relatively) dust free and air conditioned space is designed for people to experience social sexuality in a safe and respectful way. We have a 'Just Us' and an 'Open to More' section – so monogamous & non-monogamous folks are all welcome.

And check out our daily workshops on many different sex-positive topics.
landmark: A large "Orgy Dome" sign and archway.

name: Burntown
description: Don't call it a comeback, we been here for years! Burntown is back again ready to ROCK the playa. Come try the Rope Bridge of DEATH. Savor many exotic tobacco and herbal snuff varieties in our SNUFF Emporium. Shop for that special something in our General Store. Relax and enjoy our Art Gallery, which will have all sorts of artwork and guest speakers throughout the week. At Burntown, expect the unexpected!
landmark: 100ft long rope bridge.

name: Artech
description: We are a hybrid art support-theme camp. We brought a giant unicorn named #Kokon to the Playa. At our camp, we host stand-up comedy evenings and open mic nights featuring comedians from the CIS region, performing in Russian, Ukrainian, and English. We unite people through laughter and art, creating an unforgettable experience for all participants.
landmark: Comedy stage, with artificial plants and lights

name: Space Junk Ranch
description: Welcome to Space Junk Ranch: where space cowboys and cowgirls can dump out their hearts! Join in campfire singalongs under starlit skies, as we serenade the universe with tales of intergalactic exploits. Explore the wild frontier of the Trashosphere and join forces with our crew to clean up the cosmic prairie. Visit the saloon for a cool sarsaparilla, so you can lead your possie out with cheer!
landmark: Space Junk Sign

name: Teddies
description: Themed parties, food, bar & tunes all week. Cuddle with Bears & more in the Teddy dome, open 24/7
landmark: Teddy bear head in the sky

name: TeaHive
description: Step into a world of Moroccan bliss at TeaHive - Playa's ultimate tea lounge.
landmark: Look for a bell tent with an honeycomb sign

name: Pinhole Project
description: Come create large format pinhole photography to capture art installations and the community in the desert! We have built a darkroom every burn since 1999. We host art-making workshops every morning. We take the workshop on an art tour using old-school pinhole cameras loaded with photographic paper. This allows participants to slow down, observe their surroundings more closely, and truly immerse themselves in the process of capturing images. Plus, the unique aesthetic of pinhole photography adds a distinctive charm to the photographs, making them truly special mementos of the experience.
landmark: Art gallery with 40" x 30" paper negatives

name: Oracle Camp
description: Oracle Camp provides I-Ching and Kuan Yin readings everyday, all day and Tarot Card readings throughout the week depending on scheduling.
landmark: Oracle Camp sign on two Costco shade structures

name: Potty Project
description: Home of the Potty Project a group of volunteers helping teach proper potty usage and make the potties fun! We offer volunteer shifts M-F of the event so stop in to sign-up!
landmark: Look for the purple potty portal.

name: Interzone
description: Transport yourself to another time and place as you enter Tangier's International Zone. Grab a book from our Lost Times Library and hang out in our lounge area, open 24/7. Library Loud Hours daily from 3pm-6pm with iced Moroccan mint tea and craft beer on tap!
landmark: Large grey stretch tent

name: Hellfire Society
description: The Hellfire Society is dedicated to creating a vibrant, safe, and interactive environment that enhances the overall Burning Man experience. We focus on the art of fire performance.
landmark: Large Red and Black Dome

name: Camp Byte This
description: Camp Byte This is BYTE's fluffy camp! Come by and dance with us, play on our immersive art, explore our mutant vehicle "Petabyte" and lube up your tappin' toes with our signature drinks at our furiendly bar. Warning: you may receive really cool gifts, hear the best music and feel the fluffiest vibes!
landmark: big circuit board infinity sign that reads BYTE

name: 3SP (Third Space Place)
description: 3SP (Third Space Place) is your dusty, comfy front porch/living room combo serving as a Black Rock City "third space" — a relaxing, community spot offering a real sense of welcome and belonging beyond one's dwelling ("first space") and one's workplace ("second space"). As with any true third space, guests can stop by, relax, ask for directions, chat, or PARTICIPATE in one of 3SP's events focusing on all kinds of issues: being introverted on Playa; navigating the world as a stutterer/stammerer; identifying unconscious biases; Native-American appreciation versus appropriation; relaxing with essential oils or a camera obscura mediation; and more. We've been around since 2015 and we've got campers from DC, NYC, Minneapolis, Philly, Portland, LA, and beyond. Come on by!
landmark: Large blue and green flags and 3SP banners

name: Second Wind Pirate Cafe
description: Embark on a nocturnal adventure at the Second Wind Pirate Café, a vibrant pirate-themed coffee spot that only opens its doors from 9 PM until about 1 AM. This isn't just a café; it's an experience where freshly brewed black pirate coffee is served with a side of unforgettable entertainment. Our servers, true pirate spirits, engage guests with a treasure trove of games ranging from silly to absurd. Imagine sipping on the pure, bold flavor of our coffee, no milk, sugar, or alcohol, amidst an atmosphere of playful banter and laughter. Outside, our witty pirate duo, armed with bullhorns, playfully heckles and invites passersby to join in the fun. Join us at Second Wind, where every cup of coffee is a journey and every visit is a story in the making!
landmark: Large pirate flag flygin above a coffee shop.

name: Buddha Lounge
description: The Buddha Lounge is a healing and sound camp offering DJs, workshops, ecstatic dance, yoga, breath work and meditation.
landmark: Buddha Lounge neon sign

name: Playa Jazz Cafe
description:
A celebration of Jazz Music featuring nightly concerts and jam sessions, 
 daytime educational workshops, and a lively bar serving coffee and cocktails.
landmark: Big green dome with purple JAZZ CAFE sign.

name: Epiphany Jewelry Co.
description: Black Rock City's finest jewelry store.
landmark: Big orange tent

name: Slutgarden
description: What we want, when we want, who we want. Forever. Sexual Comedy.
landmark: 50 foot white dome, pink shadow boxes on DJ Stage

name: MindShark
description: Step right up for your one-stop burning man shopping right here at the grand Ol' MindShark - a place that will likely be the only stop you need to make on your travels. Behold a wild array of stupid burner shit that features seemingly unlimited booze and entertainment, mind-blowing interactive light and flame effects, dope music, and what burners are saying is "for sure one of the camps that I've seen at Burning Man," but please Stay Out.
landmark: flaming archway sign that says MindShark

name: Wally's Cowboy Kitchen
description: Interactive cooking camp for people to learn camp cooking and have a hot meal.
landmark: Huge stack of cast iron pots

name: El Tesoro
landmark: Large sign with the shape of NEVADA

name: Send Noods
description: Want to send a unique one of a kind NoodleGram? Get crafty and dive into our pool of noodles to make your masterpiece which we will hand deliver to your loved one in BRC. Limited time only, come join our team of couriers, and experience the joy of engaging in new connections! Let us give you a safe(to the third powa) space to radically express yourself and show you what immediacy is all about! If that's not your cup of tea then just join us for a hot steamy bowl of Noods at our self serve 24 hr noodle bar.
landmark: umbrella jellyfish flagpole above RV/green noodles

name: Duane's Whirld
description:
DuanesWhirld is enjoying our 18th consecutive year en Playa, with many of our campers trekking from Vermont.

Our camp supports the mutant vehicle Fluffy -- accessible public transit masquerading as a cloud wafting across the playa. A wheelchair lift and Braille rails accommodate that many more Burners into the artcar experience.

We enjoy mass-gifting our fellow Burners with Deep Playa Beer Delivery (quenching the late afternoon thirst in the heat) and 'Smores (late nights in deep playa to ease the chill with warm gooey treats.) Each of those gatherings generates micro-community among those Burners brought together. Look for Fluffy!!
landmark: Duane's Whirld faux realtor sign on the street

name: Only mEmbers
description: "Only Members" bar (21and over). Only VIPs with proof of membership are permitted. Absolutely no exceptions. No butt thing..
landmark: Neon sign that spells "Only Members"

name: The Island
description:
A French Polynesia theme camp of mostly residents in this beautiful paradise. Wanting to share his marvelous culture with you.
Don't miss out on the chance to participate in some social experiments.
landmark: "The Island" signal

name: Shipwreck Tiki Lounge
description: Enjoy our famous old school tiki and pirate lounge.  But beware of pirates, sirens and cannibals offering strong grogs and potions!
landmark: Pirate ship

name: Camp Home
description: Just your friendly neighbors next door.  We are here to provide creature comforts – cold booze,  hot tea, mist and buffer massages.  Whether it be a piping hot midnight cup of custom blended tea, or a citrusy boozy creation while you briefly escape that blazing playa sunshine, we are here for you.  We will keep you cozy with the comforts of home.  Let's get weird and stay magical.
landmark: Camp Home Signage/Flag, Geodome, Green Parachute

name: Sian Tea Party
description: Sian Tea Party is a place to chill out with a cuppa in the afternoons to some nice tunes, surrounded by a friendly awesome bunch. We want to share the best teas we have ever tried with you!
landmark: Bedouin type of shade with lanterns and carpets

name: Lily Pad Lounge
landmark: Medium-sized Lilypad artcar and/or LED jellyfish

name: Who's Ready for Jelly!?
description: Your Jello shot hub!  With Jello, power & internet for all and art for some!
landmark: Two lighted whips on top of the trailers at night!

name: Costco Soulmate Trading Outlet
description: The playa's original and longest-running soulmate trading outpost. Come and experience our unparalleled matching system, honed over 27 years of no-frills soulmate trading and find your new best friend
landmark: Large Army tents, COSTCO sign over the entrance

name: Water Temple
description: Your place on playa to find yourself, relax, recover, restore.
landmark: Tipis

name: This Old Camp
description: Welcome to This Old Camp. A place to grab some shade, visit with some veteran burners, participate in some fun activities and get oriented.
landmark: shade structures along the street

name: CornHub
description:
Do you love corn as much as we do? Come experience the entire gamut of the beautiful vegetable slash grain! Vegetables are a scarcity on the playa, so come join us for our fresh corn on the cob daily and build your own flavor popcorn bar to get your fibre on! Pooping is a problem out here, so make sure you get in and out of that little plastic box of a toilet as fast as possible.

If you've got your fiber fix already, come kill some brain cells with our glorious corn bar!
landmark: CornHub flag, strikingly similar to your fav site

name: Diablo Gators
description:
Welcome to the Diablo Gators! Are you feeling obligated on playa? Come de-obligate with us daily. 

Providing obligation consultations, a daily store filled with everything you and your camp doesn't need, and nonstop jaded burner antics.
landmark: flat shade structure with devils and alligators

name: The Shrimp Ranch
description:
Howdy! Welcome to the Shrimp Ranch, where the Wild West meets the salty sea. We're a camp of new and seasoned looking to create a unique experience for the community in the only way we know how: through quirky food, music and event offerings. 

Our ragtag crew will transport you to an imagined past, where crustaceans roamed the frontier. From shrimp snacks and cold drinks to our Shrimp Ranch virtual experience to our raucous music, get ready to live your nautical fantasy and somehow leave weirdly warmer (or cooler) than you came.
landmark: giant panda in a shrimp onesie, Shrimp Ranch flags

name: It Was Better Last Year
description: Come visit The Crusty Burner for delicious, cold beverages, lovingly hand-crafted for your intoxication and refreshment. Or, at least, beverages. They'll probably be cold. Unless Steve forgets to do the ice run again. But Steve won't let us down again today...RIGHT STEVE?
landmark: It Was Better Last Year camp sign

name: Storytime Friends
description: Storytime is a larger-than-life Tiffany's banker's lamp, building community through the magic of storytelling and reading aloud across the playa. Pick up a book, sit in a circle, and read to friends new and old. Lie back, listen, and watch the stained-glass lampshade slowly change overhead. Share your own stories, or create a new one together. Storytime is a stage for reading and connection, and a comfortable retreat from the noise, throughout the city and in deep playa.
landmark: Friends Sign

name: Frogma
description: Frogma is the little theme camp that could, where everyone is your friend and neighbor! Hop on over to our lily pads Monday and Friday at 5:00pm for BRC's one and only Hoppy Hour. Serving up ice cold slushy Frogaritas in our dome sweet dome. You're guaranteed to make a rainbow of connections.
landmark: Large childrens blocks & dome with long red carpet

name: So Far So Good
landmark: Mini golf course

name: Camp Kinetic
description:
Dedicated to Movement Arts in Black Rock City.
Afternoon Workshops in Flow Arts, Juggling, Dance, Yoga, and Aerial.
Evening Features Performances and Fire Jams
landmark: Large white tension shade structure and aerial rig

name: Frizz
description: A chill cafe & bar to come retire at!
landmark: Camp Frizz Flag, White School Bus

name: Woo Hoots
description: Providing mechanical support and consulting for RVs and Trailers.
landmark: The blue and white tower

name: Jungle Oddity
description: A jungle oasis lost in time and space. Stop by to experience our lush soundscapes with musical performances and daily workshops.
landmark: Circular camp sign with the cosmic jaguar

name: Inflatable Wildlife
description: Inflatable Wildlife is the premiere destination for all indigenous inflatables of the playa. With a menagerie of inflatable wildlife and steady stream of danceable beats and wild and wondrous interaction helping to magnify the natural syncopated basslines which undulate through us all, we will be serving signature cocktails during an array of events throughout the week, including a chance to meet your mate at our now renowned Not Awkward Speed Dating, Daily Spirits Tastings, Inflatable Goat Yoga, Playa Jewelry Making, our signature, 5th annual Sunrise Pre-Game Party and more.
landmark: Purple sign on front of camp, Inflatable Animals

name: TRANCESEND
description: TRANCESEND is a place to celebrate the sound of electronic music in all of its forms, a place to "TRANCESEND" mind, body and soul using any beat per minute you can imagine.  Join us for this musical journey-or perhaps for one of the finest hot dogs served on the Playa on Tuesday and Thursday afternoons!
landmark: Neon TRANCESEND sign in Pink and Green Neon

name: Cosmic Llama
description:
The Cosmic Llama Guardians are sworn to protect the ancient secrets of the Dali Llama lineage. The Cosmic Llamas have been charged with creating the highest vibrations of Harmony & Resonance…Without our camp offering beats, music, rhythmic dance (and llama puns)…the Cosmos would fall dangerously out of balance! 

In the whimsical world of Cosmic Llamas,  every step resonates with rhythm, every word hums with harmony, and every heart pulsates with cosmic frequencies. Together we weave the melodies of unity and vibrations of joy that reach the farthest corners of the cosmos, one llama leap at a time!
landmark: Llama Temple Guardian Statues, Cosmic Prayer Flags

name: Beaverton
description: Camp Beaverton is an intentional, experimental, and experiential Burning Man community theme camp. We are a group of queer women/trans/genderqueer/lesbian/bisexual/heterosexual/etc... or folks who are simply as wayward as the playa is dusty. We celebrate sexuality, self exploration, and respect for one's journey through this life. Our goal is to provide a safe(r) space for queer women and trans folks on and off-playa. We encourage education, participation, inquiry, conversation, and self-reflection. We extend our goals to the greater Black Rock community by hosting workshops and social events.
landmark: Rainbow Camp Beaverton sign & large Beaver symbol

name: Bite Me Oasis
description: Bite Me Oasis offers a vibrant community experience at Burning Man, featuring our interactive art installation "Booty Bite" and a mutant art car providing food and drinks on the playa. "Booty Bite" invites playful engagement with a refreshing water splash, while our mutant art car serves hot dogs, ramen, and cold drinks during early morning and late-night excursions. We prioritize Radical Self-reliance, Communal Effort, and Leave No Trace principles to foster a responsible and inclusive community environment. Join us for immersive experiences and communal adventures at Burning Man.
landmark: A large illuminated sign that reads Bite Me Oasis

name: The Carrot Club
description:
Our camp is focused on health and happiness; health through fresh vegetables and fruits at the Black Rock Farmers Market in the mornings and happiness and festivities at the Carrot Club in the afternoons. Enjoy tasty, fresh produce to feed the body, refresh the spirit, and nourish the soul! One of the best parts of exploring any
city is checking out the farmer's market- and Black Rock City is no exception! Come try one of our wide array of fresh fruits
and veggies!
In the afternoons, join us for fresh and icy boozy smoothies as well as fruit and vegetable-based cocktails at the Carrot Club.
landmark: Scaffolding; D-carrot streamers, N-giant Carrot

name: Cloud 9
description:
We are a live music, deep ancestral camp that jumps between mayhem and meditation depending on the day and whether we've had breakfast.

We wish to preserve clean water for future generations. To that end, we will provide only cold beer to the filthy citizens of Burning Man.
landmark: Cloud like sign on the street

name: Dusty Pineapple
description:
Tropical Camp & Deep Playa Bar. Discover fruity drinks, groovy jams, and instant camaraderie where you least expect it.
 
The Dusty Pineapple is an oasis with a bicycle-drawn Tiki Bar that ventures out at sunset to the farthest corners of the Deep Playa to provide a tiny oasis of light, music, fun, and friendship.
 
Come join us in camp for tropical-themed happy hours, chill morning coffee and crepes, and friendly advice from unprofessional advice givers. Or practice your leave no trace skills with a quick game of Pick It Up With Your Butt! 
 
The Dusty Pineapple does not disclose its location in the Deep Playa. We prefer to be that moment burners find by chance, celebrating serendipity, intimacy and great times. We look forward to you stumbling upon us along your journey.
landmark: Yellow flags and tiki bar!

name: Black Rock Brewery
landmark: Large pergola over a pool table

name: MacGyvers' Union
description: Every camp has a MacGyver -- now the MacGyvers have a union. We provide all MacGyvers with recognition, thanks, tools, training, entertainment, emotional and moral support, chill space away from their home camp, and an official ID card.
landmark: Reddish wood front wall with MacGyvers Union sign

name: NumbSkulls
description: Home of NumbSkull
landmark: Shade structure at street with camouflage walls

name: The Schtick Strip
description: The Schtick Strip is a strip mall of different schticks each day.  What could they all be?!  Who knows?! Not us, we haven't planned that far ahead yet.
landmark: small white shuttle bus, Tiny DMV sign

name: Penguin Place
description: Penguin Place, a welcoming home for dusty travelers from up-and-down the West Coast. Daily chai, trampoline, mid-week ice-throne event and a lounge to keep cool and meet and mix with fellow burners at several eclectic parties throughout the week.
landmark: 20ft flagpole with rainbow and orange penguin flag

name: Aikido
landmark: Fluffy Cloud surrounded by the 50" dancefloor

name: NYC Community Container
description: We Guarantee Nothing! But you'll probably pick up your gear from us if you're from NYC/NJ
landmark: 5 53' hi-cube shipping containers

name: Rumi's Tea House
landmark: large flags, Tea Tent w/stars,banner,dervish sign

name: Never Never Camp
description: Welcome to Never Never Camp - a magical land of sunset weddings, disco laser caves, and bottom-shelf drinks with top-shelf entertainment. Find our Second Bar to the Right for daily happy hours (ask about our exclusive Birgin special!), come see the view of the playa from our rooftop platform, get married at sunset in our wedding chapel, or dance the night away in our laser-filled disco cave. None of this sounds appealing? Come by anyway, hijack our sound system or bar, and make it your own - we're always ready to get weird.
landmark: Never Never Camp neon sign and 2-story bar

name: Ragnarokk
description: Ragnarok is the End and the Beginning. It tells a story where destruction is necessary for creation to flourish. It is rebirth, it is recovery, it is rejuvenation, it is a renaissance, it's renewal, restoration, and resurrection. It is what we are experiencing in our lives right now. It is Burning Man. And now, it's us. We are camp Ragnarokk!
landmark: Big Metal Ragnarokk sign

name: Artery Pavilion
description: The ARTery is the headquarters of the Burning Man Art Department on playa, located at 6:30 and Esplanade in Black Rock City. It functions as a hub for information about art, as well as a check-in and resource center for artists, helping to  facilitate the placement and installation of their art on the playa during the Burning Man event.
landmark: large ARTery sign

name: BLM/FNW Interpretive Camp
landmark: BLM Interpretive Camp sign

name: Minimal Chaos
description:
Step into the fiery embrace of Minimal Chaos, where the art of fire spinning ignites the spirit of Burning Man. Our camp serves as a sanctuary for both seasoned fire artists and newcomers alike. Dive into workshops covering essential fire safety and spinning techniques. Join us for collaborative flow arts jams, where everyone, regardless of skill level, can spin, watch, or learn. Our RSVP performance area is open for reservations—ideal for Fire Conclave, group rehearsals, performances, and various gatherings or parties.  Email pocfirespinners@gmail.com to reserve. 

Minimal Chaos invites you to explore, create, and connect through the mesmerizing dance of flames. East Coast Represent!
landmark: open performance area.

name: Waterworks
description: BRC Waterworks Department Office
landmark: Waterworks Sign

name: Mas Komodo Dragon
description: Mas Komodo Dragon welcomes you to chill with us in our cozy party lounge, enjoy cold alcoholic slushies, enjoy relaxing music while your bicycle is being fixed. Come and put your riding skills to the test on our obstacle course.
landmark: UV reactive art and giant red power generator

name: MythMaker Annex
description: We are a Tribe, a Family, and a Close Circle of Performing Artists and Skilled Makers. We seek to restore the sacredness of myth through theater, dance, circus arts, puppetry, costumes, and fire performances coupled with deep ritualized tales of days long past yet still relevant in the present. We seek to balance the foolish with the wise, the free-spirited with the disciplined, the ridiculous with the honourable; to face the Shadow and the Light. We welcome all who seek the Truth.
landmark: Big Green Viking Bus, Temple Dome, Mead Hall

name: Black Rock Piano Lounge Annex
description: Black Rock Piano Lounge is the place to come and share your talent with a friendly audience. We bring great musicians to the playa but build our lounge for that spontaneous moment where the perfect vocals are combined with the best tuned pianos on the playa. Lets make some beautiful music together.
landmark: All white tent structure with pianos and furniture

name: Arctica Outpost
description:
Arctica Outpost
6:15 and K
landmark: Ice Trucks

description:
Arctica Main
6:15 and Center Plaza
landmark: Arctica Igloo

name: Arctica Ice Sales - Ice Cubed
description:
Ice Cubed
3:00 & G Plaza
landmark: Arctica Igloo

name: Arctica Ice Sales - Ice Nine
description:
Ice Nine
9:00 & G Plaza
landmark: Arctica Igloo

name: Tacoma is for [GHOST] Lovers
description: Tacoma is for [Ghost] Lovers, home of the Black Rock Shoe Repair and Inky and Clyde the Ghost Mutant vehicles. Saving Soles By Day Chasing Souls By Night!
landmark: Giant Yellow Arcade Game Shoe Booth

name: Groove Oasis
description: Groove Oasis is your refuge in the dusty desert to rest or move your body. We are hosting dance workshops and parties throughout the week so check the playa schedule and come get your groove on!
landmark: Pink and Blue Lotus Heart Sign

name: Heartless Dino
description: Heartless Dinos. Art support Camp
landmark: Heartless Dino Flag

name: Carrot Tribe
description:
A groovy sound camp for all things carrot!
Come disco with us while we serve you up juicy beats and carrot cocktails. Keep calm and carrot on.
landmark: Neon orange sign of "CARROT TRIBE," Carrot flags

name: BlinkingManCamp97
description: ART 20 / IQ Test / Dragnet Interrogation...WE do it all! Come and visit the trash fence and see our 13th project on the fence. There will be 75 tennis rackets adorned with fun recycled folk art pieces. In camp we will give you an IQ Test with wacky question and expect fun weird answers. Also we can interrogate you using sound bite from the old Dragnet TV/Radio show. Always fun this is my 20th visit to BRC and always bring the fun!
landmark: GREEN LIGHTED IQ TEST SIGN OUT FROnT

name: Black Rock Yearbook
landmark: Yearbook Sign on the container 6ft x 10ft sign

name: RhythmWave
description: RhythmWave brings Conscious Dance to the Playa, along with yoga and other movement practices. 5Rhythms, Open Floor, Dancing Freedom, Soul Motion and others. We offer a space to figure out what is going on inside you and to move through it. Not just a place to show off your latest dance moves. Our offerings are made on a sprung bamboo wood floor beneath a shade structure, and are offered several times daily.
landmark: Hard wood dance floor with 50'x50' shade 14' high

name: Icy Hands CHILLZONE
description:
We seek out the weary, the overheated and the disconnected to offer our signature Icy Hands experience.  The instantaneous sense of relief, joy and connection turns recipients into PARTICIPANTS and makes them part of a larger whole.  Icy Hands epitomizes "the gift that keeps on giving"  by coaching recipients through providing the experience to others.  Hands are cooled to near freezing temperatures by means of a simple block of ice, then with full positive consent of the recipient, those hands are placed upon the neck and jaw, providing an immediate sense of cool, calm and connection. 

Block of Ice: $5.  Memories, endorphins, friendship and dopamine rush: PRICELESS.
landmark: Icy Hands Sign Posted High on our 40' scaffolding

name: Harmonic Drift
description: The crew of Harmonic Drift brings a one-of-a-kind mobile, participatory musical experience that brings out your inner child to unite us in the magic of improvised music. Inspired by Balinese gamelan, our unique instrument pantheon of aluminum plate gongs, pipe bells, and found object percussion instruments, awaits your touch and imagination. Find us drifting around playa with our mobile instrument and shadow puppet carts. And check out our shadow-puppet-inspired puzzle & story installation called "Adventures in Shadowland" in Center Camp.
landmark: trailer full of silvery gongs

name: Cheshire Alley
description: Join us on a trip down the rabbit hole! Cheshire Alley - the most fun dive bar on the playa!! Stop by for some afternoon and evening silliness, cool drinks, games, and black light body / face painting. We host super fun themed parties Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday evenings.
landmark: Large colorful "Cheshire Alley" sign Cheshire Cat

name: Black Rock Socks
description: Come by for Chocolate Roulette, Tea and Shock Collar Karaoke for a magical time
landmark: 2 large geodesic breasts and camp sign

name: Hunty
description: Hunty is a camp of LGBTQ+, allies and people of color from across the landscape of California. Primarily consisting of veteran burners, most of whom are artists, Hunty is space for the creative minded to come together and flourish.
landmark: Multi Colored Tent & Hunty Sign

name: Vault 21+
description: Vault 21+ welcomes you to come on down to your local 23 hour a day dive bar.  Yes, 23 hours.  If your in our bar at sunrise we kick you out to go watch the beauty of the playa.   We will be hosting a myriad of events throughout the week to include Karaoke, Themed parties and food give aways.  Stop by and have a drink and hangout.  We'd love to see you all.
landmark: Large vault door and our "Vault 21+ sign"

name: Camp Sunshine
description: Camp Sunshine- Let us fill your belly with sunshine with our rainbow unicorn pancake donuts. We believe "If we all spread one ray of sunshine, we could light up the world"...
landmark: Camp Sunshine Flag

name: Camp Byus
hometown: Reno, San Diego South, Lake Tahoe
landmark: Camp ByUs Sign

name: Sovereign Nation of Farkovia
description: The Sovereign Nation of Farkovia
landmark: Big sign saying Welcome to Fuckoffistan

name: Red.it.be
description: Red.it.be is a techno camp at Burning Man that channels the Berlin club scene with the best techno music and a giant dark cube dance floor. During the day, it's a chill-out space, and at night, the party continues with high-quality techno music. The camp is open to everyone and encourages self-expression.
landmark: Illuminated Red Sign with "Red It Be" as the logo

name: Chain Reaction
description: Welcome to Chain Reaction, your hub for Burning Man bike repair! From Monday to Saturday, 11 am to sunset, pedal over to us for all your bicycle needs. Whether it's a flat tire, a loose chain, or a wobbly wheel, our team is here to get you rolling again. Please note, we'll have limited service on Saturdays, so swing by early to ensure your wheels are ready for the playa adventure!
landmark: The Chain Reaction banner in front street facing

name: Celtic Chaos
description: Celtic Chaos sound camp is back to recharge your soul and deliver top-quality tunes and cold drinks all served with a side of Irish charm! The camp roots are Irish, but its branches reach all corners of the globe, and the attitude is radical inclusivity with a Céad Míle Fáilte (one hundred thousand welcomes) vibe. Leave your ego behind, and swing by Bertie's Bar to share a drink, a story or immerse yourself in the "craic and banter". From sunset through sunrise dance the night away and revel in the chaos. Events: Tue aft: Playa-Olympics: Think games/sports day from school! Thu aft: St. Paddy's Day on the Playa (Trad Irish) Sat night: Celtic Chaos Prom night with tantalizing tunes from a serious line-up of DJs.
landmark: The Irish Flag and 3 White Totems (new in 2023)

name: The Reactor Project
description: The Reactor Project
landmark: White Rabbit

name: Gold Star
description: Feeling like you've been doing a real good job out there? Come by and get your well deserved gold star!!!
landmark: Large light up Gold Star

name: Camposanto
description:
CAMPOSANTO is from all corners of the World, but we are mostly Latinos. We love to dance and celebrate friendship. We contribute to the playa experience with dope Latin Beats, Salsa, Merengue, Cumbia, and Deep Rhythm. Our bar is always open!

Come to enjoy our Salsa Floor, beer-in-hand soccer games, and more. Look for our Solar Mutant Vehicle (Solar Chiva)
landmark: Camposanto Sign, Stadium and Salsa/Latin sounds

name: Booty Worship
description:
Allow us to worship you. Your ass is our asset. Booty Worship is a place where you can:
Feel safe to be exactly as you are
Explore your edges
Embrace your queerness
Move your divine, sexy body

Scale our play structures, decked out with a space net, lyra, silks, pole, and great views of BRC. Move your body to our balanced curation of ass-shaking rhythms and cosmic obscurities. We serve the best cocktails this side of Center Plaza at our Booty Bar, and boast the hottest barstaff to boot. Dress-up at our beloved Booty Boutique! Not your average thrift rack – our selection is vetted and makeup flourishes are dispensed with skill by our stylists, so you can look and feel your best. Participate in an afternoon workshop! Offerings include: tantric practices, guided movement, and interpersonal skills.
landmark: 20' tall tower in the front part of our camp.

name: ESD Rampart
description: RAMPART is the main medical station providing all levels of medical care for BRC. Its is staffed with medical professional 24/7 for the duration of the event. It is also the medical vendor staff is housed along with the home to the ALS ambulance units.
landmark: On the esplanade at 5:15 next to the H.E.A.T.

name: Oceyolotl Sanctuary
description: Jaguar Temple welcomes burners for evening healing ceremonies, transformational and fun game 'Animalia', traditional Mexican live music, out of this world singing and legends telling. Enjoy our special cacao, rituals and magical atmosphere!
landmark: Jaguars and spots

name: Mindless Movement
description:
Come empty your mind and be intentionally aware of the present moment via embodied play with our many mental wellness mindLess movement activities and toys.

"To find your heart you've got to lose your mind"
landmark: "Mindless Movement" sign, yellow/green surfboard

name: Pink Lightning
description: Pink Lightning is the home of the Burning Man Ultramarathon, and all things running at Burning Man: the 5k, the beer mile, the naked mile, easy mile, and more! Come to run an event or support an event. We also love all things PINK!
landmark: Pink Lightning Bolts and pink shade structure

name: Quarks and Recreation
description: Games for Progress! Play! Scientists vs. Jabberwocks! Discover! Nuclear Fusion Bocce-Golf! Learn! The modern wonders of the Atomic Age! Your local Quarks and Recreation department invites you to experience our comprehensive catalog of nuclear-inspired games, physics trivia, labyrinthian bureaucracy, and definitely-not-radioactive "drinks" at the elusive h-bar. (Void where the strong nuclear force is inhibited; the electromagnetic force may apply).
landmark: Parklet w/ green "grass" and rad waste burn barrel

name: BURBS
description: The Burbs is the ESD camp that hosts our fire suppression contractor and ESD volunteers.
landmark: next door to ESD Sta. 3. Look for the Fire trucks

name: Endstation
description: Welcome to Camp Endstation, your intimate oasis at Burning Man. Dive into deep human connections in our cozy space adorned with cushions and rugs, all set to the backdrop of soothing lounge music. Receive a crafted ticket to explore scheduled and spontaneous activities, and engage in meaningful conversations sparked by our unique 'Who Cards'. Each morning, our pavilion transforms into a coffee bar with massages, promoting reflection and connection. Embrace the tranquility of our communal area, designed with an enchanting oriental atmosphere for relaxation and nightly festivities. Our camp is a sanctuary for shared stories and experiences, inviting you to rediscover yourself and connect deeply with fellow burners.
landmark: Endstation Sign and black Flag

name: Perihelion
description: Welcome a brilliant morning at our Planet Brunch parties (Mon-Fri, 11-1)! Discover an unexpected oasis under the scorching noonday sun: chilled cucumber sandwiches, loaded drunken pancakes, frozen Pina Coladas, and spiked Frappuccinos! Come for the hotcakes, stay for the live-music dance jams and giant adult coloring boards.
landmark: Blue & gold camp, lines of blue streamers in front

name: Ply Curious
description: A fun loving semi eccentric group inviting all to experience the unknown. Be loving. Be musical. Be creative. And above all.....be curious!
landmark: two large question marks.

name: Cirque de Licious
description: Eccentric buncha clownz that love fun and serving coffee to the masses!
landmark: circus tent with swing sets next to it

name: Camp FYFA
landmark: 30foot tall LED Spotlight

name: Ray's Fix It
description: Break something? We'll try to fix it! No promises, other than you'll leave with something and we'll have a good time trying. Power tools and expertise available Office Hours, otherwise 24/7 DIY with hand tools, work space, and plenty of materials to MacGyver your issue. No bikes or mutant vehicle help, though we'll try to point you in the right direction.
landmark: Chain link fence and Rays Fix It sign

name: The Lost Penguins
description:
Welcome to The Lost Penguin Cafe! We are one of the oldest continuously-returning theme camps at Burning Man, and we are back in 2023 to bring our freezing cold treats and sizzling hot entertainment to the playa!

Come take shelter from the hot sun in our 40 x 80 shaded, adult-only lounge and comfy couches! Here, you can enjoy live performances from noon until the wee morning hours, along with a refreshing drink or piece of chocolate from our bar.

Between noon and sunset, we serve snow cones in our all-ages area so anyone on playa can beat the heat!

Come join our waddle for an unforgettable afternoon or evening. Straight from the icebergs of Antarctica to you!
landmark: Large Penguin Figure at the Front Entrance

name: Pam's Parlor
description: Welcome one and all to Pam's Parlor, where you can find shade and get shiny with our custom flash tattoos designed specifically for the Burn, or enjoy other scheduled events such as gourmet hot dogs (and veggie dogs), Tarot reading, meditation, and more!
