landmark: long wall of  art tapesries and Swagatron sign

name: Shangri-Lounge
description: Pop-up support camp for the Shangri-Lounge human-powered mobile martini bar in Deep Playa, the Air Band interactive performances in Central Plaza, and the Ice Taxi shuttle running from Arctica to your camp. We'll serve you the finest cocktail while you relax in intimate conversation with new friends under the stars, help you live out your life-long fantasy of being a rock star, and keep your precious ice from melting all over the Playa. All you have to do is find us!
landmark: Black Rock Shade structure with Martini sign

name: Nanomo Selfies
landmark: N/A

name: Melons Present: The Dinner Party
description: The Melons are back on the playa and this time they… don't have any melons. But they do have a deep playa dinette set that goes blinky. Can you find it?
landmark: Lit-up Melons sign; watermelon playatech

name: Burners Without Borders (BWB)
description:
Our camp in Black Rock City (BWB-BRC) is a physical manifestation of our mission and our community in the Black Rock Desert. We seek to bring together do-ers, makers, and change agents bringing the 10 principles to life beyond the orange trash fence. We do this by hosting a speaker series, a maker space, evening conversations around the fire-pit and supporting the participant-facing BRC sustainability teams like BLAST, RAT, and the Green Corridor. 

BWB promotes activities around the globe that support a community's inherent capacity to thrive by encouraging innovative approaches to disaster relief and grassroots initiatives that make a positive impact.
landmark: 3 story building with wings and BWB sign on top

name: DragonCamp Armory
description: DragonCampArmory teaches women to hand-make their own sexy  armor bikini. Participants will trace, cut, pound, and decorate thin sheet aluminum into a cool, amazing custom fitting metal bikini costume.
landmark: Giant Life size dinosaurs and dragon vehicle.

name: RIPPLE
description: The Ripple Effect reflects on the very nature of affecting change:  how one small stone tossed into a body of water causes a ripple effect with an almost never-ending forward motion.  Camp Ripple is all about tossing those positive stones to impact your own life and those of others one small metaphorical pebble at a time!
landmark: 10x20 Tie-Die with RIPPLE in large letters.

name: Lamplighter Lounge
description:
The Lamplighters began in 1993, with a small group of participants placing a dozen or so kerosene lanterns on the ground each evening, illuminating a pathway towards The Man. 

The Lamplighters are more than a handful of volunteers; they are a team of well over 100 participants every evening. To accomplish this considerable task, we ask for your help, and we invite you to be a part of this community, this event, and our tradition. 

The Lamplighters begin EVERY EVENING of the event in their center camp workspace at around 5pm. The ceremony begins around 6, and soon the work is done. No experience is required. We welcome virgin and seasoned burners alike. One thing is certain though. We can't do it without YOU.
landmark: Large Black shade structure and spires

name: Cadillac Cramp Country Camp
description: Welcome to Cadillac Cramp Country camp! Where you can be refreshed daily between 1 and 6pm. Bring a friend you'd like to interrogate, if needed. Please join us for karaoke in the evening, and bones grilled up by Bones when the bbq is hot ! We love you !
landmark: lumerian lander space gypsy art bar

name: Honey Puddle
description:
Honey Puddle gives you that warm, sweet, exhilarating feeling of being enveloped by love and friendship. And music and mead and
dancing and light. We're not a quiet camp, we're not a not-quiet camp. We're just right...and we'll be here when you want us. We fit like
warm pajamas.
landmark: shimmering golden camp with fire-shooting portal

name: Lamplighter Chapel/Village
description:
The Lamplighters began in 1993, with a small group of participants placing a dozen or so kerosene lanterns on the ground each evening, illuminating a pathway towards The Man. 

The Lamplighters are more than a handful of volunteers; they are a team of well over 100 participants every evening. To accomplish this considerable task, we ask for your help, and we invite you to be a part of this community, this event, and our tradition. 

The Lamplighters begin EVERY EVENING of the event in their center camp workspace at around 5pm. The ceremony begins around 6, and soon the work is done. No experience is required. We welcome virgin and seasoned burners alike. One thing is certain though. We can't do it without YOU.
landmark: Large Black shade structure and spires

name: Playasophy
description: Playasophy is a Burning Man camp based primarily out of Seattle and San Francisco. We've been on playa since 2010, and you can usually find us serving iced coffee in the hot afternoons. We offer an open, welcoming shaded spot to pass the day and a relaxing lounge in the evenings with music and alcohol that challenges your tastebuds.
landmark: LED "Playasophy" sign atop our LED pillars.

name: Dj as a Service
description: Join "DJ As a Service" for a unique Burning Man experience! Our camp features a dynamic drive-thru DJ pick up where mutant vehicles can pick up and drop off DJs, creating a mobile music journey across the playa. Designed for art cars and participants alike, our setup includes a vibrant display of 40,000 LEDs and strobes, syncing with electrifying beats. Dive into our communal effort and radical inclusion as DJs gift their beats and participants revel in spontaneous art car adventures. Stop by, pick up a DJ, or become the soundtrack of the playa! 🎶✨
landmark: Big LED EYE

name: Discordia
hometown: UK, New Zealand, France and Australia
description: Discordia is back! After a hiatus of a few years we are returning with our giant misting pyramid. Come hang out in our chill space daily (afternoons) or join us for one of our legendary parties throughout the week. DJs and drinks of questionable quality may or may not be served.
landmark: giant pyramid

name: The Kingdom
description: massive artcar that welcomes all for art tours and a cold one.
landmark: 2 big tigers

name: Camp VRC
description: Camp VRC is about capturing and sharing the Burning Man experience beyond the playa by means of immersive 360 D virtual reality (VR) footage. Lose yourself in past VR experiences or jump in and help us build a global network to carry the impact beyond the playa. Monday to Saturday, 3-5pm, at the yellow short schoolbus. Also, you might find us POP-UP, to show footage, at other busy events throughout the playa.
landmark: yellow short school bus and Camp VRC sign

name: Coney Mc Coneface
description: We are Coney Mc Coneface .... if you desire cone nonsense come find us ....
landmark: Traffic Cones

name: Bright Cider Life
description:
Come and join us from 4-6pm each afternoon for riotous cider drinking and English shenanigans.
Wassailing Ceremony on Friday at Sunset. Come and watch the wonders of this ancient pagan celebration unfold before your very eyes.
landmark: Large Apple Tree bearing numerous apples

name: Joey Glowey Bar
description: Work Access Camp
landmark: Joey Glowey Bar

name: Arrow Dynamic
description:
Join us at The Arrow Bar each day from 2pm-6pm for drinks and shenanigans
Arrow Party Wednesday night 9pm-12am 4 Mutant Vehicles patched for great sound.
Look for the Arrow 40 feet in the air to guide you home at night
landmark: 40 foot arrow pointing downward

name: Airpusher Collective
description: The Airpusher camp is the port from which our fantastical airship begins and ends her voyages.  Join us for music and joy.  Check our event schedule and meet us at camp prior to our published airship rides to playa and beyond.
landmark: Illuminated arch with angel wings and ship's wheel

name: Sweet Car Bed
description: The home and builders of the "Sweet Car Bed"
landmark: pirate flag on a flag pole.

name: Dolly Llamas
description: Serving southern hospitality and high desert camp since 2022. Come join the breast party in the desert, featuring Dolly-themed coffee parties, discos, drag shows, and more!
landmark: LED Dolly Llamas camp sign

name: Tower of Slackjaw
description: Tower of Slackjaw is one of the tallest climbable structures on the playa with the best views of the 3:00 sector and beyond.
landmark: 60 foot metal tower

name: Dune Dwellers
landmark: "The Wandering Playhouse parking" Sign

name: Nuclear Dandelion
description: Unlock Your Inner Radiance at Nuclear Dandelion! Come visit our "One Dandy of a Spa" daily for hydrating facial masks.
landmark: lighted circular "Nuclear Dandelion" sign in front

name: Gratitude Grove
description: Gratitude Grove is a welcoming oasis dedicated to fostering kindness, gratitude, and community spirit within Black Rock City. Join us for interactive activities including our Gratitude Wall, where you can leave and receive anonymous notes of appreciation, or create your own positive affirmation bracelet at our Kindness Bracelets workshops. Join our nightly Candlelight Gratitude Circle, a space for reflection and gratitude sharing. Engage in storytelling and workshops centered around spreading Tiny Acts of Kindness throughout the week. Embrace the spirit of radical inclusion and join us in spreading kindness and positivity throughout the playa.
landmark: "Gratitude Grove" sign surrounded by two "trees."

name: Temple of Together Crew Camp
description: We are the support camp for Temple of Together, this year's official Burning Man Temple 2024, designed by Caroline "Glitter Kitty" Ghosn. We are a multinational crew of doers, builders, artists and supporters who have spent the greater part of 2024 bringing this temple to life for our community, We welcome everyone to stop by and learn more about the process of designing and building the temple, and we'd love to hear your thoughts and stories.
landmark: Temple Builders Guild painted 40' trailer

name: Turtle Camp
description: Turtle camp is a quiet shady spot where SIMON the TURTLE can rest between playa cruises. Come visit SIMON in his "TURTLE CAVE", and cruise the playa in the luxury of SIMON's plushy turtle shell!
landmark: large 16' tall carport with the "TURTLE CAMP" sign

name: Camp Gotalotgoinon
description: A collective of doers and artist that want to create a collaborative art space to share with others. Creating together and experiencing multi-sensory art that inspires connection and growth. Come play games, solve a puzzle, get your dance on, add to the collaborative string art or come relax and take it all in at the Fog tub. Whoever and whatever you create is art and we look forward to sharing ours with you and experiencing yours.
landmark: Camp sign, Giant teddy bears & Heckle stand

name: L'Atelier de Wagon Support Camp
description: L'Atelier de Wagon has been created solely for the intent of interaction, participation, leave no trace, and gifting at Burning Man.The vehicle is a mobile art studio, bringing together professional and amateur artists or anyone whom wants to give painting a shot. Atelier gives the ability to participants to share their feelings, emotions, thoughts, and minds through live, group, artwork creation. Participants can paint in one location, load into the vehicle, be comfortable during a journey, then unload and continue to work in a new location creating a whole new set of outside interaction in which to paint.
landmark: Yellow Flags

name: Entheos Community Village
description: Members of the Entheos Community organize one of the larger and most diverse theme camps placed at the annual Burning Man event in the Black Rock Desert of Nevada. Friends and members of the Entheos Community come from over 43 countries to contribute their effort, skills, and resources to the creation of Entheos @ Burning Man. The camp creates extensive 24/7 interactivity for all ages as a gift to the citizens of Black Rock City, functions as a pilgrimage home for its members, and serves as a nexus to meaningfully connect people from around the world across national, religious, and ideological lines. As part of Entheos' commitment to radical inclusion, diversity, and equity, we hold a significant portion of our camp capacity open each year to welcome people who are new to Entheos.
landmark: giant trampoline arena with angled bounce walls.

name: Fauxliage
description: Our fake greenhouse offers a temporary refuge from the harsher elements of the playa. Come take a break in our cool space, have some tea, and practice your creativity by making origami playa gifts. We'll hang leftover origami pieces throughout the week as if our greenhouse is "growing" in the desert! At night, look for our 11' LED sign, colorful up lights, silhouetted plants, and occasional fire spinning!
landmark: 42' dome with fake plants & 11' illuminated sign

name: 8-bit Bunny
description: Join us in our steam sauna daily. Sweet out the dust and refresh yourself for another adventure on that playa, or spin the wheel at our bar for a drink. Rabbit ears encouraged but not required.
landmark: Giant pixelated bunny sign

name: ASTRO SHACK JaVa JoINt
description: Delicious coffee served in a cool space with extraordinary hospitality. Fresh ground French press dark roast brewed black as the depths of interstellar space itself (BYO creamer if you must adulterate). The hangout for quasi-legal alien beatniks, mutant cyborg gear heads, trans-solar scooter gangs, radical anarchist raypunks, neuroatypical geeks, freaked-out psychonauts, and caffeine fiends of every stripe.
landmark: Astro Shack sign, lit up at night

name: The Wire
description:
Welcome to a Burning Man experience immersed in HBO's the Wire!

Come watch 24/7 The Wire on repeat all seasons, or engage in awesome interactive experiences and help create the West Baltimore we know and love for our very own in the Playa.

Discover The Wire Burning Man Camp, where the gritty world of the iconic HBO series comes to life. Immerse yourself in interactive workshops, thought-provoking discussions, and cultural celebrations that promote diversity, inclusivity, and social justice.

Step into the roles of your favorite characters and engage in storytelling sessions that foster empathy and understanding. Participate in "The Game" workshops, exploring themes of power, privilege, and inequality, and join our outreach initiatives to support marginalized communities.
landmark: TV playing the Wire on VHS

name: Cabaret of the Void
description:
Cabaret of the Void is a variety show-style vaudevillian speakeasy featuring an intimate stage and bar offering wine and song and a bohemian-chic lounge for socializing and unwinding.

Boasting a decadent aesthetic, red and purple velvet decor, and low-lit ambiance, our interactivity will focus on bringing the spirit of satire, performance art, and parody to the playa. Cabaret of the Void offers a dizzying array of burlesque, comedy, magic, dance, circus, music and more!
landmark: Spiral O and our camp sign!

name: Playa Choir
description: Playa Choir is a performance art piece open to all participants.  Come and join us for a rowdy,  spirit-lifting musical experience!  Radical Inclusion, no audition required!  Singers of all skill levels, ages and persuasions are welcome! Also seeking musicians, dancers and aerialists. Rehearsals are Tuesday through Saturday 10:30 a.m. to 1:00 pm.  Join us on the risers or just come to listen.  Full  performances are on Sunday: Sunrise at the Temple and 11:00am in the Playa Choir Dome.  An additional collaboration performance with the Black Rock Philharmonic tbd.   Performances are a non-denominational, non-religious, spiritual, moving experience. More information and music can be obtained in advance at our website or contact musical director Madi.
landmark: 22' White Dome- lit at night with Blue lights

name: StarPups
description: StarPups welcomes you for a daily caffeine fix of cold-brew coffee in the morning and chill space to hang out at night!  Play some games and make new friends in our cafe during the day, then come back at night to cuddle up and enjoy the psychedelic visuals in our LED dome.
landmark: Puppy Flag on a 20ft pole & 12 foot tall LED dome

name: Camp Cul-de-Sac
description: Our Cinema runs from Sunset to Sunrise, Monday through Friday. Family-friendly content 8pm-10pm. Silent Films 10pm-12am. A cornucopia of the delightful and absurd from 12am-6am. A different theme every night!
landmark: Large upright movie screen and four couches.

name: Curios & Curios3r
description: Curios & Curios3r (aka the Curios) are a delightful band of weirdos camping with the Alight Market Village. We're a tight knit, year round community of seasoned Burners who love to gift interactive experiences that put smiles on the faces of others. We strive to be the highlight of someone's evening by offering strange and delightful experiences that are exactly what you didn't know you needed. Our offerings include: Playa Shoe Shine, Heck and of course, the Curios Shoppe
landmark: Lit up "Alight" sign with laser cut box letters

name: Burning Man Bike Course
description: Come test your skills on the Burning Man Bike Course! A bicycle obstacle course and pump track for all ages, abilities, genders, and sexual preferences. Look for our morning "Kids Only" hours and our world famous Nitro Circus Biketakular Demo and Competition!
landmark: Bike features - pump track and teeter totters

name: Misters & Sisters
description: We are a fun daytime camp, offering two main activities, 1. overhead water misters, accessible all week from dawn to dusk, assisted by a camp member, or self-service, and, 2. a DIY Essential Oil body spray activity daily from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. Monday to Saturday, or until our daily allocation of bottles runs out.  We have 26 different essential oils to choose from and will show you how to mix base, medium and top notes to create your own fragrance. Our oils are therapeutic grade.  Give your senses a spa treatment!
landmark: Misters & Sisters camp sign & overhead misters

name: Duckbutt
description: Come shake your Duckbutt with us for Crafts and Cocktails and Comedy
landmark: giant Duckbutt flag

name: Camp Fuck If I Know
description: Camp Fuck If I Know offers advice, shade and a big welcome.  Stop by for the Coconut Lime Ceremony, drawing games, laughs and hugs.
landmark: Camp Fuck If I Know sign

name: Black Rock Public Library
description:
There once were some folks from afar,
Whose love of books knew no bar.
They visited a library so remote,
In search of good quotes,
And they left with improved repertoire.
landmark: Black vinyl banner w/camp name; white book flags

name: The Surge
description: Come charge your small devices at THE SURGE's bar or living room. Join us for cold-brew coffee, meditation, education, conversation in our comfortable living room with a water mister, or grab a tasty brew or shot (or NA wine) at our fabulous bar. Join us for our Cancer Survivor circle on Monday and/or Thursday mornings.
landmark: SURGE sign with a giant yellow lightning bolt

name: Gong Wrong
description:
"Gong" is both a universal cognate (the same word in virtually every language), and an onomatopoeia (a word that sounds the same as what it describes). It's also a highly under-appreciated musical instrument, as it's typically played loudly, but poorly.

Join us for sound meditations with gongs and bowls to explore deeper states of consciousness. Reveal your deepest self in ecstatic dance or by playing one of our many drums or gongs. Catch us at our Wednesday night camp party, or meet us on the playa as we share the same energy serendipitously!
landmark: Neon 'Gong Wrong' sign

name: Whynauts
landmark: Bright pink neon sign that says "WhyNauts"

name: Dark Sparkle
description: Dark Sparkle is your call to the mysterious, your insatiable drive of self-expression, your community for inclusivity and possibility. Through full-sensory burlesque, music, and ecstatic dance events, Dark Sparkle promotes body-positivity and self-expression.
landmark: Large Dark Sparkle banner, lit at night

name: Northwest Mist
description: World famous misting tent that is like walking into a rain forest on playa. Where we come together to provide a cool oasis for dusty travelers.
landmark: Red and White tent with nation flags sign in front

name: Memento Mori
description:
Life, Death and Sexi Breakfast!

At Burning Vitae we nourish your body and invigorate your soul!

Come experience the sexiest breakfast on playa followed by powerful life and death reflective exercises.

Who says the most important meal of the day can't also be the sexiest?
landmark: The illuminated tree of life on the double doors

name: Academy of Arts and Sciences
description: We're the scientists who are artists. And the artists with a passion for science. We can show you how a crystal is born, and then teach you to make wearable art with it. Want to look at the sun? Want to look at the sun and NOT go blind? We got you, and we'll even paint you up once you're done. Want to learn more about drug tests, or have a question for an OB/GYN? Stop on by for our lively and interesting debate and educational sessions. Feel like pursuing gallery worthy photos of Burning Man through the years? The Academy is the place to be You can also just kick back in the shade, trade a bad idea for a bad drink, and relax at the Bad Idea Bar - worst bar on the Playa (since 2010!).
landmark: A big Banner with Academy of Art and Science

name: The Shaft
description: The Shaft espresso based cocktail. Booze and caffeine on ice is better than most. Daily afternoon services.
landmark: White marquee with The Shaft sign on bar front.

name: Camp Ephemeral
description: Camp Ephemeral is an oasis of calm amidst the dusty, chaotic playa. We aim to provide a shaded, quiet lounge with beautiful lighting and plentiful hammocks. The centerpiece of the camp is a beautifully decorated tea bar, where you can indulge in the most refreshing iced tea you've ever tasted. The tea is garnished with fancy touches like edible flowers and dried lemon slices, and is customizable with mix-ins and syrups.  It's the perfect spot to unwind, recharge, and connect with your fellow Burners.
landmark: Camp sign + shaded area with multiple hammocks

name: Dusty Mule Saloon and Playground
description: We offer the vibe of belly laughs all day, everyday. Inside our vibrant dome, you'll find a welcoming bar offering boozy cocktails or one of our chilled non-alcoholic options with a boogie music theme. Dome interior games include Yard Yahtzee, Pin the Man on the Ass, Truth or Jenga, Cards Against Humanity, Monolopy, etc. Venture through tunnels connecting smaller domes to our main dome for added adventure. Our playground features an array of interactive games sure to entertain all, from large-scale Connect 4 to Rubber Ring Toss Your Cookies and Shut Your Cornhole. LED Tetherball and hydraulic teeter-totters in What Goes Up Must Come Down add to the carnival-like atmosphere. Laughter is the universal love language of friends.
landmark: 30ft colorful dome with purple saloon doors

name: Cafe Sua Da
description: Dusty, hot and tired? Come by Cafe Sua Da for a cafe sua da (Vietnamese Iced Coffee). Designed to look and feel like a cafe on the hot streets of Saigon, we welcome anyone and everyone to enjoy an iced cold shot of caffein dripped personally for you, topped off with a healthy dose of sweetened condensed milk. Open most afternoons during the week.
landmark: Cafe Sua Da sign + lots of people enjoying coffee

name: The Sound Garden
description: We are a high vibe sound camp here to delight your senses with a unique 360 degree sound system that will blow your mind. By night we bring you some of the most talented DJ's and artists to create an unforgettable experience of movement, sound and performance. By day we host sound healings, deep house yoga, and listening parties of your favorite artists. We also offer body work, and a few healing  workshops in our Garden Lounges
landmark: Pitched hexagonal roof looks like a circus tent.

name: Miso!
description: Come join Miso! for late night miso soup and sake underneath our 20 ft bar tower. Enjoy our consent based workshops and events during the day in our event space. All are welcome!
landmark: 20' tall tower with the big yellow buddha

name: It Yurts So Good
description: Come and experience the charm of the prairie together, feel our roughness and enthusiasm...
landmark: 1 large Yellow Yurt, light at night, red blue flag

name: Ranger Headquarters
description: Black Rock Ranger Headquarters – The center of Black Rock Ranger Operations. Located on the Esplanade at 5:45.
landmark: Ranger Headquarters

name: Burnstream Court
description: Burnstream Court is a group of Airstream owners who recreate a 1960s trailer park, Black Rock City style.  We almost always have fun daytime events happening that you can join in with. And we give away grilled cheese sandwiches midday M-F.
landmark: antique lighthouse beacon and 3 Airstreams in line

name: Fucking Joe Camp
description: Welcome to Fucking Joe Camp!  Where everybody knows your name, and we're always glad you came!
landmark: Pole with bright orange beacon, lighted camp sign

name: HEX Collective
description:
Join HEX Collective for a Feast of the Senses: a host of interactive activities designed to tantalize your 5 senses and leave you with a sixth, HEXsense!

Including:

HEXperience Coffee & Tea from 7am - 11am
HEXperience Day Party from 12pm to 4pm
HEXperience Cocktail Lounge from 9pm - 12am
landmark: Large white 40' HEX Tent on our frontage

name: Cascadia Lodge
description: Black Rock City's favorite Apres-Ski bar and dance party, serving up craft cocktails made with pacific northwest spirits. Warm up at our fire pit or try your hand at the lodge games.
landmark: stretch tent bordered with fake pine trees

name: The Market
description: Imagine – you are wandering through Playa on your way home from a night of adventure or just starting out in search of adventure. Your stomach growls a bit, maybe you feel just a tiny bit thirsty. From afar you see a gathering of carts, lit up and welcoming. What's going on over there? You pedal towards it and stumble upon The Market. You are suddenly surrounded with stands offering their goods. You eat, you drink, and maybe you even get your future told. As you bumble back home, you wonder – was it a dream?
landmark: 5x 10' fabric sails uplight w/ RGB LED floods

name: Ab Avo and Therapy Tea
description:
Ab Avo and Therapy Tea is your place for the avocado toast and hot tea in the morning. Come by and enjoy 100 avocado toasts serving with hot tea Mon-Fri every morning on the first come first served basis!
We're also facilitating therapy workshops teaching how to live a happier life. Check the schedule to find the one that works for you the best and come join our high vibes!
landmark: Ab Avo and Therapy Tea sign

name: Fluffer Camp
description: Home of the The Fluffy Cloud! A giant 360-degree immersive sound and light installation towering 3 stories tall and equally wide, the Cloud is a one-of-a-kind art amplification platform hosting a variety of musical interactivity throughout the week. From world-class DJs to interactive jukebox nights, join us under the Cloud every day of the week to get your taint-shaken by 60,000 watts of overhead sound hitting frequencies 32% lower than any other on the planet!
landmark: Look for the 3 story tall UFO-looking monstrosity

name: Camp Equilibrium
description:
Equilibrium has been established as a destination to represent the pinnacle for the collective first world culture in which we live: vacation. Adhering to a strict belief that our shared time together should be one of joy and relaxation, we seek to strike the all too difficult balance of hard work and play.
It is here that we have constructed a series of spaces and activities to ensure that all who step through our threshold experience the relaxation, camaraderie, and playfulness that we all deserve outside the hectic worlds of which we live the other 51 weeks of the year. "Because it's vacation for fucks sake."
landmark: red and yellow flags that line the road

name: Mortifying Ordeal
description: Come experience the mortifying ordeal of being known! We offer a psychedelic lounge space, coffee service, and interactive opportunities to develop deeper knowledge of yourself and others. Come to our mixer, find a soft place to lie down, or learn to brush someone else's teeth.
landmark: Large LED Eyeball and Mortifying Ordeal sign

name: Burning Questions
description: Burning Questions offers visitors an escape to a hammock world surrounded by nature. Here to provide you with a comfortable hang space day or night, come climb into our nets and let us take you away to the beach, the forest, or a field filled with our World Famous Crickets. We are a group of friends from around the globe who are excited to build our small sanctuary for you to enjoy!
landmark: 25' two-masted circus tent, green lasers @nite

name: The Future Is Weird
description:
The aliens have landed!
Close encounters of the dancing kind.
Offering music, happy hours, and daily chances to spin The Wheel of Future for prizes and surprises.
Come get WEIRD!!!
landmark: Future is Weird LED Sign and Large Metal UFO

name: Radial Sonic Runway Art Support
description: Art support camp for the Radial Sonic Runway.
landmark: With AquaZone - bar draped in billowy aqua fabric

name: Cosplay Central Casting
description:
The most awesome Cosplay LARPing experience on earth! 
Come by and see us and get involved in some fun activities in the Cosplay world.
For sexy and adventurous couples- We have a Barbie theme and naturally Ken being a dickless doll will be fitted with a male chastity cage and Barbie will hold the key!!!
landmark: Large Barbie (pink) and Ken (brown) boxes

name: MISTO
description:
We are MISTO, a Ukrainian camp symbolizing 'city' in Ukrainian—a place that honors the rich cultural heritage of Ukraine and reminds our guests of the importance of their own hometowns, where the heart is. https://www.instagram.com/mistocamp/ 

MISTO is the cultural heart of Ukraine at Burning Man, created to join  talented individuals that come together to showcase Ukrainian rich arts and traditions.

MISTO unfolds as a colorful and lively camp, inviting you to immerse yourselves to experience Ukrainian hospitality, create eye-catching flower crowns, savor delicious food like Ukrainian borscht, and to share Ukrainian uniqueness with the world.
landmark: Dome+MISTO logo,8' wooden dolls,4 flags+MISTO logo

name: Camp Questionmark
description: The most curiouser. Celebrating creativity & music born from the playa. Serving up curiosity constantly, come get some )?(
landmark: Large Metal Question Mark Statue in front area

name: Atomic Pussy Photo Lounge
description: Come visit what is easily the 3rd best Bar/Lounge and Photo Booth on the playa. We serve ice-cold beverages to fuel your Curiosity and propel you to a higher flow state. Returning this year is Weir(d) Wednesday, when we'll be serving up a hero dose of the Grateful Dead all afternoon. Also returning this year is our twin-tip, reverse camber Shot-Ski (for those playa face shots), the Elaine Benes Dance Experience (dance classes for dance-introverts) – and of course the photo booth, photo art, and photo gifts. Noon-6pm M-T-W-F and late night on Thursday. Lounge space is 24 hrs.
landmark: Camp Banner - Atomic Pussy Photo Lounge

name: Ice Ice Maybe
description: Welcome to Ice Ice Maybe! We are a small but playful and inviting camp that offers daytime events inspired by wordplay, silliness, nerdiness and creative joy – hosted in a camp with some ice/winter-themed infrastructure and art. We bring a solar panel array to power ice generation, and serve this to sweaty Burners in the form of various icy delights. Sometimes the sun cooperates, and sometimes there are clouds, dust, and thunder. Hence the "maybe!"
landmark: 20-foot swingset

name: Mellow Mountain
description: Mellow Mountaineers invite you for mid-morning cold-brew coffee and espresso martinis, to play on the the big purple "M" look-out and the swings, be served frosty beverages and snacks, hang in the lounges, and trade smooches with the Kissy Fish art car.
landmark: Purple "M" structure with pole tower and swings

name: Devachan Lounge
description: Resting place of the gods/goddesses, a comfortable shaded lounge and performance space with cushioned floor, lounge chairs, cushions, and cozy blankets. Come to relax with our daily spa service or cuddle puddle. Join our expansive workshops and Interactive Dinner Theater.
landmark: large shade lounge, light up Devachan Lounge sign

name: Venice Red Light
description: Inspired by the free-spirited heritage of our adopted home of Venice Beach, CA. We are a conglomerate of artists getting weird and supporting each other as we put our dreams into action.
landmark: 6 feet illuminated "V" on top of a 30 foot  dome

name: Pookah Lounge/SNAFUBAR
description: Pookah Lounge— an old-school burners' paradise, complete with fine company, xmas lights, art & music, thrills, and chills... But what makes it really cool is YOU. Drop by and be cool. SNAFUBAR—the better beverage bar—drop by and stay in school! We'll mix you the best drink on the Playa!
landmark: Poo Sign, Burnbarrel, SNAFUBAR, CamoHut

name: Midnight Poutine
description: Bonsoir les amis! Step into the whimsical world of Midnight Poutine, where the clock strikes twelve and the land of cheese, fries, and gravy beckons. Viens donc découvrir la magie de minuit et prendre part aux délices nocturne du Québec. Join us in a curious culinary journey where french fries, cheese curds, and hot gravy unite in a dance of flavors that defy logic and delight the senses. Here, amidst the flickering shadows and moonlit whispers, embrace the joyous spirit of our bilingual Canadian camp, where English and French frolic hand in hand like characters from a tale spun by the Mad Hatter himself.
landmark: Quebec flag

name: BRC Hash House Harriers (BRCH3)
hometown: Houston, TX, Phoenix, AZ, San Francisco, CA, and Washington, D.C.
description:
With members of the BRCH3 found in several camps across the playa, a group of us camp together in the Bike Repair Camp. Our mission: share hashing with BRC while keeping the beer cold and bikes running smoothly.

Join us for a hash on the playa. In addition to our Annual Red Dress Run (Thursday, 3pm, meet at the man), we host a variety of hash activities and events. Check out our events page for more information!

The BRCH3 pays homage to our roots as hashers as we encourage our wankers to live in harmony with the 10 principles of Burning Man while sharing our own hashy culture and community. The two overlap quite nicely!
landmark: oversized red BRCH3 letters,  totem lighted arrow

name: Camp Fucking Magical
description:
Swing into the surreal on our suspended floating lotus trampoline or find solace at the Whiteout Teahouse & Tavern. Stop at our bar serving up libations and art from fellow burners. Prepare for unforgettable experiences with our lineup of events - guaranteed to leave you rehydrated, fed, and blessed with unforgettable memories. Ascend to new heights at our lotus pond rooftop lounge, where you can unwind on colorful cushions and behold breathtaking panoramic views of the playa & night sky. 
We provide a sanctuary, a safe space to unwind and connect with others at the heart of your bustling Burning Man adventure. Join us at Camp Fucking Magical and discover the true essence of playa-style adventure, community, and boundless possibility.
landmark: Camp Fucking Magical gold/red sign on the TeaHouse

name: Camp Next Year
description: Camp Next Year providing unique opportunity for evening night life with Resident DJs specialize in organic deep downtempo and Afro house, house and progressive, house and progressive, dancing, movies, food, and the opportunity to meet new burners.
landmark: Rainbow Windmeel

name: G's
description: Nourish your body with warm croissants and enter the Sound Spa with soft downtempo music, at our colorful, comforting home. We're a tight knit community of friends committed to supporting one another. We strive to invite, host and involve any camper who walks through. Our offerings include: backgammon tournaments for the mighty, movement classes for the almighty, and breakfasts for the lucky.
landmark: The letter g, lit at night

name: No Bikini Atoll
description: We are a small camp of Big Island Hawaii based campers sharing aloha and Pāʻina Wai Niu coconut water parties and hydration.
landmark: Fancy white tent with large sign: No Bikini Atoll

name: The Hand Lovers Lounge
description: A soft landing space for hands, lovers, lovers of hands, and everything in between!
landmark: 24 ft Purple archimedes dome and Bamboo Fencing

name: Garbage People
landmark: 10 ft tall Metal Fly Swatter and GARBAGE camp sign

name: Redhanded
description:
Do you have dust in curious places? Visit Redhanded to freshen up sustainably. We will pamper you with a drink and let you complain about the heat, especially if you are on your period. We have precious supplies that will help with your period and personal hygiene before and after playtime. We have funnels that will make your dream of peeing in a porto without opening the lid come true. Come to Redhanded if you're caught red-handed by your bodily functions!

You can visit us at sunset for our scheduled activities or swing by at any other time to make our stage yours.
landmark: White canopy shade surrounded by velvet curtains

name: Roasted Breauxs & Coffee Heauxs
description: Roasted Breauxs & Coffee Heauxs Coffee Roasting on the Playa & serving pour over coffee in BRC since 2011. We serve single origin coffee Mon/Wed/Fri 11-2PM  We will focus on reducing our carbon footprint in BRC
landmark: Green Beacon (Night)  Truck with Solar Panels

name: BRC3PO (BRC 3:00 Post Office)
description: Set in a giant rural postbox, the Black Rock City 3:00 Post Office (BRC3PO) provides postal services up to 16 hours per day. We offer authentic, one-on-one, creative interactions that range from the side-splittingly silly to the supremely sublime. We also provide an array of curated Burning Man postcards and postage to send those postcards anywhere in the world. Imagine the intersection of immersive improvisational theater, spontaneous talent show, soulful conversation, and stifling yet corrupt bureaucracy. You never know what will happen next at BRC3PO -- YOU could be what will happen next at BRC3PO, if you pay us a visit!
landmark: Giant white postbox with BRC3PO sign and red flag

name: Yellow Balloon
description: Clean and Sober camp
landmark: yellow balloon

name: Camp Shoshana
description: We dream of gardens in the desert sand...are you curious?  Like a many petaled bioluminescent rose, we are a collective of multi-hemispherical curiosity seeking creators, engagers, go-getters, and contributors.  All are welcome to bask in our sweet scents and radiant fluorescence.  Visitors can expect a chill vibe, silly games, sweet treats, and maybe even a new playa name.
landmark: Illuminated Shoshana Sign with our camp logo below

name: Bad Asstronauts
description: Welcome to the spaceport where queer Asstronauts from Denver and San Francisco will take care of all your musical needs. Our DJs will blow your mind with electrifying beats on our upgraded sound system and DJ booth to bring you an incredible new audio visual experience. Quench your thirst with our extraordinary elixirs crafted by our skilled mixologists at the Moontang Bar. Step into our all-new chill lounge, the Planetarium, where you can find tranquility while gazing at celestial wonders projected onto the dome above.
landmark: Look for the space port arch with our LED logo.

name: BurningShip
description:
"There are Wood Ships, there are Steel ships, but the best ships are FriendShips."
A bunch of hippie shipmates from all over the world bring their FriendSHIP to the desert for a week of debauchery! Join us at BurningShip, a cruise ship full of immoral crew that's currently stranded in the desert! We'll be your BOOZE directors providing you with drinks, smiles, and fun events. Learn how to salsa dance, smoke a premium stogie, and find hidden 'Booty'! Come with no expectations and leave feeling full. Full of love, hugs, laughs, and WTFs. And most importantly long lasting Burning(friend)Ships.
landmark: Sailboat and Little Wooden Man

name: Bearwhalea
description: They frame the wildest theories upon the most irrelevant facts, or upon the merest fancies. Mr. Darwin thinks that whales may be bears which have enormously increased their bulk, washed their paws into fins by constant swimming, and stretched their mouths by keeping them open to catch insects in the water. So also he thinks that men and women may have been developed out of monkeys, monkeys out of mushrooms, and mushrooms out of " monads," or little clots of jelly. Where is the proof? Where is a single instance of a bearwhale, or a man-monkey, to be seen? Of course there is not one.
landmark: 10' wooden platform, bearwhale sign, bone statute

name: GroundSwell
description: Groundswell Surf Lodge is an Oasis from the playa heat. We have a beautiful shade structure with projection mapping at night, comfy couches, and an abundance of beverages at our tiki bar.
landmark: 2 grey flags with out camp logo w/LED light strips

name: Parley
description:
Parley is your dedicated conversation camp.  Come "Parley" with us during our daily facilitated events and our drop in 24/7 for adhoc conversations on topics of your choice (deep, fun or controversial). 

Our mission is to facilitate meaningful conversations and bridge gaps between people who may disagree with each other.  Participants that accept the Parley (and agree to its' rules) shall be under our protection. No one shall be left feeling unwelcome and no one will be silenced or shunned for simply expressing an idea.  The topics and framing are done in a way that everyone can have an opinion and a voice. In our conversation pit, under the flag of truce, ideas and thoughts shall be shared, rapport shall be built and new friends made.
landmark: makeshift white surrender flags that say Parley

name: Camp PyrOasis
landmark: Large Neon PyrOasis sign

name: A Playa Home Companion
landmark: White shade structure, A.P.H.C. Flags

name: AdramaNation
description: AdramaNation is an all inclusive and diverse camp focusing on a drama free and fun filled burn.  Engaging workshops, delicious delicacies, hydration, art, weddings, burnercise, and good company are to be found with us.  Whether you need a safe space to escape your drama or a place to meet new friends, you're always welcome here.
landmark: AdramaNation yin yang flag

name: Don't Stop
description: Burning man is a place where small things can derail your day or night and we want to support our fellow burners by offering small necessities [ex. tampons, condoms, sunscreen, or glowy things] from our Don't Stop Box, or a drink with inspired conversation.  Additionally, we offer opportunities to restore through Yoga and breathwork and learn how to repair your  bike.
landmark: Shade white roof shade structure and fire pit

name: FlybyNyte
description:
Serving exquisite coffee drinks at the Airport from 8am-noon, Mo-Sat
Come and enjoy our live music and airport cafe atmosphere with the beverage of your choice.
Mo-Fri 10am-noon we will have aviation ground school. Our instructors will give you an introduction to aerodynamics, weather, radio communications, avionics, airspace and all things aviation. We can go as easy or as deep as u like - let's learn about flying in a playful way.
landmark: center of the airport. Café has a yellow top shade

name: The Space Between
description: Mutant Vehicle support camp for The Temple of Time.
landmark: Sign that says The Space Between & solar setups.

name: Organic Fruit & Veggie Camp
description: Daily Fruit & Veggie Bar offering fresh organic produce in a relaxed lounge space. Daily workshops and special offering to wet your palette and tickle your fancy.
landmark: Vertical Yellow "ORGANIC" Flags

name: Bioluminati (Bike Mutation)
description:
Unadorned cyclists beware-- The Style Enforcement Officers will be back in person in the dust to issue citations for kinetic-aesthetic violations! But fear not: the Bioluminati Bike Mutation Station - is THE destination for bicycle decoration and transformation. We gift all manner of non-moopagenic materials and accoutrements for mutating your mobile mount into something magnificent!  
We are open Monday through Friday from 11-4ish hosting interactive bike decorating activities.  We have a spray paint area, lots of duct tape, toys, dolls, barbies, non-moopy materials, all helping to make the playa a more fun and colorful place to be!
On Tuesday night, we will have a night bike DANCE PARTY!! with lights to decorate bikes and a DJ
On Saturday a.m. we will be having a bike mutation ride parade!
landmark: The Bioluminati Bike Mutation Signage

name: Mimosa
description: Hey you, yes you our dear friend! I know what you want, or I would say even need. A fresh, cold MIMOSA. Please step by our bar where we will get you what you need.
landmark: Mimosa sign on the front of the bar

name: DISCO LIPS
description: Snarky performance art by day, raging dance parties by night. Stop by Disco Lips to enjoy chugging beats, flowing beverages, nonstop wisecracks, and even some random playground equipment thrown in for good measure!
landmark: Large blue Disco Lips sign

name: Black Rock Travel Agency
description: The Black Rock Travel Agency is a gang of pilots, aviation enthusiasts, and adventurers who come together every year to serve the airport village and its visitors located at the end of Point5. Yes, there is an airport! BRTA makes it just like you imagine a Burning Man Airport would be. A massive Starport pyramid structure with entertainment and bar underneath with 30 foot viewing platform above? Yes! A super yummy galley serving pancake breakfast and bbq? Yes! Facilitating scenic airplane flights for Burners? Of course! The Agents at the Black Rock Travel Agency are committed to burners having an experience only to be found at the best airport in the world. Start, continue or end your journey with us.
landmark: 30ft high Pyramid w/ dome/view platform on top.

name: Scarbutts Cafe
description:
Scarbutts Cafe is the leading megacorporate ass-spanking coffee shop on the playa.
Monday through Friday, 9-ish to Noon-ish, our chipper staff serve strong coffee and fantastic spankings to the groggy masses. Choose from a menu of spankings that range from mild to hot and heavy. After being served their spanking of choice by a friendly bar-assta, they are served a cup of coffee. We come with a sarcastic edge butt provide a warm, welcoming, atmosphere.
New for 2024! Exclusive, Scarbutts After Dark(tm)-brand coffee will be served at a number of after-sundown VIP events including a "Coffee Cocktail Happy Hour", "Midnight Coffee" and more! Wanna know exactly what and when happens After Dark(tm)? Then come visit our Cafe for the nightly schedule ass it becomes available.
landmark: illuminated 8-foot sign, reads "Scarbutts Cafe"

name: DinerTown
description: DinerTown is the home of a 1950's style, full service Diner with a burner-twist, run by a bunch of eclectic Canadians. We're open at a 1/4 too, with a full breakfast & lunch menu served with a side of love.
landmark: Large "Diner" sign hanging from the roof

name: Burn Scouts of America
landmark: Khaki Tent Structure, Burn Scouts signage, Oven

name: Corner Pocket
description: Billiards at Burning Man! Corner Pocket Camp is your Black Rock City Pool Hall. We have FULL SIZE TABLES! Come enjoy learning and playing up to five pool games: 8-ball, 9-ball, Cutthroat, 3-ball, and Goonball. We'll have tournaments with awesome prizes and FUNishments, as well as special events such as "Strip Pool" and "Heckle Pool". Also, DARTS!
landmark: 8 ball on top of a pool cue

name: Hot Noodz
landmark: Hot noods sign, blue semi truck, carnival games

name: Wanderer's Camp
description: Our camp is an oasis on the playa for the Wandering Burner who happens upon our camp and finds HUGS, ice-cold gin and tonic and hotdogs. Come by every afternoon from 3 -5 pm for a hotdog or veggie dog, a gin and tonic and enjoy the shade, great company and music
landmark: Yellow Wanderers Camp Sign

name: Vagabonds & Tagalongs
description: A camp for wanderers and wanderlust! Vags and Tags brings together an ever-expanding nationwide community of burners to co-create a space where everyone can feel at home. Come by and see for yourself why we've won the official BRC award for best friends on playa since 2012!
landmark: Dome, big colorfol canopy, and Vags & Tags signs

name: Body Shop
description: At the Body Shop, we believe bodies require regular maintenance. Our shop is a whimsical place where the worn down burner can relax their mind, refresh their body, and enjoy themselves for a bit before continuing on their journey. In the style of an auto-body repair shop, we are staffed with friendly mechanics ready to appraise, repair, and certify all of the bodies on the playa. Guests will enjoy a full gamut of traditional tune-ups reimagined for the human body: buffing, lubrication, oil change, painting, fueling, and waxing. We look forward to servicing you!
landmark: Sign marked "Body Shop" near the "wolf" geodome

name: HexMix
description: Come relax at HexMix and enjoy spa services as well as guided meditations and workshops on traditional Indian art forms.
landmark: Pink shade wings on the sides of carports

name: KashyyyK
description: Your favorite wookiees are back! Stop by our legendary Wookiee Bodega, open daily from 12-5PM. Modeled after a beloved NYC community bodega, it is a little convenience "store" for trinkets ranging from playa-essential (sunscreen, tampons, reusable water bottles)  to ostentatious indulgences (bedazzled jewelry, candy bars, decorative knick-knacks).
landmark: Stoop: stairs & doors. lights will read: KASHYYYK

name: Rancho Sparkle Pony
description: Find your stage at our venue, The Rubber Spur.  Contact us to hold an event, teach a workshop, learn how to run a theme camp, a world-class playa camp kitchen, learn how to operate an art car project!    Rancho Sparkle Pony is your home away from home at Playa BRC!
landmark: "Rancho Sparkle Pony" sign

name: Honkers Harbor
description:
Curious about what type of honker you are? We may just be the gaggle for you! Come find yourself at Honkers Harbor. A neighborhood sanctuary for all. 

We invite you to sit back and unwind under a canopy of fluttering fabrics and lights. Enjoy a hydrating refreshment or snow cone and tune into the mindful and eclectic sound. Find the inspiration you need to look up, reach out, and yearn for more. It is our pleasure to be part of your journey.
landmark: Neon Honkers Harbor sign out front

name: Iceberg Cowboys
description: We wrangle icebergs and ride 'em off into the desert
landmark: Giant Blue Icicles

name: Pretentious Fox
description: Our name may be Pretentious but we're a diverse, international crowd with an eclectic mix of personalities and playa offerings, including our Flying Fox swing-set, the Fox Hole Bar, Foxy Beats, and parties and self-improvement workshops galore. Come get Foxy with us.
landmark: Big swingset with turquoise aerial silk

name: Dickhead Camp
description: Camp Dickheadery is at your service providing shitty jokes, bazar drinks and all-around good times. We will be providing an interactive neighborhood bar with inappropriate reading material and creative art experiences such as learning how to draw a dick, or possibly boobs.
landmark: Camp Dickhead flag flown high

name: Combat Zone
description: If you're looking for the best late night food on the playa, come find us. We'll be serving hot noods and cold beats in our sexy tea lounge from 4-6am every night.
landmark: Sign: LIVE NOODS arrow pointing at a steaming bowl

name: Beats 'n Deets
description: Don't lose your shit when you lose your shit. Label it first at Beats 'n Deets. We make labels for all your stuff with a mug shot style photo with you and your camp details on it making it easy for people to return it to you or easy to find at lost and found. And it's a great souvenir. We are also home to AccaPlaya, a 6 piece jazz acapella singing group and Professor Dr Lumington and her Medicine Wagon to cure your ills. Come join us for drinks, specialised in NA drinks, in our circus tent with animated projections on the wall and some of the most underrated DJ's on the playa.
landmark: large circus tent and illuminated archway

name: BRC at BRC
description: Burner Rec Center at Black Rock City! Volleyball, Pickleball, Batting Cages, Corn hole, Tetherball and more...come battle it out on the court or cheer on the homies. ;)
landmark: big arch letters lit up BRC@BRC over entrance

name: KISS
description: KISS (Keep It Simple Sexy) is an experiential theme camp and non-profit co-created by a leadership team with backgrounds in experience design, community building and decades combined building theme camps on playa. We look forward to sustainable, organized, and artistic year together in 2024.
landmark: circular stage surrounded by shipping containers

name: Cozy Dinosaur
description:
a safe and cozy place to party, relax and meet new friends!

During the day, come escape the elements in our cozy shade structure where we'll be serving ice cold flavored seltzers.  Kick back on our comfy seats, take a moment to reflect, or listen in to one of our many workshops or lectures.  Introverts welcome!

Come by in the evening to grab a cold beer while you listen to music and dance at our nightly party.  Or hop on our art car - After Life - as we head out for sunset rides or catch us for one of our midnight lectures.
landmark: cozy Dino sign - it is extremely bright

name: Snark Bar
description: A Snarky experience awaits day or night, take a spin on the prize wheel if you dare! Our Dick n Ball pit awaits those that would prefer a cozy lightshow with a touch of nostalgia. Snark, shade, couches, a dome with hammocks and excellent drinks await dusty hot travelers of the day. WIFI Available - intermittently!
landmark: 4 Dusty Pale "slinky Alien" decorations

name: Camp Fellowmankind
description: Gourmet food and tasty drinks with live talented DJ. Drum n Bass and House.
landmark: 40x40 small stage next to a 60x50 shade structure

name: PlayaDough
description: Are you a burner hungry in body and in spirit? PlayaDough will treat you to delicious dumplings, vodka and unsafe doses of eastern european nihilism.
landmark: large dumpling neon sign

name: Ataraxia
description: Chill. Laugh. Dance.
landmark: Ataraxia sign in front of a large white tent

name: Brainiac
description: Brainiac Mutant Vehicle
landmark: Dual Purple Flags

name: Religious As Fuck
description: Camp Religious As Fuck provides decomodified and non-judgy Christian spiritual practice and hospitality.
landmark: Multicolored labyrinth & dome with Jesus images

name: Temple O'Flying Spaghetti Monster
description: We are a comfortable neighborhood pub with a-rockin' attitude and groovin' tunes. In honor of His Noodly Goodness, the Friendly Fire Bar will administer ice-cold libations for your mind, body, and spirit. We will also provide unofficial official playa weddings in His Noodly Goodness' Temple. Come learn about his Noodly Goodness, call almost anywhere in the world on "Talk to Mom" phone, or visit our giftorium. We also offer bad advice, favorable directions, and delicious conversations to invigorate and stimulate your mind. The Flying Spaghetti Monster welcomes all so stop by, be touched by His noodly appendage, stay awhile, and rest your dusty bum.
landmark: The Flying Spaghetti Monster on top of the bar.

name: Disco Ballz
description: Disco Ballz is your place to come for Disco Dancing the night away.  Don't miss our Big Thursday Night Disco Dance Party.  Come by for Coffee & Donuts or enjoy a drink at our Shitty Bar.
landmark: Shade Structure with DISCO BALLZ flags flying

name: Slutty Microphone
description: Camp Slutty Microphone provides an open mic stage that hosts guest live music performances 24/7. Our stage includes a shared keyboard, drum kit, guitar, and a few other instruments. Bands are welcome!
landmark: Large glowing microphone sign and fire barrel

name: Dreamery
description:
Dreamery is a camp to discover, share and experience dreams. It is an interactive space to read and write dreams and fantasies, happy or scary, random and crazy, sensual or sad.

What dream would you ask for if you could?
If you could go anywhere in a dream, where would it be?

At Dreamery, you might also meet someone special. You can see if you want to hang out for just a bit or maybe become lifelong soulmates.

Got any bad dreams you want to get rid of? Drop them to the Dreamery Alter to be ceremonially burned at The Temple Burn.

Have any happy dreams or exciting tales to tell? Jot them down in The Book of Dreams. Flip through the pages to discover stories and dreams from people from around the world, and you might even find new dreams to call your own.
landmark: DREAMERY roadsign, Star tent, Closed Eye flag

name: Deaf Granny's Kitchen
description: Deaf Granny inhabits a vintage 1950s kitchen,  serving up goodies (and some baddies) in an interactive improv performance art format.  Sit and learn about visual communication and the particular ways of being exemplified by Deaf people.  Lovingly and  humorously she will confront and break down your preconceived notions, drawing you in as a participant actively engaged in your own awakening.
landmark: 15 foot billboard and 1950s vintage kitchen stage

name: Camp EAT ME
description: Camp EAT ME is EXCITEMENT ACTION TEAM MAGICAL ENCAMPMENT. We are a tight-knit group of weirdos united around making life more playful. Our skills, interests, and attitudes vary wildly, but the one thing we all have in common is that we almost always say yes to your silly idea and encourage everyone to play with us.
landmark: Eat Me sign w/ blue & yellow curtains, pink carpet

name: Camp Scatter
description: CAMP SCATTER pays tribute to the all but forgotten Prince of Mayhem, Elvis' chimpanzee, SCATTER PRESLEY, who once reigned over GRACELAND with a bottle of Bourbon and an unbridled libido. This pampered CHIMP was draped in the finest studded jumpsuits and was known to be the life of the party. We celebrate our friendly furry fiend with daily shenanigans and nightly Elvis movies featuring the most unruly interruptions at our legendary BANANA HAMMOCK THEATER. Stop by and swing with us; grab a banana rum shot or an ice-cold beer and put your monkey feet up.
landmark: Large Shade structure with colorful hammocks

name: Beverly Grillz
description: The playa's home for exotic meats and wacky beatz. We believe in radical inclusion and invite you to participate in our love and nourishment.
landmark: Beverly Grillz Marquee Sign & Rainbow Umbrellas

name: Planned Playahood
description: We offer "second aid" services including contraceptives, pregnancy tests, and hygiene products and a Menstruation Station to help you stock up on your needs. Pay homage to Our Lady of the Shaven Beaver, where you can experience your playa rebirth. Visit our bar The Rusty Speculum for your daily speculum shot and themed cocktails, stop by our photo booth, climb our tower or use the couch swing, get a faux-scription from our camp 'doctors' for whatever ails you, or mix up your playa wardrobe at our costume exchange. Visit The Musuem of Dildonts (items you don't want to put in your body), or stop by for daily events, parties, DJs, a shaded dance floor that just won't quit. We have it all to Un-Fuck your Burn!
landmark: 20' tower, couch swing, woman giving birth mural

name: Reverbia
description:
Reverbia is an All Live Music Camp with 4 stages, including: The Radiance Dome (LED interactive) The Jam and Teahouse, Embassy Shad Stage, and Reverbia Main Stage. 
 Reverbia features Daily: Calm Inside (breathe, Stretch) ,Live Music Yoga in the Morning...Dance Workshops, Open Mic/ Songwriter Showcase, Concerts in the Shade, Reverbia  Classical Music Sunsets and Live Nights, The Reverbia Childrens' Hour, and Late Night Mini Radiance Dome, and Jam and Teahouse. Reverbia also features Dance Performances, including the Production Curiouser and Curiouser. Our Tribute to Lost Musicians honors musicians who passed away the previous year.
landmark: Reverbia Main Stage - 2 towers and lighting

name: Camp DIY
description: Camp DIY offers daily Agua Fresca (non-alcoholic) refreshments Monday to Friday of Burn Week. We also have crafty supplies for you to "Pimp Your Cup".
landmark: Camp DIY & Agua Fresca signs

name: HAVANA NIGHTS
description: Experience the essence of a vibrant Latin dance party infused with the relaxed vibe of Miami. Encircled by palm trees, our spacious, shaded dance floor beckons. Relax on our plush, elevated chill pads or sway in hammocks. Savor the night with bottomless, hand-muddled frozen mojitos served by attendants in traditional guayabera shirts as world-class DJs deliver an electrifying mix of Cuban and Latin rhythms. Immerse yourself in culture with daily dance lessons and indulge in complimentary cotton candy. For a touch of tradition, request cigars and fedoras. Join us on Thursday, from 10 PM to 3 AM, for the iconic 8TH ANNUAL HAVANA NIGHTS, the pinnacle of our week-long dance celebration.
landmark: Palm Trees, Flaming Cigar & 20-ft Lime Green Tent

name: Black Hole Literary Society
description:
COME PLAY!! Grow old, not up. By day rest in our shady lounge and hydrate, color, knit and talk. After dark, lose yourself in our 3-D black-light experience! Come flow to some vibey tunes, create a visual masterpiece on our Giant Lite Bright installation, and warm yourself at our campfire. Join us till late on Thursday night for 'Elvis Hour' around 8pm followed by
a night of music with words through the decades and psychedelic rock. Friday we welcome ALL for our annual Shabbat potluck at sundown - bring some food to share or simply come and enjoy! We dig high fives, interpretive dance, and hula hoops, meaningful conversation and (bad dad) jokes. WELCOME HOME! We've missed you. Let's play.
landmark: 30 ft LED wrapped flagpole and Giant Brite Lite

name: Space Cowboys
description:
Shakin Yo Business again on the Playa!

The cowgirls and cowboys are back yet again with their version of the Wild West. 

Travel the playa on the Martha - An Art Car with a personality. Martha < 3's you! An experience to the edge of the playa. 

Put on your best duds and enjoy your experience at the Space Cowboy Lounge where we barter, trade, howl, laugh, dance, and share liquid libations, music, and much, much more. Bring a bottle, a twelve-pack, or a bag or two of ice to make your lounge hours cool and comfortable. 

Be sure to join us for the Black Rock Hoe Down, a hidden party gem.
SOMEWHERE! A party that will be out of this world.
landmark: Shakin Yo Business - Best hidden gem on the playa.

name: Half Baked
description: Make Shrink-Art Jewelry (necklaces/pendants, earrings, keychains, bike tags, etc.) using our solar ovens. Tuesday-Saturday, Noon-2PM. All art supplies and solar ovens will be provided. Walk away with some cool, self-made swag, along with a greater understanding of the wonderful world of solar cooking. Come bake with us!!
landmark: HALF BAKED banner atop our shade structure

name: *cats
description: *cats is all about the immersive digital art experience - we gift a high-fidelity LED live visualscape, where we host a roster of visual and sound artists, with a bias towards experimental art forms. For the last few years *cats has been part of the BRC skyline on Esplanade.
landmark: LED domes covered in triangular lights， LED garden

name: Skyhorse Carousel
description: The Skyhorse Carousel is an amusement ride and a piece of art which celebrates human culture and cosmology from ancient and modern times, creating an experience with aspects of both art and play. The horses of the carousel are painted like figures from myth and legend that relate to the sky, bearing, guiding, and embodying the Sun, Moon, and stars for mortal civilization down below. You might spy one of the fiery steeds from Apollo's solar chariot, the Jade Rabbit in the Moon, or even the Paiute Bighorn who became the North Star. So come take a ride through the sky yourself, and recapture some of the magic and simple delight of childhood.
landmark: 15-horse carousel

name: Vertical Camp
description: A vertical celebration of intentional community and how a disparate collection of people from around the world, each bringing their skills and experience to create an exponentially more rewarding experience for each other, and a welcome home to those who happen upon us. We provide new perspective on our collective experience within Black Rock City and tools to bring that experience back into the default world.
landmark: 5 story scaffolding tower, lit with colored bulbs

name: Better With Butter
description: Butter my buns and call me a biscuit. Have you ever watched butter melt in a pan in anticipation? Spread a rather large chunk on toast? Avoided your high cholesterol to have it? Used it for something naughty? Whatever your relationship is with butter, we want to know.
landmark: Front porch with "Better with Butter" yellow sign

name: Camp Lost It!
description: Have you ever been lost, then found, then lost again? We are Camp Lost It! Through previous lives and iterations, we have arrived here, er, lost. Together in this space we will explore being lost and how it inevitably leads to better things. Try and find us!
landmark: 30x flags, CLIT! entrance archway, and circus tent

name: Burner Buddies
description: We are a relaxed LGBTQI+ camp known for issuing Gay Cards, throwing the Gay Conversion Party to 'turn' people gay, and Genital Printmaking based on a traditional Japanese technique.
landmark: Three colorful towers on the corner

name: Soju House
description: We bring a taste of Korea to Burning Man, with a soju bar, Korean calligraphy classes, and tea ceremonies.
landmark: A white Asian-style house with blue tile roof

name: F.U.Ego Stage Bar & Lounge
description: Camp Fuego hosts the F.U.EGO Bar, No Mercy Stage & VIP A/C Lounge, serving daily the playa's only bottomless ORGANIC SNOW CONES and hosting No Mercy karaoke parties, an open mic, and DJ'd dance parties. DJs and musicians welcomed to our stage! Choose any mixed drink, mocktail, spiked cone, cold craft beer or hard cider. No Mercy karaoke singers agree to be cut off at any time, for any reason, or no reason at all! A gong is standing by. Only truly amazing singers get to the end of a song. ALL PARTICIPANTS gain access to Fuego's VIP A/C Lounge! There you will sip top shelf booze in cool luxury. Look for Camp Fuego's namesake Art Installation, "Fuego", a life-sized stretched barbed-wire prancing HORSE with flame effects coming from her eyes and mane. Or lie in our coffin. And Eff Your Ego!
landmark: life-sized stretched barbed wire horse in front.

name: Children of Chaos
description: Children of Chaos, established in 2000, is returning to the playa!  Join our Gold Parade, stop by our conversation bar and have a drink and a chat!  Our campers hail from Reno, Portland, Seattle, San Francisco, Denver, and Houston.
landmark: Orange-interior bar, "Children of Chaos" banner

name: HELLVetica
description: HellVetica is a Burning Man camp that celebrates the power and potential of propane. Members of HellVetica are all passionate about engineering and design, and come from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences.
landmark: Big, orange flame effect

name: rEVOLUTION
description: rEVOLUTION is both a high energy camp and a chill camp.  We believe that through evolution, we can create a revolution.  We reserve the right to change, to be agents of change and to commit to the Burning Man principles each time we return after our revolution around the sun.  We offer food, beverages, healing through Gamma Breath Work and fun through dance.  West Coast Swing and Martinis.  Hot dogs and Gin & Tonic.  We feed your body, soul and sense of freedom.  There are no requirements to visit us, only the ability to participate, act on immediacy and be open to both revolution and evolution.
landmark: Two large Red and Yellow Flags lit at night

name: Prometheatrics
description: Bringing the gift of Fire to humanity since the dawn of time, Prometheatrics has been a fixture of Black Rock City's Esplanade since 2002 and hosts a fine interactive collection ready to surprise and delight you! Step inside the Tesseract to experience yourself as you truly are: infinite! Trace your face at our Self Portrait Studio and take home a masterpiece or shoot a selfie in Clesthyra's Eye. Enjoy a bounce on our Danpoline, enter the dream-space of the Infinitipi or admire the playa's colors through the radiant FrameBows. Join us for dusk and dawn spin jams on our mirrored stage, where there's a safety on duty and all wicks are welcome. We're honored to be a part of what makes our city magical, and eager to share what makes us shine!
landmark: Tripod of Aluminum I-beams w/ 4' Welded Steel Cube

name: Mah Na Mah Na
description:
LED Crown Workshop – Look gorgeous and make it easier for your friends to find you at night. Get your water bottle refilled.

Mouse Trap Roulette – Fuck your fingers. Test your luck my spinning the roulette and seeing whether your fingers get snapped by a loaded mouse trap. Get your water bottle refilled.
landmark: Flag w/ Mah Na Mah Na on it.

name: The Parlour Room
description: The Parlour Room is a classy-not-classy industrial Victorian lounge space welcoming all BRC citizens to come relax under the shade with a cool beverage during the morning and afternoon or chat the night's adventures fantastic around our fire pit in the wee hours.
landmark: Stop Sign with blinking red lights and chandeliers

name: Flock of Donkeys
description:
Come burn off that hangover and create a new one, you sparkly little donkey, and let's pretend we're ageless. Rock the day away on our life-size donkey, test your balance on two or four hooves on the balance beams, and take a spin on the pole.  The best place on the playa to be a real ass, and bring a friend to play with you!

Alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages served in the afternoon during our donkey shenanigans. 

Hoof it over and horse around or, in this case, come donkey around with our crew.
landmark: Rocking Donkey, "Flock of Donkeys" flag, UN bar

name: The Spanktuary
description: The Spanktuary is an immersive and inclusive camp dedicated to the exploration and celebration of the art of spanking within a consensual, respectful, and fun filled environment.  Our camp is a haven for enthusiasts of all experience levels, from the curious novice to the seasoned practitioner.  The Spanktuary offers a space where participants can delve into the multifaceted aspects of spanking.  We are committed to creating a safe, welcoming and judgment-free zone where individuals are encouraged to have fun as they explore their desires!  Equipped with various  accoutrements such as paddles, whips and bare hands,  participants can choose to spank or to be spanked. Have your spanking with bacon, whipped cream or a shot. A good time is in store for all! You will laugh your ass off!
landmark: large "Spanktuary" sign in front of our camp

name: Broken Compass
description: Lost at sea? On a boat without a paddle? Us too! Join Broken Compass for golden milk, workshops and more!
landmark: Dome draped in white cloth

name: UnPlug & Play
description: See you in the dust!
landmark: Big Black Tent

name: WHAT THE PIC?
description: Camp WHAT THE PIC? is where everyone is welcome and we will be taking 360 degree photos. All photos will be gifted instantly via wireless connection. Bring your friends, hang out, and take home a lasting memory of a 360 degree photo!
landmark: 10 foot wide Butterfly

name: Deep Ohm
description: Deep Ohm is a place for centered connection, friendship, and fun. We build large art, burn larger fires, and enjoy spending time in our cozy home on the playa. We are a mutant vehicle support camp for Burnie the Bonfire and we are focused on creating a safe space for anyone who is interested in learning design, engineering, and fabrication. Mistakes are celebrated because they are opportunities to grow. We also serve s'mores and jams around the campfire all night.
landmark: Deep Ohm sandwich board sign & Burnie the Bonfire

name: Fantastic Sams
description:
Camp Fantastic Sams serves breakfast during the week, cocktails in the afternoon, and drinks in the evening.  

We are LGBTQIA+ friendly, and look forward to seeing you at our camp. 

We also have a comfy cuddle puddle!
landmark: Big Fantastic Sams sign, and the big wedding tent

name: U.F.O.
landmark: UFO sign in "living room" and purple lighting

name: Penny Smashing Point
description: Our custom pressed penny machine turns ordinary pennies into unique BM souvenirs.
landmark: Shining dome structure

name: Mycodelic Forest
description:
We are a mycologically based theme camp located in the 3 O clock sector. We love mushrooms and all fungus related things!
Like the mycelium that connects the roots of the forest, the Mycodelic Forest serves to connect the humans that pass through it.
Come sit in our shade and have a cold home brew beer while listening to a wide variety of music. You may learn something!
landmark: Look for the Mushroom themed archway with our name

name: Hushville
description: A welcoming camp with no amplified music or generators. First time burners greeted with joy and mentored with care. We welcome campers from across the world and beyond. We've had people from every continent camp with us in the past. Many activities all week long.
landmark: "Welcome To Hushville" Sign

name: Guano Loco Lounge
description: We are a sanctuary for those who embrace the mystique of the winged wonders that navigate the darkness. Take a break from the stimulation of BRC with a visit to our Bat Cave, a sensory deprivation experience featuring sound blocking headphones and inversion tables inside a cooling cave environment. “Hang out” in our lounge equipped with surround sound, moody lighting, craft cocktails for 21+ burners, and a variety of NA beverages. We encourage a sense of unity and Radical Inclusion. Sane or Bat Shit Crazy, with wings or without, it doesn’t matter to us. All creatures are welcome in our colony.
landmark: Lit up Guano Loco Lounge sign and Bat flag

name: Edna's Oasis
description: Edna's Oasis, where the elephants instinctively flock like the bassheads of capastrano
landmark: Illuminated sign, "Edna's Oasis"...and an elephant

name: Graham's Group of Adventurers
landmark: Psychic Taxi EYE sign high above camp

name: Crepiphany
description: The Crepiphany café offers a typical Parisian-style experience with chef-cooked crêpes and puzzles.
landmark: Pink neon "Crêpiphany" sign

name: Plaisance
description: Plaisance: a joyful pleasantness which captures the spirit of frenchness and fake-frenchness. Our French toast and Iced glace are examples of our events. Come by early for French Press coffee, or relax on our shaded veranda with lemonade and iced tea.
landmark: White veranda  and two White Cabanas in front

name: Playground
description: Playground is an oasis for the intrepid burner crossing the vast expanse of BRC. Filled with sights, sounds and music, Playground will entrance and delight with fun, fire and dance!
landmark: A large sound stage with eight fiery towers.

name: Banana Hammocks
description:
Banana Hammocks is back with 1000000000% more sex-a-PEEL
Relax and chill on one of our many hammocks, enjoy the relaxing beats of our DJs. Hydrate yourself at our Hydration station or lose your inhibitions at our DE-hydration station. 
Hop our our Art Car! The Dusty Busty!
landmark: Yellow Flags, yellow hammocks

name: Burning Globe
landmark: Burning Globe Sign!

name: Emergency
description: Emergency is a Burning Man camp that embodies the ethos of self-expression, communal living, and radical self-reliance. The camp is a vibrant and inclusive community that fosters creativity and encourages its members to embrace their unique identities. The camp's central gathering space provides an area for participants to connect, relax, and engage in creative pursuits. From sunrise yoga sessions to late-night dance parties, Emergency offers a dynamic and welcoming environment for all who seek to explore the boundaries of self-expression and community.
landmark: 40x50' beige military shade. & Camp name sign

name: Brulee
description: A Brûlée Tea Party.

name: Big Ding Energy
description: Big Ding Energy has finally made it to the Playa to provide wind wing lessons to the citizens of Black Rock City. We couldn't find a truck big enough to bring a lake but learning how to wing on a variety of wheeled vehicles is going to be just good enough. Love speed and adrenaline? Hate having skin on your knees? Come on by for daily wing lessons and bacon grilled cheese. Stretching and warmups will be provided so come by early and make sure your fit and ready to rip!
landmark: Wind Wings hanging out front

name: Mary's Little Lambs
description: Marys Little Lambs (MLL) is a Burning Man theme camp that embodies a vibrant, queer, and international community. The camp thrives on its welcoming atmosphere, where wit, fun, care, community, and duty intertwine seamlessly to elevate our collective experience before, during, and after the Burn. With an inclusive ethos, it embraces individuals from various backgrounds, making everyone feel like part of the flock. The camp exudes a sense of warmth akin to a lamb's gentle nature, fostering an environment where diversity and community flourish under the Black Rock sun and amidst the fiery essence of Burning Man.
landmark: Large Marys Little Lambs sign in pink neon

name: Camp Safari
description: Determine your fate with a spin of the Safari Wheel. Photo ops, animal hunts, and other dusty games
landmark: Lions & Giraffes, Camp Safari & Safari Bar Signage

name: Gauchos del Fuego
description:
Gauchos del Fuego, the home to Argentinean burners in BRC since 2014. Come by to enjoy some mates in the morning and may be you might end up taking your own mate kit home.

We are also home of Fuego Austral, our regional burn. We'll have information and postcards for you to take home about the only regional burn in Latin America.

On Thursday show your Gaucho's skills at the Guacho Partuza, a Pampa's Rodeo BRC Style and the Alpha Whore competition.
landmark: Large Argentinean flag,

name: Professional Hippies
landmark: Wooden Booth with "Professional Hippies" sign

name: Parched Albatross Hookah & Bar
description: Parched Albatross Hookah Lounge and Bar
landmark: Blue Shade Structure w/ Parched Albatross sign

name: Astral Headwash
description: Washing your dusty heads since 1998. Missed you and can't wait to hug you again! After all, the best hugs are wet hair hugs.
landmark: Purple Astral Headwash sign, 8' tall water towers

name: CrazyCamera & Christmas Every Day
description: CrazyCamera & Christmas Every Day is where you can make crazy picture, burn the wooden frame for it and celebrate Christmass
landmark: Crazy Camera sign on an 11' surfboard

name: Guerrilla Cheese Camp
